It was action packed, cinematography was good as was costume. I'm surprised at the low score, Ive seen lots of other movies with higher scores and they have not been nearly as entertaining. I often wonder if the scores are predominantly made by men on this app and they probably would score low as it would not have been gory enough for them and it had a female strong cast. Not enough women taking the time to rate, or maybe I'm generalising. Oh well, I really enjoyed it.

title: BROWN GETTING HER DRAGON ON...!
text: 1981's Dragonslayer, Matthew Robbins' tale of a knight battling it out w/a dragon now gets a gender swapped treatment in this current Netflix original release starring Millie Bobby Brown. Brown's hand has been promised in marriage to the scion, Nick Robinson, of a neighboring & more affluent kingdom negotiated by the machinations of Robinson's queen mum, Robin Wright & Brown's king, Ray Winstone (nice to see you again!) even though Brown's stepmum, Oscar nominee Angela Bassett, has doubts about the union (being done since their own kingdom is in dire financial straits) yet Brown's younger sis, Brooke Carter, is all for it. Upon the final wedding vow (where slit palms & comingling blood seal the deal), Brown is tossed from a precipice into a series of caves where she awaits her fate to be food for the beast as a talking dragon, voiced by Oscar nominee Shohreh Aghdashloo, makes her case to be fed (we've witnessed in the film's opening salvo a king & his men tried killing her but not before destroying a trio of her eggs). Brown realizing her situation (& surrounded by victims that didn't make the grade) sets off on a lengthy battle between her & the fire breathing monster where all truths will be exposed & Brown can save her own hide in the process. Brown smartly continues to enrich her relationship w/Netflix by picking savvy projects which fit nicely into the persona she's cultivating (I wouldn't be surprised if a third installment of her Enola Holmes series is announced soon) where she wisely tapped into a genre which is very popular but not something which apes something else (like the glut of big screen fairy tales like Snow White & the Huntsman & Mirror, Mirror from a few years ago) making Brown's prospects rosy for some time to come.

title: Ok(ish) but very perdictable!
text: Watched this with the other half, she fell asleep after the first 45 mins which isn't bad for her!The plot was very paper thin also very predictable. Could see the ending before we even got to the dragon also the reasoning behind why the dragon wanted sacrifices! It was mildly entertaining. Although typically it showed all the men as either weak and timid from the original king to the current one who says nothing, to the prince who is a coward to Ray Winstone's character who has an extremely weak part in this film being a bad father, but it shows all the women bad or good in a strong dominant roll... just another one of those films that are ruined by misandry for the sake of elevating the female characters! The bit I did like was the cat and mouse part of the dragon and princess in the caves! Although the size of the dragon changes throughout which really makes it loose perspective. Though the voice of the dragon was very well cast done by the same actress who played Gozer in Ghostbusters afterlife!

title: Worth the watch.
text: Excellent CGI. Excellent cinimaphotography - there are half a dozen shots where the blocking is really supurb. And Better dragon than The Hobbit. Excellent dragon fire. Very good acting. A bit "girl boss" - but no more than "superman" is boy boss. The world building and logic of action is very much "hey here's a fantasy drama to watch".. it isn't The Godfather. As good in terms of fantasy entertainment as Malificent, or the Narnia movies. The ending is a little unrealistic though.I don't think it's should spawn a series, but I wouldn't be surprised if it does in today's age, and there is certainly an opening left for that.

title: Pretty good, could've been better
text: Damsel, the new fantasy action movie starring Millie Bobby Brown, is now streaming on Netflix. My wife and I watched this over the weekend and I would classify it as perfectly fine. That is to say that I did not think it was good or bad, but more just forgettable. I do not regret seeing it, but I will most likely never see or think about it again after I finish this review.Like I said, I did not think that this was a bad movie. I have enjoyed everything that Millie Bobby Brown has been in (minus perhaps Godzilla: King of Monsters) and she delivered a perfectly fine performance, as did her costars Robin Wright, Ray Winstone, and Angela Bassett. The movie follows Elodie (Bobby Brown) who is tricked into marrying into a family of monarchs who use her as bait to settle a debt with a dragon. It is a cool story that focuses on themes of class revenge.So far, everyone I have talked to about this film enjoyed it. I wish that I liked it more, but as I said, I felt that it was just ok. I recommend giving it a shot on Netflix.

title: Survive the first 30 minutes of the film and it will get enjoyable and fun.
text: Most people knowMillie Bobby Brown from her role as Eleven from the Netflix series Stranger Things. Later she also played in the Netflix productions of Elona Holmes and played in the unspokably bad Godzilla II: King of Monsters. The titles mentioned don't immediately make me eager to watch Damsel, but the trailer decided to do it anyway. Next to Brown, we see Robin Wright as evil queen Isabelle and Angela Bassett as Lady Bayford, Elodie's stepmother. The direction is in the hands of Juan Carlos Fresnadillo who also directed 28 Weeks Later and did so not undeservedly after Danny Boyles 28 Days Later. Throw a budget of a sloppy seventy million dollars and you should really have a good base to make a nice movie. Well, unfortunately that is not often the case with Netflix productions. In fact, I think there are only a handful of really good films made from the Netflix stable, which do a lot better in the field of series.Fortunately, that is not the case with this film. Despite a lot of negative criticism of this film, I don't really understand that, because Damsel has become an old-fashioned fun adventure. Still, the film needed half an hour of start-up time, where I even considered turning off the film after 20 minutes. This was more because there is a large prince and princess content that you normally get to see in sweet royal comedies. Fortunately, that's just working towards something, because after this half hour the film comes off well. When Elodie is thrown into the dragon's den, it will take a while before we get to see the dragon. Perhaps the dragon could have been a bit more imposing, but the dragon's fire spitting has been well thought out. It's not a normal fire, but when the fire hits things it turns into a kind of lava-like substance, so that when the dragon spits fire you can't hide almost anywhere.The film has a neat playing time of an hour and 45 minutes and that is a perfect film length for a film like this. It all shouldn't have lasted any longer, giving the film a good balance. Elodie is the great heroine of the story and when it finally becomes clear how the fork really seems to be in the stem, Elodie swears revenge and that leads to the final fight between Elodie and the dragon and that can be called quite exciting. Perhaps the film is just a little too exciting for too young viewers and there are a few pieces in it so that the film has rightly received age advice of 12 years and older. If you want to watch this with younger offspring, it is advisable to check the film yourself in advance whether it is possible.Damsel has finally become a good Netflix production for young and old. Millie Bobby Brown plays the tough damsel Elodie who has to take on a dragon and escape from his cave. The effects are very beautiful, where it is mainly the fire spitting of the dragon that is very nicely animated. The dragon itself might have been a little more imposing, but good. If you make a movie this way, it's a little thing to take for granted. These kinds of films were actually made on a large scale in the eighties and nineties for the last time, then dragon films went a bit in a different direction, which is why Damsel is a welcome surprise where you will have a very entertaining evening when you go to watch it.

title: visually beautiful, simple plot without positive or special features
text: Unfortunately, the colorful fairy tale world of Damsel cannot hide the fact that the plot is quite simple and things like character development or even exciting characters are completely missing. There are also mistakes and inconsistencies in the staging. Cinematically, the whole thing is rather mediocre. Nevertheless, the movie doesn't manage to be completely boring - which is probably also due to Millie Bobby Brown's good performance. Conclusion: not really good, but not really bad either ... at least visually splendid and therefore worth seeing. Last but not least, I wouldn't call it a fantasy movie. It's a fairy tale movie ... but a little too brutal for children.

title: Did They Lose a Bet?
text: Watching this movie feels like seeing top-notch actors wondering how they got tricked into this mess. It's almost embarrassing. You get the feeling they signed on thinking this script had potential. Spoiler: it didn't. The result is a movie so awkward, you can't help but cringe.Millie Bobby Brown's character somehow looks better as the movie drags on, defying any sense of logic.Demsel is a mystery. Not the plot, but how it managed to pull in such a great cast for such a questionable ride. It's a film you watch and think, "There must have been something good here once, right?" But if there was, it got lost along the way.

title: Slightly predictable in some parts, but very entertaining
text:
The Damsel must save herself! This is the truth that young princess Elodie must face when she is suddenly betrayed by the royal family she has married into; she's thrown into a creepy mountain, made to be sacrificed to an angry monster! However, she soon will discover, there is more to this beast, and sacrifice, than meets the eye...
I'm not quite sure where I may have seen them before, but there were parts of the writing that I found slightly predictable, as I suspect other reviewers of this movie may have noticed. However, everything else, was excellently beautiful!The performances were superb and splendid! Millie Bobby Brown does it again, as the damsel Elodie, first hopeful and naive, then scared and losing hope, then fierce and brave, as she fights for what she believes in! I also enjoyed Ray Winstone's, Angela Bassett's, and Robin Wright's performances as well, and I was also introduced to an Iranian and American actress for the first time, named Shohreh Aghdashloo, whom has a chilling, excellent voice role (won't go into those details, so as not to spoil anything)!Scenery and costumes were so lush, lavish, and stylish! So was the directing and cinematography; those elements of the movie mixed together beautifully with the scenery! I love how Elodie improvised with bits and scraps of her own dress to use to her advantage in the quest.Pacing was perfect, taking its time to gradually tell the story, while preparing for the thrilling climax.Overall, I enjoyed Damsel. Not exactly what I was thinking it would be, but a nicely crafted, moving adventure nonetheless, with thrills and chills to spare. I'd say you'll be entertained for sure.

title: Fun Fantasy Film
text: If you can't have fun watching a fantasy movie staring Millie Bobbie Brown going against a dragon voiced by Avasarala herself, Shohreh Aghdashloo, than I don't know what to tell you. I kept waiting for the Dragon to yell Holden! Anyway, this was a well made movie with a fantastic crew at the helm. The production values were excellent and it looked great in Dolby Vision and sounded great in Atmos. The effects also looked great. The story was a lot darker than I thought it would be. A warning for younger kids. But I didn't mind the darker tone. At the end of the day it's a Damsel against a dragon fantasy film. If you're looking for plot holes and such and can't check enjoy yourself for a couple of hours...oh well.

title: Wow. Bad Stuff
text: 'Damsel' is bad stuff.It's a fairy tale turned on its head: the poor girl marries the handsome prince and it's then that her troubles begin. Which by itself isn't a bad premise. Imagine if this were a comedy during which the new princess is confronted by her husband's crazy family; so crazy that in the end she decides to return to her poverty in the proverbial pumpkin.Alas, this isn't intended to be funny. Instead, we've got a dragon that speaks human language and, equally important, understands it as well. We've got an underground cavern which as though by miracle turns into a sky-high precipice. An evil queen. A weak-kneed prince. A guy in a bad toupee and a crown who I assume is the king but does not have a single word of dialogue. We've got important plot points that are, for no good reason, withheld from the viewer.On the plus side: The dragon flies real nice.Milly Bobby Brown is our heroine 'princess' and I guess she's OK in the role, though I doubt this film is going to do her any good. I have a hunch that there hasn't been a lot of film offers coming her way and so when this one did, she took it. Which does not explain Robin Wright accepting the role as evil queen, or Ray Winstone as the princess' scheming father. These are established talents. They have reputations. Both of which are now sullied. Finally, Angela Bassett as a good-hearted step-mother (as opposed to the tried-and-true evil step-mother); she's fine. I guess.Confession: I watched the entire silly thing.Confession #2: And I'm absolutely ashamed of myself.

title: a dragon that speaks. in english!
text: I like well made pulp cinema better than the next mediocre high brow arty farty movie, so yes I liked it although the story is very simple.The point of the story (sacrifing women to a dragon or a husband) could have been more elaborated. It was great to see how the Stranger things actress has grown up from a child to a woman. The talking dragon ruined for me, I mean. Dragonheart was great, but at least it was Sean Connery's voice.Also, typically Netflix the movie lacks real violency and gore as you would expect when people get killed by a dragon.I watched this in my home cinema but I would want to spend money on it in a theatre.

title: Decent Movie For Lunch or Brake
text: This movie quit decent to watch when you need a movie to watch over a lunch brake or a solo dinner.The story line is clean, not to hard to catch. The cast was pretty good playing there role. But it didn't have any special feature. But i must say that the cgi is pretty good and solid, even though there not to many action in the movie.I try to find something special to put in this review for the movie but can find any. But after all when you need a movie just to a-company you while waiting something or enjoy your brake this would be the movie i recommended to you.Thank you so much for reading this very usual review.

title: Ripping medieval fantasy fairytale yarn featuring cinema's most impressive dragon to date
text: In medieval fantasy fairytale "Damsel" princess Millie Bobby Brown saves her impoverished nation by being dowried off by dad Ray Winstone & stepmum Angela Bassett to Robin Wright's rich distant kingdom, there to wed handsome prince Nick Robinson (good)... but all is not as it may seem, and a brutal adventure ensues featuring cinema's most impressive & fearsome dragon to date (for which props go to director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo). Dan Mazeau's screenplay does get rather repetitive, and Brown & Winstone's performances are far from their best, but this is still an impressive entry to the genre - especially with THAT incredible dragon. A ripping girls-own yarn indeed.

title: A one sentence story
text:
It looks like a big budget movie? I would prefer to see a unbelievable story seem conceivable. Something to kind of draw you in, and keep you watching. That never happened. This is the worse big budget movie I have ever seen. The two stars is only because it is possible their can be something worse in the future. Nothing against Millie,
Anola was super witty, as was stranger things.This is a lemon. Imagine Conan the barbarian, now imagine it with Millie Bobby as Conan. Imagine Rambo but
Millie is Mammbo. Now Imagine the terminator, but they used pee wee Herman as Sara Connor. Now imagine a role that no matter who, you cast it is doomed no matter who you place there. I guessing this was written and produced by gptchat.

title: Not bad but not great
text: Definitely not the worst movie I've ever seen. You can tell their budget went into the locations and special effects. The set is absolutely beautiful, the costume design, the landscape, so well done. It is visually, a very cool and beautiful movie.That being said, the overall story was just ok. Millie just did a lot of...panting and grunting the whole time.One thing that bugs me about these shows is when they have a woman in obvious distress and this crazy ordeal of FIGHTING A DRAGON in a cave, and yet she somehow is wearing a perfect smokey eye and lipgloss? No...I hate when movies/shows do this because it's not only unrealistic but they clearly are just trying to give the audience something pretty to look at, which makes it more about the objectification of the woman and less about the story and what's happening.I'd say a 6 is about what it deserves.

title: A film made as a cash grab on the under-12s.
text: Simply, rubbish.It's not often I watch. Film with no redeeming features but this is one of them.It is a glitzy mish-mash of tired old tropes led by a 'damsel' who is equal parts olympic athlete, warrior, engineer and fire-proof.We have so much CGI it should have been made as an animated feature. At least then the acting would have been better.And speaking of acting. There is very little, probably the best by Robyn Wright but I think that might be from habit and not direction.The lead is very poor, from fluctuating accent to performance, some of which i will put down to having to 'act' in front of a green screen while looking at a broom.This is an unabashed cash grab from youngsters pestering parents for pay-to-view. Everyone involved should be ashamed for cashing the cheque and giving nothing in return.

title: "Damsel (2024): A Captivating Tale of Sacrifice and Superb Acting by Millie Bobby Brown"
text: "Damsel(2024)" captivates with its intriguing premise and captivating storytelling. The film weaves a tale of sacrifice and duty as a dutiful damsel finds herself entangled in a royal family's ancient debt. Millie Bobby Brown delivers a stellar performance, effortlessly portraying the complexities of her character with grace and conviction. Her acting shines, adding depth and emotion to every scene. With its compelling narrative and standout performances, "Damsel" is a must-watch for fans of fantasy and drama alike. Overall, "Damsel (2024)" is a triumph of storytelling and filmmaking, anchored by Millie Bobby Brown's stunning performance. With its gripping narrative, standout performances, and exquisite craftsmanship, it's a cinematic masterpiece that demands to be seen.

title: ENTERTAINING AND MAGICAL
text: I must say I was a surprised to find myself really enjoying this thrilling ride with Millie Bobby Brown. It felt like an old school fantasy adventure flick with a femme fatale protagonist, only this one was fiercer. She really embodies a true heroine in every character she plays, and this one was probably one of her bests. The plot and story was a bit disturbing and shocking to watch, which I really liked because it added a certain depth and maturity to the whole film. The antagonist was also decent in her portrayal. The entire film was a whole vibe, and the production design was one of the most enjoyable to watch.

title: Almost the same as brave
text: Slapping MBB as the lead it'll definitely get viewerships but not an original, it's more of the same as BRAVE, bit of lazy writing tbh but I guess it's a kids movie so not much appeal to older audiences but I guess you can not please or target every one, if you are young female who loves a feel good movie and wants relate this is definitely for you, I am 30 yr man just watched it to kill time as iv seen just about everything that appeals to me I can say it is worth a watch on a Friday night if you've sent about 20 minutes flicking through the Netflix catalog, definitely will forget about it tomorrow morning. But have it a 5 star as it could of been a bit gory and better storyline with the dragon side of things but I guess they are running out of ideas..

title: With Lipgloss against dragons
text:
A visually stunning film that Netflix offers here, with an interesting and entertaining plot. On the other hand, the costumed actors with their lip gloss and powdered faces aren't quite what I expected. BUT: I was positively surprised by Millie Bobby Brown's portrayal of the main character Elodie, who delivers a convincing one-woman show. All the other actors seem rather weak next to her. Millie Bobby Brown manages to make the most of the scenes despite the weak script. But sometimes you forget that it takes more than a strong woman who can save herself. There is a lack of character depth. It can't just be about a woman being able to save herself - we're starting to know that. Why should you still watch the film? Because it has strong images, strong acting, a great twist and a fighting action heroine with a huge dragon. In the end it is a film
A mixture of fairytale kitsch and survival.

title: Enjoyed it..
text: As is obvious from the trailers... a princess from a kingdom that is in dire conditions is offered a way out for her kingdom by marriage to a prince. What is the catch you say? Well, good on them they mostly say that but can't find anything obvious so...Princess Elodie goes through with the marriage and, sadly, is immediately taken out to be sacrificed to a dragon. That is cold. The only thing I didn't like is that much of the section dealing with how she survives is a little too long and, in some parts, unbelievable. But most of it is stronger and more intelligent than I was expecting. For example, she doesn't just magically survive... all the other girls have written information on the walls of the cave so that each girl has more information to survive. It ends in a manner that I wanted it to and is overall smart enough not to have me turn off.

title: [6.8] Winning (taming) a dragon's heart - MBB mode
text: To some dear viewers, wanna stick to the trailer impression, then just watch trailer(s). I, for one, rarely watch any trailer cause it's pointless, I always love the feel and freshness of a new, unknown production.As much as I like Millie Bobby Brown acting, since Enola Holmes and her lovely self-made executive producer business! , she seems to be stuck in a loop of dreamy, prisoner-of-her-own-mind productions that she won't get free anytime soon as "predicted".'Damsel' is entertaining, lovely, thrilling, with hearts and messages for teens. Is that what you seek Millie? Lovely average beautiful heartwarming productions? If yes, then you're on the right path.You're old enough now, think for a moment to expand your "library" with crime, drama, mysteries with pinches and mixes of sci-fi & fantasy. Think of an adult, deeper version of 'Stranger Things' , you'll be successful 100 times more.Make up your own crime drama mystery series with horrific touches of realism. Remember 2014 and 'Intruders' , to this day I remember it as your best early play, do it again and alike, now that you're 20 and a mighty "princess" soon to be "queen"...P. S. A special, kind note to the beautiful and talented Robin Wright who too seems to be stuck in a production loop with queens, princesses and warriors. Mrs Wright, be the next Madame Web and get rid of your repetitive "crown".

title: Awful
text: They filmed a big portion of their film in a cave, its like 80% to 90% of the movie takes place in a cave, at one point you will realize the movie is done and you have seen nothing. American actors speaking a fake British accent and not being fluent, a horrible script. The advantages are, good acting, good special effects and good cgi, good lighting, very good color grading. The set was nice, the locations were great, the makeup was okey, the outfits were fabulous. In conclusion, I recommend all of you not to watch this movie I repeat do not watch this movie because its a waste of time and a waste of energy.

title: Perfectly adequate fantasy action with strong female lead.
text: Action fantasy is one of those genres where films are relentlessly pumped out, so much so that many of them completely pass you by unnoticed. Damsel is, in my view, comfortably above average, but its real benefit is in the lead actor/character.Millie Bobby Brown in Damsel is a very capable actor, but I think she is a bit let down by the directing and the script. Strong female leads in these films (who aren't horrendously over sexualised) are lacking, and she does a damn fine job of addressing some of that gap. Her role was definitely the best thing about the whole film in my view. The soundtrack is a close second.There are quite a lot of downsides, though. The plot is fairly flimsy and its changes in pace can be odd. I don't think production really knew who they wanted their audience to be. It's a bit too mature in themes for some younger viewers, but also lacking in depth for older viewers.If the intention was for a non-challenging, female-led fantasy action with the propensity for a wide-ish market then those boxes have been ticked. It's ideal for passing a bit of a rainy afternoon or evening. But I don't recommend going out of your way to watch it, and I think few will find it memorable.

title: A paint-by-numbers misfire - more fatal than femme fatale!
text: Damsel, released on Netflix today is their latest partnership with actor Millie Bobbie Brown, having previously collaborated on the Enola Holmes movies (Not a fan of the first, but really liked the second) and also a relatively unknown project called Stranger Things. This latest fantasy-adventure offering yet again sees the 20 year old actor take centre stage.Millie Bobbie Brown (engaged to Jake Bongiovi, son of rock legend Jon Bon Jovi) plays Elodie, a princess married off to save a kingdom but at the potential cost of her own life. She is the damsel, but it is we the audience that is very much in distress, this was a terrible movie.Let's break it downStory and PlotThis laughably predictable fantasy-adventure written by Dan Manzeau who brought us such classics as Fast X (2023) and Clash of the Titans (2012) is stuffed with "Yawn - we've seen it before" plot points that leads to the inevitable conclusion. The biggest complaint is it just didn't feel real at any stage. Talk about low stakes, this had no stakes, There is a complete lack of tension which put this movie firmly into Sand Timer territory (See 4 Types of Movies at top of homepage). Despite all of Elodie's hardships and obstacles which includes being chased around a series of caverns in scenes pretty much ripped from The Hobbit: Desolation of Smaug (2013), you just know she is never really in danger, and that everything will be just fine in the end.CastMillie Bobbie Brown is a very good actress as is Robin Wright and Angela Bassett is an acting legend but the clunky stilted dialogue stunts the casts performances. The great Ray Winstone is staggeringly miscast and as a result along with the rest of his peers phones in his performance. What's more I just couldn't get over the fact it looked like actors just playing dress-up, it felt I was just watching a very bad pantomime.CGI and Look of the MovieWhat added to the story not feeling real, was the way the movie looked. Set sometime in the 17th-18th Century the look is way too clean, the locales and vista's are clearly CGI, the movie was most likely shot directly on a lot with backgrounds added in post. The reported production budget was $60-70 million so once you take away the salaries of the star heavy cast, that may have left precious little for anything else.ActionYou've seen it all before, heroine in danger, heroine escapes, she get's into more danger, and oh my god she escapes again...rinse wash repeat.Music and ScoreMusic was by David Fleming. It's a nice enough score but pretty run of the mill. Surprised to learn it was produced by Hans Zimmer.A paint-by-numbers misfire for both Netflix and Millie Bobby Brown. This desultory fantasy-adventure is more fatal than femme fatale.

title: For those who also enjoyed this film
text: I am writing this review out of obligation to the cast and crew who put it together. This was an extremely entertaining movie. The buildup in the beginning was cinematically beautiful enough to be immersive, and while I did not stop trying to guess exactly what was going on I did forget I was watching a movie. All characters actions and scripts were on point with what would be expected in the given situation. They also did a great job of constantly switching between a sense of wonder and horror. Its a shame that more people could not get past whatever tropes they thought were cliche' especially since there are not that many movies with smart and capable women such as this. Very strange double standard indeed.

title: Oh boy another horrid Netflix movie
text: You already know how horrible this movie is going to be before you even watch it. Anytime there is a female lead and a netflix movie you know the horrid bullshiet you're going to get. Im sick of these generic female led movies that netflix drops on us every single month. Millie Bobby Brown is very dull and makes a bad movie even worse.It the madame web except its releases by Netflix. This movie felt like it was created to cater to the ESG score. I barely made it through the movie and almost gave up multiple times.Its a cheesy movie that caters to every cliche known to man. I highly recommend not watching this terrible movie.

title: A watchable one-girl show
text: Damsel has one of the most unremarkable plots of the decade, but it can still be enjoyed as a Friday night movie thanks to a couple of redeeming factors:Otherwise the movie is quite bland: Music is extremely standard, plot has no element of surprise. Except for the main characters, all others are monodimensional, so their actor don't have the chance to deliver a interesting performance.I feel sorry for the actors and artists working for this movie, they had all the necessary means, I'm sure they also had decent scenarists, but as it's too often the case, overly-frivolous executives who must've toned the story down to nothingness.

title: Utterly abysmal
text: Truth be told I wasn't expecting much from this film. Thought at the most it might be at least entertaining.. Or considering what I've heard from Millie Bobby Brown, it could have been an angsty coming of age story. Something positive to honour feminists or those with more liberal sensibilities. Sadly not.The storytelling was some what lacking, from the start it felt like a take on the Grimms fairytales.. However it proved to be more confused, fumbling and failing to hit the mark it was obviously trying too hard to achieve..The characterisation and acting also fell short in this way, proving inconsistent. At first I thought it could be the writing but I was proven wrong but Browns performance. She gave what I believe to be her poorest role. And ended in a somewhat peculiar way. Feeling more like her telling the world 'I am now a women.' Leaving behind the childish image we have of her from Stranger Things.Despite the odd musing, I stand by my comments and say don't waste your time.

title: CAVE-DAMSEL-DRAGON key to the film. Predictable but enjoyable
text: The film is interesting because they have renewed the concept of the princess in danger, who always waits for a prince to save her. This is the way.In DAMSEL that I see reflected that essence of empowered woman with a judgment, logic and cunning. It is no coincidence that it will be released on Netflix on March 8, International Women's Day.The protagonist is not the typical heroine. She proves to have cunning, intelligence, a lot of intelligence and of course courage and heart. Millie Bobby Brown is perfect for the role of damsel in distress, used to perform action scenes, she plays it perfectly, although it is true that the role of fairytale princess before the cave does not suit her so much. Her characters always stand out above the rest, such as Eleven/Enola Holmes. Although in general it may seem a simple role, the interpretation she makes in several moments in the cave are very impressive, full of feelings and emotions that keep you fully involved in the plot.The rest of the characters contribute nothing or very little to the film. The movie is predictable, we could say that the movie starts from the moment the princess is thrown into the cave. And since it starts this is a joy or enjoyment for anyone who likes fantasy, adventure, dragons, heroism or epicness.CAVE-DAMSEL-DRAGON key to the film. I love the images, shots and scenes in the cave. The Dragoness has an incredible level of detail, her design is beastly, the textures and finishes look great, shape, color, plus she has an identity, voice and thought of her own.The development of the narrative around the protagonist seems interesting to me, the contributions of different discoveries in the cave shape the film and the construction of the story.Correct direction, good work, correct editing, good sound, soundtrack a little fair, it does not stand out too much. Good photography in the cave scenes. The VFX and special effects are well done. Scenery and setting in the cave is very good.FINAL NOTE 7 The film stays in the dragon, the cave and the damsel. The rest does not matter and almost detracts from the value of the film. As for the story it is simple, predictable, but enjoyable. It could have been so much more, but I enjoyed it and would watch it again.

title: This damsel should stay in distress
text: Damsel is a lifeless experience. The filmmakers have assembled all the constituent parts of an interesting fantasy adventure film - genre-bending premise, a starry cast, locations with character, and some creative creature design - but the connective tissue is paper-thin. A weak script and boring performances make the Netflix fantasy film Damsel a real slog, torpedoing its attempt to be a subversive spin on classic adventure tales. Any sense of wonder or magic is diluted by cheap-looking CGI and its overly repetitive action sequences. Rather than being any particular person's bright idea for a girlboss fantasy revenge caper, this lousy romp was obviously hatched by an algorithm, and might just as well have been directed by AI.My Rating : 3/10.

title: A "damsel in distress" film this is NOT
text: OK, I really liked this film. A lot. You can tell from very early on that Elodie, played by Millie Bobbie Brown, is not a damsel who will need rescuing. She's smart, tough, clever, charming, and very much her own person.While it does employ many of the tropes expected in this genre -- a dragon, people of questionable intent, myths & legends -- it does so with a much fresher take and direction. Brown is terrific in the role, and Robin Wright, as the queen of a neighboring kingdom, does a great turn as a (semi-spoiler here) really despicable character. Angela Basset is under-utilized, though, and really wasn't given as much for her talents to work with as I would have liked. Hers could have been a much more important character that was allowed to be here.There are some solid "Heck YEAH!" moments that are quite satisfying, especially as we see Elodie find ways out of her predicament.Definitely a fun flick.

title: Predicable and Trite
text: A silly fantasy story that was mediocre and a pleasant enough waste of time until the end. What the heck were they thinking with that ending? Who cut her hair in the cave? Was there a beauty shop in there. Hair and make up? A lot of make up for someone who has been fighting a dragon. Totally unacceptable for a production of this expense. Millie Bobbie Brown did a serviceable job but her acting reminded me of her efforts in Sherlock Holmes. Except there was no Henry Cavill to carry her. Predicable and trite. CGI was okay until the end and then it got bad. Did they run out of money? Netflix originals are originally bad these days.

title: Ironic Woman Power movie
text: The title is Damsel and so you already know this is meant to be a woman power movie. I have no issue with that.The movie itself is OK. It's not too bad.There are 2 obvious issues with this being a woman power movie.1. It is set in medieval times but the woman have makeup caked on their faces. I found that odd. I don't think they had makeup like that in those times and if you are making a woman power movie why all the makeup?2. The funniest or maybe saddest part of this woman power movie is that the way the main female character goes about to solve her predicament in the exact way that a man would. I'm not spoiling anything but it isn't until the very end that she finally does what a woman would have done from the very beginning.So, for an obvious woman power movie it was very weird.

title: Better than I expected
text: Some people seem to expect way too much from entertainment. This is a rather enjoyable flick that knows it's demographic. It's a young heroin stuck in a "Damsel in distress" situation that she's gotta save herself from. It was indeed rather predictable, and I did feel the first act kinda dragged on considering the previews really didn't try to hide it's big twist, they could've cut some of that and tacked more on the ending IMO. But Millie B, Bassett, Wright and... All the cast really. Nailed the material they were given. (Shohreh Aghdashloo especially was an absolutely genius choice for the voice).The CG work was fairly solid, but did have some slight dips if you're really looking for them, if that's going to be your dealbreaker that's a you problem. They were never so blatant that I couldn't get past them for the seconds they were there.This isn't an Oscar contender and at no point did I get the feeling it was trying to be. But if you've got a couple hours to kill and you and your kids (I would say 12+. That dragon was pretty spooky at times) like fantasy media. Give it a shot. If you're some lonely dude that's hoping they put Millie in a plate mail styled sports bra and spends the whole movie being sexy, you're not the demographic it's trying to please.

title: Not a bad film but not a great one either.
text: So the story is OK but there is little background to it. I felt rushed into "well here we are".There is no valid or real reason (other than political correctness) that the white King (Ray Winston) and his two white daughters are complimented vy Angela Basset as mother (step mother admittadly) but Angela seems to be there to tick a inclusivity box and sadly is wasted in the role.CGI is OK, the design of the dragon is OK but not attractive at all.My biggest gripe is the casting and "acting" of Millie Bobby Brown. She is miscast here plain and simple. Her English accent is Irritation, Spotty and of such a sound that its what an English accent sounds like from an American actor emulating a description of upper class English. Its TERRIBLE. She is wooden in this role...I mean solid. The tree she landed on in the pit was less stiff and board like. She oozes arrogance whilst supposedly the good, kind daughter of an empoverished father/King. Due to this her whole role feels phoned in. I honestly have ZERO idea why people rave over her as she is at best an average actor.8verall...its worth a watch if you want some escapism for a while, but don't expect miracles.

title: Uninteresting drivel
text: Title says it all. They should have allowed the dragon to burn the script.Millie Bobbie Brown spends more time screaming, grunting and whining than the dragon spends burning knights. Are Millie's talents wasted here or are there simply limited talents to showcase? Lots of other talented actors here wasting their own talents.And speaking of talent, where did they find that dragon?! I suppose the dragons from GOT had language in their contracts limiting their ability to work in similar productions for a specified period of time. A shame.No need to worry about spoilers here. I barely made it past halfway.

title: A 6.2 Rating is Not Accurate for this Unpredictable Story!
text: Tired of hashing out the same old story? I know I was. Here is an original fantasy that will entertain!As a passionate viewer and an avid consumer of entertainment, I felt compelled to share my thoughts about this unfair rating. Damsel is anything but ordinary. In fact, it was refreshingly unpredictable, a rarity in today's cinematic landscape dominated by formulaic plots and predictable endings.But it wasn't just the plot twists that kept me hooked; it was also the characters and the stellar performances by a wonderful cast that brought the story to life.As for the film's rating of 6.2 on IMDb, I couldn't disagree more. In my opinion, this arbitrary number fails to capture the essence and quality of the story. While I understand that tastes may vary, do not dismiss this story because it dares to be different in a long list of boring mainstream films.

title: Mid
text: This is a 6.5 or lower film. There is nothing that stood out for me but for some reason I did not hate it. Here is why I think this film is "Mid".First, the characters felt dull to me. Within the first 25 minutes, it went straight into the climax so we didn't get to see Elodie's character as much so I didn't really care what happened to her that much. By the end of the movie I didn't see a change in her at all and she felt like a side character.Second, the acting was sub-par. There was a lot of lines that I was cringing at. There is not much else to say.BUT, this was a super fun film and so I did enjoy watching it. ITs just not my favorite.Overall its just not the best. You may love it and that's great but its not for me. There is not much more to say about it at all.

title: Wasted potential
text:
Was really looking forward to this and set a reminder for its release date. MBB and Robin Wright are both actors I've enjoyed in the past so figured this would be a fun watch.The good:
-The costume design was stunning and I loved all the attention to detail. There are a few visually striking scenes that are fun to look at.-Robin Wright is a glamorous yet ruthless evil queen. Also Robin Wright can do no wrong so maybe I'm biased here.-The dragon VFX were pretty good in my opinion. At first I was taken back by the voice but it grew on me throughout the movie.-The premise is intrinsically interesting, and the setup was reasonably solidThe bad:
-Like I said, it's an interesting plot and started pretty strong and they could have done something really cool with it. Instead, it was annoyingly predictable and you can get the entire story from the trailer. Whatever you assume will happen...is what happens.-After MBB gets thrown into the chasm, there is a ridiculous amount of grunting and yelling. Like, she is trying to evade a dragon but literally every movement is followed by a tennis grunt lol. It was pretty distracting. I guess she did the best she could with what she was given, but there really should have been another factor added into this to prevent a good 30-45 minutes made up entirely of MBB grunting/talking to herself to steer the plot or the dragon speaking.Overall, it was still okay to watch. It isn't the worst thing I've ever seen. But definitely a letdown.

title: Damsel Not In Distress
text: Once again Millie Bobby Brown showed us her acting skill. She's an amazing actress, hopefully she'd stay that way through the coming years. Not letting herself swallowed by the dark side of Hollywood. Amen. Okay, back to the movie. A fair warning, Damsel is another feminist movie. So for those who DOESN'T LIKE watching women who can use their wits and courage to save the day, DON'T WATCH this movie. Cause we don't need another butthurt misogynistic pig spewing their toxic review on this movie. And for those who DO LIKE this kind of movies, then you must watch it. It's well acted, the plot is simple yet interesting. There's only a small plot twist, but still make a big difference to the story. The only thing I'd like to ask is, if the dragon can always attack the castle? Why didn't it do so when the first tragedy happened? Why make a pact? That's the only thing that I'm still having a hard time to take in. Cause it's so illogical. But then again, it's just a movie. Maybe I shouldn't think too hard. LOL.

title: NOOOO THEY SOLD THE ENDING
text: The story starts off with a decent build of suspense, nothing too fancy. Of course the plot twist was predictable as it's title suggest perhaps try making it a secret with its title making and thumbnail? Nevertheless, it started off as a petty survival between the dragon and Elodie. In retrospect, it was pretty good with its accurate depiction of what a dragon would be, but in the end, for some reason, all the budget seemed to disappear and you can literally hear the dialogue dissipate as well as the CGI. It ends with a classic badass ending or at least they tried to. Millie Bobby Brown really delivered but the writers sold the movie with the cringe dialogue and scenes in the conclusion. The movie was good but the ending sold it.

title: Diferent and over my spectations
text: I almost skipped it because I didn't feel like wasting my time at all with this one. But I stuck around just to watch another random fantasy movie, a kind of movies that are missing those days. I started watching this movie with out any spectation. My opinion didnt get much better after watching it, but lets say that it'is not that wast of time at all.You'll see something that reminds an a old argument but with something "original", quite predictable and with some holes in the story. Let say in favour that it's better than other fantasy princess movies.It's watchable, but not gonna watch it twice.

title: Felt forced, but still good for what it is
text: This is not a long movie, but it looked beautiful and moved fast enough. The actors were great and the story was good for how short it was. However, I do understand why the reviews are so split. You can immediately feel the political side of the movie while watching it. Girl power and diversity where for example every princess is from a different "race". I am usually all for it, but it should never feel forced, as a lot of movies have felt lately. But I decided to look past that for this movie since I did get more involved in the story than the forced elements within it. And by doing so, I really felt like the overall story, acting and CGI were above average and that's why I will give it a 7. A bit politically forced, but still a well crafted movie.

title: Please!... Stop Making Movies Like This.
text: I recently subjected myself to the cinematic catastrophe known as Damsel (2024), and let me tell you, it was an experience akin to watching paint dry on a medieval castle wall. If you're considering watching this film, I implore you to reconsider. In fact, I beg you: please stop making movies like this.The premise seemed promising-a damsel in distress, a dragon, and a royal wedding. But alas, the execution was more disastrous than a jousting match between blindfolded knights. Let's break it down:Weak Script: The dialogue felt like it was penned by a sleep-deprived squirrel with a typewriter. Characters spouted clichés and platitudes as if they were reading from a medieval fortune cookie. I half-expected someone to say, "May your quest be as fruitless as a banana tree in Antarctica."Boring Performances: Millie Bobby Brown, bless her heart, tried her best. But her portrayal of Elodie-the damsel who transforms into a makeshift MacGyver-was about as captivating as watching grass grow. Nick Robinson as Prince Henry was equally uninspiring. I've seen more chemistry between a rock and a moss-covered log.CGI Disaster: The dragon, supposedly menacing, looked like it escaped from a PlayStation 1 game.Repetitive Action Sequences: Elodie's escape attempts from the cavern were like Groundhog Day with a medieval twist. She'd dodge the dragon, sharpen her corset busk (yes, you read that right), and repeat. It was like watching a medieval version of "Wipeout," minus the water and the humor.Missed Opportunities: The film had potential to subvert fairy tale tropes. Instead, it clung to them like a barnacle on a shipwreck. The dress transformation scene hinted at something deeper, but alas, it remained as shallow as a puddle after a light drizzle.Damsel left me yearning for the sweet release of a dragon's fiery breath. If you're ever tempted to create a movie like this, I implore you: please, for the love of cinema, reconsider.

title: I can't fathom all the negative reviews
text: I truly can't understand what all the negative reviews are for.This movie is visually beautiful, has gorgeous attire, gorgeous CGI, a great cast, and what I found to be a very fresh plot that I hadn't quite seen before (and I've seen a lot of movies. I'm a stay at home mom with nothing but time on my hands in between doing the parenting thing).I adore Millie and Nick so I was excited even before starting the movie to get into it.The way Millies character stops at nothing to get her point across and break a centuries old awful tradition, and the moment karma comes back to those who wronged her, had me on the edge of the couch like YESSS GIRLLLL!Lol but seriously, if you've watched her since Stranger Things and cheered her on as she blossoms into an even more known and loved actress, this movie doesn't disappoint in her string of amazing characters.

title: It's as if AI learned how to make movies from watching 25,000 and cobbled this together!
text: I would say it was made for little kids, but then again, a horse and birds are killed in a horrifying matter not to mention the gory death of several characters, so no, I wouldn't let my kids watch this. Then I thought, perhaps it's a development of a hero's story where the protagonist must bear trials to come out stronger. We have the requisite caves; an ancient symbol of rebirth, magical beings which can heal (slugs), a fiery dragon, the symbol of a chthonic goddess embodying the Earth mother herself. However, the dialog is weak, the plot transparent, and the acting horrendous. So no, no deep delve into our ancient psyche, just a sorry excuse for filmmaking and a complete waste of time and resources.

title: Takes me back to good old basic fantasy
text: I was worried that this movie was going to be another Mary Jane eye roll flick. But instead I was rather pleased that we had an actual character with a hero's journey arc.So I do my best not to spoil so I will just give my rough synopsis.The plot was simple and reminded me of a sort I would have been seen in 70's and 80's. I felt the story did a more digestible young woman with a strong and witty personality and not a superiority complex. I'm better than everyone else. This was good because she was more relatable to a larger group of watchers.The pace of the film was just right for the story that was told.I rather liked the dragon, a quite menacing air and the CGI was good and flowed well with most of the scenes. A couple of obvious green screen moments. But considering it was a made for Netflix movie. It doesn't even really hinder the story.A couple of good actors and actresses helped give weight to the overall film. Good casting.I will say, if this movie was made in the 80's I would have had it along with my other classics like Conan, Dragonslayer and Beastmaster. I know some of you might not agree on those being good. That's fine. But still enjoy them.As this is not a remake or if it is I'm unfamiliar with the original. I was able to over look the funny new super diversity quota. It doesn't harm the story and it's a fantasy so you could have one of everyone. I usually only forehead slap when it's historical stories or if it just doesn't fit.That said, if you like dragons and a simple but decent fantasy plot.Sit back and enjoy.

title: The ending Daenerys deserved
text: I absolutely loved this film. I thought it was so well written and I disagree with the hate. People saying it was predictable, I don't think this was the point of the film. It wasn't made for it to be predicted, Damsel has a strong female protagonist who uses her survival instincts to keep herself safe and grounded in a life threatening situation, and I really admire that they wrote her so well. Elodie is a character to look up to, she has grace, charm and wit and I think the team on this film captured that well. It was not a film based solely about revenge which I thoroughly enjoyed, and it was nice to watch something that carried out a positive message with a positive ending that showed that people can change, and revenge is a dish best not served at all, and lies and deceit gets you nowhere.Idk, I thought it was great, made me cry and the ending was happy 😊

title: Why she talking like that?
text:
I don't know who was thinking what when they cast The Angela Bassett, but they got it wrong when they asked her to do an accent. It's just so strangely off and weird, like she's trying to do an English person's idea of an American Doing a Royal Family Accent. It's distracting. Not quite from the Dick Van Dyke School Of Accents, but it's not good.Luckily she's not in that much of the movie, the first 30 minutes or so.And that's when the film starts btw. You could fast forward the first 30 minutes, watch it on 4x speed and get a perfect idea of what's going on.The rest of the film gets progressively more predictable and clichéd from there.If I had to sum up this whole movie in a couple lines, I'd go with:
"That's a tough situation, gonna be hard for her to get out of that one"
"Actually super easy, barely an inconvenience"
"Oh really?"But I don't wish to spoiler anything.The cgi is meh.The green screening is, meh
the story is, meh
the action is ok in parts.A dull, mediocre and predictable movie that looks ok at times.

title: Why is everyone complaining?
text: Just watched the movie and it is actually a very nice fairytale about a princess, a dragon and some bad people to make it all as usual. It's had much less annoying feminist moments than 'Barbie', so I was fine with it. What did you expect- some kind of a deep storyline? No such thing can be found in a fairytale where the good always wins over the bad since Disney started changing Brothers Grimm tales. The effects were nice, the movie had dynamic, actors did a nice job. For me everyone who is super unhappy has to just go for another genre of movies altogether. It is a nice, family popcorn movie.

title: its much better than what i expected !
text: Movie is far from great but if you like fantasy worth watching as its not bad as it looks !Its a simple plot , and that's the main issue with movie its like they lack of ideas or rush to make the movie as i know could be much better !Really enjoyed it and it makes you think what can happen after if it has second part as it has potential !Effects of the movie are really good and the dragon its just brilliant.Acting on main characters is very good but it has some issues .I had a great time , watching it and recommending for all fantasy enthusiasts !!Fingers crossed for second part!!!

title: Quite good
text: I love a good fantasy story but I had no idea there would be such a compelling monster sacrifice element to this and found it thoroughly entertaining. I was pleased with Millie as the main character of Elodie. Her tenacity and resilience when faced with insurmountable and endless troubles was on point for a female led ensemble and it's comical that it lends to tongue in cheek on the damsel aspect because while she is in distress for the near duration of the movie save the first 20 minutes, she is not offered any sort of hero or rescuer and that makes it all the more entertaining. I'd recommend it to LoTR, DND, Dragonheart and Harry Potter fans.

title: This movie is the reason why Netflix shouldn't be allowed to raise prices anymore!
text: Netflix: We're raising prices to have better quality Movies.Also Netflix: We've released an absolute dog pile of a movie enjoy!Netflix should be embarrassed. This is also why I can't take Netflix seriously on it's price increases to "increase quality". This movie is unbelievably boring and dull. I kid you not I wanted to fall asleep the first 15-30 minutes of this movie and it's hard for that to happen to me. The Script writers/storytellers must of not been motivated when writing for this movie. I don't even know who in their right mind would even greenlight this at Netflix. Just Terrible. Netflix can't keep putting crud like this up anymore.

title: In Dis Dress
text: No pun intended - I think you can manage to combine the title and my summary line and get what I was aiming for without me having to mansplain it. I reckon I already said/explained too much. But if you thought I took too much time to get things started ... wait until you see the movie.The whole movie is carried by our main character. And while she is called a Damsel (in the title), she can handle herself quite well. Mostly dialog wise (and she is quick to say something back to you), but she also has the will to survive ... which I reckon is quite important.The numbers game (how many before her that is) is one thing - I am not sure it checks out, but then again, I really didn't care that much about it. The movie was quite obvious, even without having read anything about it before. So quite predictable - but it does look good. Also has too good actors in it.That said, the effects are good and the voice over from one actress in particular is quite special ... if you've seen movies with her, you will recognize the voice! Great casting choice once more.Good movie then, if you are into fantasy ... nothing more nothing less.

title: Latest guilty pleasure
text: Lets get the negativity first. The plot is paper thin but we don't watch these movies for plot. That being said this movie is pretty good for a netflix movie, better than many that comes out of netflix machine. It does look like a netflix movie though but the visuals are pretty good actually.This is a one woman show and Millie Bobby Brown is very impressive. She has proved she can carry a whole movie alone & she is very likable. Rest of the cast had nothing to do. Queen Angela deserved better. Robin Wright is playing the same character in the exact same way like it was played before her by many people (even her pointy crown is the same).I would say go for it. This is a good one time watch and fun ride if you are into fantasy.

title: OMD WHAT IS THIS?
text: Why is this hyped up? The CGI is so bad (other than the dragon that they obv put all their money on).The dialogue was so cringe, girl was in a cave talking to herself about things she can hear as if I cant hear it either.This is only hyped because its "progressive" and has a famous actress, waste of tiiiime.I was really hoping for a good fantasy film, i got a snooze fest.I really tried to like it. The plot was okay, i see the vision but damn was it poorly executed.So many scenes were pulled from great films like the Hobbit, and there was no development of any kind. Just her screaming for an hour.Netflix do better!

title: much better than expected. good watch
text: I expected a incredibly basic sexy smut fantasy fighting movie, low budget atomic blonde with dragons.Unfortunately there's no sex. But it made up for that with cool twists and turns that i didn't see coming inside the otherwise somewhat "generic" dragon fighting story.The character are a lot less shallow than i expected. And the special effects and art are MUCH better than i expected. Really good actually.GOT's CGI would constantly take me out of the series. The incredibly basic landscapes. The bad blending. Meanwhile here i was thinking to myself. Dang, this is filmed on a bluescreen huh. She isn't actually riding a dragon. This took me off guard. Didn't expect it to be this good.Honestly. If you're expecting an incredibly deep and meaningful fantasy story, it isn't it. But if you want an awesome story about a cool girl fighting a dragon, then definitely grab some popcorn.They created a landscape and made navigating it a core feature of the movie. There's decent worldbuilding too.I'd give it a 7,5 if it's allowed. It ain't cinema but it's a hella good watch and i didn't feel distracted or annoyed. Actually very much got into it.

title: Pleasantly surprising film
text: "Damsel" is a pleasantly surprising film with a dragon that is very realistic. Millie Brown resembles Scarlett Johansson and is just as beautiful and performance is great. The movie takes you on a captivating adventure full of tension and emotion. The visual effects are stunning, bringing the dragon to life in a way that leaves you breathless. Brown's acting talent shines through every scene, immersing you completely in the story. It's a must-see for fans of fantasy and adventure. The dynamic between the characters adds depth to the narrative, making it a truly unforgettable cinematic experience...

title: My fault)))
text: My fault)))I didn't go to deep into what's this film all about , just read slightly misrepresented genre , so fantasy / dragon and made a wrong decision to watch it ))) This is a good film , if it would be advertised like a fairy tale for children ))) Not as a fantasy movie ... Considering that it is a film for children , I still give it a 6 stars , just to acknowledge the fact that it is indeed a decent fairy tale style flick. Now , if I would take it more seriously , I would have to be more strict and probably give it about 4 stars ... Basically there is not much positive about this film ...

title: Action fantasy movie, but give her Kardashian type of makeup...?
text: It was a great story. I had fun watching it and I was very invested in the story. Great acting, storyline was exciting and scary at times. I will say that it was very predictable. I had not seen the trailer, but I could guess all the time what was going to happen.The costumes were amazing! And the action scenes too.The big problem I have with this movie is the makeup!!!! Why make an epic fantasy movie and make the main character look like a Kardashian did her makeup???? I could not get carried away by the story in parts of the movie. I just kept looking at the red lipgloss, countoring and eyeliner... while she's in the fight of her life, but she obviosly had time to freshen up her makeup.Look at Snow White and the Huntsman. At least she looked natural and like she was actually in the forest, fighting and in danger. You can make an actress look pretty without making her look like an influencer.Anyway, the ending was ok. All in all it was an entertaining movie and I enjoyed it, except for what I mentioned above.

title: intersting movie many questions
text: A new arrival in the platform on March this year, and it also seems to be on the top list of this period for Greece.In the start, you think that the movie could be some kind of lolly water movie with a girl who is married to a prince, but soon you understand that is wrong. This is the fiest twist in the story that shows an innocent girl becomes the victim of a mean dragon who wants to take revenge against humans. This was the regional king invading her home in the mountains. This dragon seemed quite mean and terrible at the time and continued to chase the young lady throughout the movie, but in the end, this dragon was not as terrible as I could have thought in the beginning. There are some more twists I will not identify here.The adventure part with Elodie was quite interesting and reminded me to die hard. She is very good in rather risky cases. She learned by her life to struggle for the lives of her people in a place where food was missing, and this marriage was a good reason for her father to earn some money for 'selling' by some means, his daughter.PS: What I can doubt in the movie. How can this dragon live so long? How can she talk with humans? Centuries later? Next to it, can it be the same for the family of the groom as long as the dragon lives? There is a map somewhere inside that means someone from the 'jailed' girls has attained to get out of the mountain, and thus she returned back to design the map. And finally, there was no smarter girl before her to solve this puzzle with the dragon. There are possibly many other questions to be answered, but these are my early thoughts at the time of writing this article.As a result, I can rate this movie 6-7/10. Its quite entertaining and possibly a bit silly not replying to these quite reasonable questions.

title: Damsel Not In Distress
text: The film's visuals are stunning, with breathtaking landscapes and meticulously designed sets. The cave scenes are particularly immersive, creating a sense of claustrophobia and danger that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The dragon is also a sight to behold, with its realistic design and menacing presence.The plot of 'Damsel' is both thrilling and unpredictable. The film takes unexpected turns and keeps viewers guessing until the very end. It is a refreshing take on the classic fairy tale formula, exploring themes of female empowerment, survival, and the true nature of love.Overall, 'Damsel' is a highly recommended film that will appeal to a wide range of audiences. It is an exciting adventure, a suspenseful thriller, and a powerful story of female resilience. With its stunning visuals, compelling characters, and unforgettable plot, it is a film that will stay with viewers long after the credits roll.

title: Dissapointing...
text: I don't understand why this film has been hyped up so much. I have to admit I did watch it because Millie was in it and her acting is very good. I don't think she was given a lot to work with here. The script was quite cheesy and the story was okay. I felt like not much actually happened or everything happened all at once. It would have been nicer if the pacing was slower or there was more character development. Pretty obvious ending too. I feel like they wanted two things in this film, dragons and Millie. They ran with it and unfortunately it was a poor execution. Although it may have a different story, this idea has been used a thousand times. There were nice touches throughout the film, things that were truly beautiful yet it felt like it was lacking something the whole way through. I probably wouldn't watch this again.

title: feminist take on the knight vs dragon story
text: All the girls are righteous, except for the one who is fulfilling the dreary obligations of patriarchy, which stem from a long-ago crime committed by males, of course. In the end, the girls all go on to a happy ending. I won't spoil things by listing which girls in particular...It's funny to see Angela Bassett playing a goody two shoes type when she's more the Evil Queen sort but Robin Wright handles that well.Just one quibble, shouldn't dragons be immune to fire inasmuch as they breathe it out of their stomachs and throats? I'll need the judges to rule on that one. Otherwise, its an okay watch. Certainly not bad by Netflix standards.

title: Don't bother
text: I am a massive fantasy fan, and even bad fantasy I tend to enjoy. However this was dreadful. I want to love Millie, but the story was just awful, so rushed, no emotion connection or care at ALL for the characters and honestly the acting was just so dry and fake. Really disappointed, honestly there's only ever been a handful of films that I've disliked to the point of wishing I could rewind time - this is now one of them. The idea was so rushed and it think that was the main problem, there left no real depth for character growth or plot and it was all so predictable and boring. There was SO much more to be done and honestly it fell so flat.

title: Meh... Another Predictable Fantasy Adventure
text: This is a film that attempts to weave a tale of a princess being used as a sacrifice to appease the wrath of a dragon, but ultimately falls short in delivering an engaging and innovative storyline. The plot unfolds in a disappointingly predictable manner, with twists and turns that can be seen from a mile away. In fact, the word "generic" doesn't even begin to describe the lack of originality in the narrative.Throughout the film, the audience is taken on a journey that feels like a rehash of countless other fantasy adventures. The characters, plot points, and resolutions all feel like recycled elements from mid-level storytelling, leaving little room for surprises or genuine emotional investment.While the film may hold some appeal for a younger audience who may not have been exposed to a wide range of films over the years, it fails to offer anything new or compelling for more seasoned viewers. For those accustomed to the rich tapestry of storytelling found in cinema, "Damsel" may come across as little more than background noise - a forgettable addition to the fantasy genre that lacks the spark of creativity needed to truly captivate its audience.In conclusion, "Damsel" is a film that struggles to break free from the constraints of its own predictability. While it may find a place among those seeking a simple and straightforward fantasy tale, it ultimately fails to leave a lasting impression or offer anything of substance to those looking for a more engaging cinematic experience.

title: A great fantasy film with only one flaw
text: A dutiful damsel agrees to marry a handsome prince, only to find the royal family has recruited her as a sacrifice to repay an ancient debt.It sounds like a classic Disney film with a fairy tale type fantasy story. Indeed it has all the right ingredients and the scenes are sumptuously made, the CGI as good as I've seen.The acting from everyone but Winstone -who is as good as ever- is mediocre but that doesn't spoil the film overly much. What spoils it the most is simply Milly Bobby Brown.I don't know why casting directors get it so wrong sometimes, but a film can be made or broken by their decisions. The decision to use brown who is simply not skilled enough to take on the lead role bemuses me and saddens me also, as this could have been a much better film.In the first half she's passable, but the second half all she does is screech and yell, and her screeches and yells are so unbelievable they just raise ire.Her delivery is so poor she could have been reading ingredients from a sauce bottle. Elle Fanning would have been the natural choice for this: impeccable acting abilities and better looking too.If you are a massive Milly Bobby Brown fan you may enjoy this more than I did. As it was a gave it a 6 because it's a great story and Winstone and Wright both delivered in their roles and everyone else was acceptable. Only Brown let the film down.

title: Good Premise, but bad fulfillment
text: The premise is great, but it is wasted on this movie. The movie is well acted, with plenty of star power, but it should have been a multi-year series. So much of it is easily predictable and, ultimately, unsatisfying. The acting, and the casting are not bad, but the use they are put to is deplorable. How can you put Angela Bassett in a film and make it feel like she is so completely wasted?Seriously, I feel that there is so much wasted potential in making this a movie instead of a series. Characters are not nearly developed well enough it could have been so much better if they had all been allowed to grow. I would advise those that made the movie to rewrite it to a series and let the characters grow.

title: I Did Not Expect....
text: ....to give this movie a 7, I honestly did not. It's a classic fantasy movie, pretty good pace, gorgeous costumes, not so hot on the decor though, to be honest...too much gold for my taste and a very yellow gold at that which makes it slightly tacky...Plus I really don't understand why they insist on heroines wearing lipgloss after they've had the living daylights beaten out of them. I mean, come on. Millie Bobby Brown is a consumate actress which, again, I did not expect. The reason for that is because she comes off as a tad bit fake in her interviews and very precocious to her detriment. Bottom line, she should star in movies with a bit more character developement.

title: Paper Bag Princess Redux
text: In 1980 Robert Munsch wrote The Paper Bag Princess. In 2024 Netflix stole the plot. Munsch should definitely sue for story credit and residuals.Other than that, the story moved nicely, Millie Bobby Brown shows her acting chops, and the dragon is well-voiced by Shohreh Aghdashloo. Ray Winstone is perfectly cast and Robin "Princess Buttercup" Wright does a heel turn as the evil queen. The direction was blah, with a little too much screaming on Lady Elodie's part and at least one annoying plot hole.Upside is that this doesn't have all of the cliches of a dragons laying story, and tries to subvert a lot of them, but the writers and director definitely watched 1981's Dragonslayer one too many times in their youth.

title: Scream if you wanna go faster
text: So you're married into a self serving family of Tories (republicans if you're a yank), you can tell they are because they don't care about anyone but themselves.You're then thrown into a pit of misery, full of despair and no hope (pretty much what the conservatives have turned the UK into),You find there's a fire breathing dragon who's trying to turn you into coal.What's the best course of action if you find yourself in that spot?Well according to this movie, you'll do nothing but scream, groan, shout, whisper, talk, scream and then scream some more.Not quite as catchy as dodge, duck, dip, dive and dodge.Tedious best describes this movie.Main actress was ok, Ray Winstone was as stick as the rocks in the cave.Yawnorama!

title: Entertaining enough for those who enjoy fantasy adventure
text: Greetings from Lithuania."Damsel" (2024) is a movie that has nothing special or original, yet for the run time 1 h 45 min it did its job - it did entertain me. The premise was intriguing and i won't spoil anything, but i haven't watch any trailers nor read synopsis - the less you know about the plot the better it is. Acting was good enough by the lead actress. Directing was also solid enough. This movie did kept me involved. And while the third act was disappointing in comparison, still i would recommend this flick for one evening.Overall, a descent movie "Damsel" won't blow you away, but it might entertain you mildly for one evening if you are in fantasy adventure movies.

title: Damsel of Disappointment
text:
This movie looked so promising in the trailer, and I was quite excited to see it. But...
Let's see the good things: the CGI is pretty, really, the whole movie is visually pleasing. The costumes are great. The music is... Pretty good? And it's not a long movie, fortunately...
Because the bad things: Jesus Christ, everything else! The first half of the movie is exceedingly long, we spend more than half an hour waiting for the plot to start. It's pretty but boring. The acting is bloodless and flat. The plot is. It's just. I'm sorry, but it's stupid. Everything is predicable. The ending is mind-blowingly weird and underwhelming. The whole experience can be summed up in saying: "meh". Made me sad, to be honest.

title: Shockingly bad
text:
Another shockingly bad direct to streaming film with bad CGI, cheap sets, computer generated backgrounds and awful dialogues so bad they feel like they were written by ChatGPT.I allowed myself to get suckered into watching it, due to the comparatively high rating here.So let's start with the good
-The actual story structure itself is logical. Shocking in this day and age. There's a setup, motivations for each character, a twist that actually makes sense and a (predictable) resolution. It's not Madame Web or Thor Ragnarok level stupid.-The director actually makes use of the environment. Gusts of wind, bioluminiscenct life forms, some scenes have a good texture to them. And the environment is also used in a clever way in a pivotal action scene. Good job!-Some of the side characters are more fleshed out than they need to be. The prince for example is given little character moments that set him apart of his ruthless mother. I liked that.-One theme from the soundtrack was decent-Color grading was good. That's a rarity these days as well.-The twist with the Dragon's motivation works.Now the bad:-As usual with these films, the actors are on tiny greenscreen soundstages, with a few real props and the rest of the background being CGI. The costumes and environment feels small, generic and cheap. A royal wedding takes place with a crowd of maybe 12 people. It looks ridiculous.-Forced diversity. Naturally, a story taking place in what looks to be medieval England or Sweden features countless African Americans... who did not even exist at that time in history.Sure, they turned it into a fantasy setting. It's still as stupid as that google AI generating black Nazi SS officers for diversity's sake. Just stop it, you're embarassing yourselves. If you want a diverse cast, set your movie in today's day and age. Or in regions where there was racial diversity at the time, i.e. Medieval Spain or ancient Egypt. Or if you're going to make it a fantasy setting, then make it feel like a fantasy setting and don't just use English and German architecture, clothing and aesthetics.-The pacing. As so often, this movie is *slow*. But not throughout, which is different from usual. The beginning and end are quite brisk. The slow part is the middle part, where the heroine has to fight for her survival. Unfortunately, it's the central part of the movie, but it's also the least interesting, because the plot grinds to a halt. Yes, we eventually learn of the twist, but for the next 25 minutes that doesn't change the dynamic of how she interacts with the dragon. The chase just continues. Which brings us to-the writing. Dialogues are terrible almost throughout. The entire opening scene is a clunkily delivered exposition dump. She watches her own father and 3 men get killed by the dragon, when she could have simply stopped it by revealing the truth. A truth she and we as the audience had already been sitting on for a while. When you give the audience information, you want it to advance the plot. This doesn't happen. After the killings, we get yet another chase and confrontation scene between her and the dragon. It takes forever.And that's the central problem with this story: The middle part is garbage. The setup is great, the ending is servicable, but there is no middle. To make matters worse, all other characters disappear from the plot. It's essentially a one woman survival show. Except this isn't "The Revenant", and Millie Bobbie Brown isn't Leonardo DiCaprio-The lead actress. She's not terrible, but she's not good either. She lacks the physicality for the role, having absolutely no muscle tone and lacking the agility to convincingly pull off the role.
