The opening scene shows her chopping wood, to show her as a tough girl. But those noodle arms never chopped wood in their life.Her acting is hit and miss. Bad during the opening, good in the romantic scenes with the prince, really good in scenes of sadness, terrible in scenes of acting though, good in scenes where she is injured, terrible at the very end (though the script does her no favors).Much of the movie's acting is hit and miss. Angela Bassett does the best she can with her role. Robin Wright shines as usual. Ray Winstone phones it in, seemingly between drinks, and the guy playing the prince does a fine job.-The dragon is overpowered. A common problem in these types of films. In an attempt to have impressive CGI shots for the trailer and make it scary, they make the movie monster unstoppable - until the script needs it to be vulnerable. This would have worked better with the dragon not being an unstoppable killing machine.If one were to condense the middle part down from about 50 minutes to 15, it could be watchable. Certainly better than the usual Netflix dreck.

title: It's OK fairytale fantasy.
text: Honestly, it's OK. There's some clever playing against some fairytale tropes. Ending is rushed, like so many of the type (like the animated Snow White). But it's basically entertaining enough.Those criticising the strength of the protagonist should rewatch the opening scenes. She's fit, strong and doesn't need supernatural skills or superhuman abilities to accomplish what she does. Just some determination and a bit of luck - and the story does contain enough elements to show that others have faced the dangers before and perhaps been not quite as fit or quite as lucky.There's some less believable grandstanding, but that's hardly unusual in the genre.

title: Millie Bobbie Brown Excellent In Decent Fantasy Action
text: In which Millie Bobbie Brown is a young woman married to a prince to avert a crisis in a her homeland, and finds herself being unwittingly sacrificed to a dragon to pay off an ancient debt. The result is an enjoyable action-fantasy romp as she battles for survival.You can't tell a story like this without invoking Alien, and this film does so on several occasions. Millie Bobbie Brown is a convincingly bad-ass action heroine who deserves an even bigger vehicle than this one. And whilst the homages to Alien are clear, it has other connective tissue to the superior Ready Or Not, a film which is elevated above Damsel by managing to find more than a dash of wit when this is just a bit too po-faced to really sing.The dragon is beautifully realised (and voiced - when the dragon started to speak I wasn't sure it was going to well, but it's carried off well). The film sits squarely in the young adult space, and light enough on gore to be appropriate for the intended audience; there is a world where we see more of the gore, and the film becomes more of a horror story. But what we have is what we have; we already knew from Stranger Things and the Enola Holmes films that Millie Bobbie Brown has the capacity to carry to a big franchise. Damsel is another feather to that bow; I'm intrigued to see where her career carries her.

title: Not bad but formulaic
text:
This is Netflix medieval fantasy movie
Is certainly not bad, but deffinitely is not great either. If it were more into horror and less into adventure perhaps it would engage
little more. It is not very convincing and atmospheric, despite the interesting general plot and some nice elements such as the light worms. Perhaps what was actually needed for a bettter outcome was an authorial director with a touch of magic such as Terry Gilliam or Jean-Pierre Jeunet or Guillermo del Toro, instead of Netflix producers making a film according their formula. The excess of clichés and the always obvious dialogues annoy.

title: An hour and 45 minutes you won't ever get back
text: Millie bobby brown has officially planted herself in the 'Ruby Rose' acting category. I mean where do I start, how can an actress under/act and over-act in the same movie. Millie manages to do this to a point where it's borderline cringe.While the movie plot is super cliche and over stretched, fantasy movie fans, would have, in normal circumstances, maybe come to endure the hour and forty five minute $hit show had the director manage to cast at the very minimum a tolerable lead. But no, who do they choose, no other than Millie Bobby brown; an actress who has not managed to develop her acting since the second season of stranger things; it's like she hit a wall with her acting skills at age 12. Really painful to watch, almost as much as Ruby Rose...Robin Wright and Ray Winstone's characters salvage the tinsy bit of whatever is left of this production of garbage.

title: Entertaining But Takes Self Way Too Seriously, Needs Humor
text: I laughed reading the wide spread of reviews here and totally get how people can love or hate this movie. For some reason Netflix really struggles to consistently make quality in-house feature movies.This movie could have been so much better if humor and self-awareness were injected, it takes itself way too seriously. Now, that's fine if you have a tight script, strong character backstory, and believable/internally consistent storyline but this film doesn't. They should have taken a lesson from Robin Wright and added a couple doses of Princess Bride. Regardless, there is action and the story moves. Great airplane movie.I hardly ever complain about this but the diversity in this film seems so forced and is borderline cringe. 2024 and Hollywood still seems to have not figured out how to incorporate diversity in a believable way.

title: Simply a good watch, with only a few big flaws
text: I think a lot of people nowadays expect new films to be overly complex and devoid of fun, but I think this film deserves to be recognised as just a simple and exciting watch. The film didn't try to be anything it wasn't.The cinematography was outstanding, surpassing Netflix's already superb standards of filmmaking. The CGI in this film has set a new standard for a good looking film, which isn't surprising for its budget, but it still made for a satisfying experience. In this day it is certainly off-putting to see bad CGI in a new film, because the whole point of CGI is to look real.My only major problem was the writing - it came across as bland and basic at the best of times, and at its worst it was quite cringeworthy when it broke the rule of 'show don't tell'. The worst part was that it DID show, but then it proceeded to have the character say out loud what has just been shown. Or even worse, the character is explains her character development to the audience in a way that is laughable; for example, "im through with being told what to do."However, the actors absolutely made the best of a bad script. Millie Bobby Brown was great in her role as 'Elodie' (marking her 3rd time she's played a character who's name starts with 'E') by giving her charisma and a sense of quiet confidence. I do like how this character is actually very clever, and not just a "kick-ass woman", although she is certainly that too. Millie Bobby Brown has a history of being good at playing those kinds of characters.

title: its a good job dragons play with their food
text: This is a neat little story. Yes, it is silly. There's a later shot of Millie walking with the world burning behind her... an absolutely classic shot and she pulls it off with such a silly look on her face I couldn't help but laugh.The story is not deep, and it is not overlong. Its shot reasonably tightly, and we are spared the excesses of girlboss power fantasy nonsense. As the title says, its a good job dragons play with their food, or the movie would have had a very different and much shorter ending. That small contrivance aside, the overcoming of the enemy was clever and within the bounds of possibility. We get another meme shot, this time of the A-team/McGuyver preparation.Bad guys get their just deserts. Really bad gal doesn't really, but we kinda feel for them. Fun movie.

title: Millie Bobby Brown: Blood and Wine
text: The kingdom this film is set in is gorgeous, so much so that I felt it a real shame so much of this took place in the cave. The film for the most part is absolutely fine with a couple cringy dialogues but nothing too bizarre. Enjoyable film, easy watching but maybe I am just craving a high fantasy epic set in Aurea.Surprisingly this film turned out to be rather gnarly, was not expecting the detail in some of the death scenes but it was a pleasant suprise.Mostly this kinda felt like I was watching the dwarven mines scene from Desolation of Smaug. Apart from this time no one surfed on a trail of molten gold. Oh well.

title: It is like Game of Throne with a Happy Ending.
text: Imagine this is a parallel universe where Millie Bobby Brown is the first Targaryen. The one who befriended a dragon and so their bloodline continues like this.And you know Cersei Lannister, she is here too playing the same role as the villain. And yes, many good characters die suddenly in this film (just like in GoT)It is fun to watch 'movie'. Millie is a good actress but she is still learning. The opening part is all smiles and smiles... and it is a bit too much but the fun starts soon after the wedding. And that is till where you must tolerate the fantasy. After that is good fun and the film takes you in an incredible journey of struggle and sacrifice. The ending was a bit too lovely, but overall it is a job well done.Giving it 6 out of 10, for its cinematography, acting, special effects and music. The first part and second part seem like two different directors directed it.It is good and a worthy watch if you like fantasy films.

title: Honestly, it was exactly what I was expecting.
text: Obviously Netflix movies have a negative stigma. However, this was exactly what I'd expect from any streaming movie. The cgi, acting , and locations were all well done. From the title alone, you'd expect it to be some all powerful female warrior who was able to do something a bunch of men couldn't. While there is some of that, it makes sense. The drawback is that it feels rushed and bloated at the same time.Within 10 minutes, our princess is already off to a new land to be married. There's not enough time spent establishing the characters and their motivations outside of them being poor. Then when the movie is nearing its end you realize not much actually happened. It doesn't feel like there's a middle act. It was more like a really long episode of a solid show.Overall, it was slightly above average.

title: AMAZING
text: I thought that this film was amazing, the acting is incredible, Millie Bobby Brown playing Eloise did a superb job, the CGI and costume are very good and set the atmosphere perfectly and the plot is extremely entertaining. This movie has an amazing script and the actors all did it justice, I enjoyed every second as it was very engaging throughout the whole film. The story line was imaginative and well thought out. I can't think of a single negative comment and can't fathom why it only has a rating of 6.1, this is a great watch! I will definitely this movie recommend to all my friends and family, a good watch for all ages.

title: Manages to entertain just a bit
text: A dark fantasy film that attempts to subvert the tropes of the "The Princess Bride" subgenre while incorporating some elements of survival horror. Based on the novel of the same name by Evelyn Skye and directed by Spanish filmmaker Juan Carlos Fresnadillo, it's a stylized medieval fantasy with dragons, princesses and evil queens that gets very dark and surprisingly claustrophobic, especially after the saccharine first half. There's also a great cast, led by Millie Bobby Brown and a wonderfully frigid Robin Wright, who are completely wasted by an underdeveloped, very predictable script with no surprises and some poor lighting choices that opt for artificial phosphorescence where darkness and shadows would have been better. Despite all this, the movie manages to entertain sufficiently and offers some frightening scenes that are a pleasant surprise even for horror fans.

title: Wasted good potential...
text: I'll just quickly start by saying that Millie Bobby Brown is an absolute beauty and she was the only reason I kept watching'till the end.Amazing cast, amazing idea, but it gets too boring too fast. This movie could've lasted 20 minutes and it still would've covered the whole story. No characters' stories were developed, it became very predictable because the story is so empty.Also, tooooo many meaningless scenes that are exhausting and you find yourself conflicted because you want to keep watching but you're so bored and tired, you have to force yourself to not stop.Costumes were good, the CGI - amazing. The story - ridiculously meh.

title: An Entertaining Fantasy Movie
text: I enjoyed the movie. Definitely nothing great by any means but I would recommend it for those who enjoy fun entertaining fantasy movies but are not expecting Lord of the Rings. Millie Bobby Brown is solid as the lead. Robin Wright always plays a cold antagonist well. I liked the premise and the basic story. The ending could have been better but again this is not Academy Award material nor s not trying to be. I agree with other reviewers that say some seem to expect too much from a film. I will say that I look forward to Millie Bobby Brown taking on more interesting roles with award competing scripts. I think she has the chops for it.

title: Waste of time.
text: I quite like the genre but this film is just trash. I tried so hard to stay positive and grasp onto anything decent about it, but it's so exhaustively bland that by the end, i was resentful that not a single element made it worth my time; this film epitomises mediocrity in every aspect. I concede that this was not the worst film I've seen, but the whole thing just seemed like another "here's X million dollars, write a safe and generic script, throw the famous Stranger Things girl in it and make the studio money"; and sadly, they probably will. This film exemplifies the death of modern cinema..

title: Girl-bossed to close to the sun.
text: Honestly the first 3rd of this movie held some water, but by the time we got to the last act I was ready for the movie to be over. The writing got worse as the movie went on and honestly this might be the movie that kills Millie BB for me.her acting is quite flat in the lead-up and I can only hear her do the 11 scream so many times before I'm like "is this what you're good at?!". The girl-boss trope is also super-tired now, they don't establish that she even knows how to use a sword but by the end, she's a fantastic warrior? I miss Ellen Ripley. More Netflix slop for the bucket, but hey VFX weren't completely terrible.

title: total waste of time
text: An ordinary plot, bad acting, a simple narrative. To be fair, the CGI isn't bad. Especially the dragon is very detailed and it is a nice combination of The Hobbit's Smaug and Daenerys Targaryan's dragons. I can say that maybe Millie Bobby Brown's worst performance. It might be a good choice if you have free time and want to kill it. I'm thinking of a scene that will stay in my mind throughout the movie, but I really can't find it. It's a very ordinary movie, devoid of emotion, with little excitement, and doesn't add anything to you after it's over. Netflix had recently started to produce good productions, but this did not happen.

title: ok
text: Princess Elodie (Millie Bobby Brown) comes from a struggling northern kingdom ruled by her father Lord Bayford (Ray Winstone). Queen Isabelle (Robin Wright) of the wealthy island kingdom Aurea has agreed to a marriage between her son Prince Henry and Elodie. There are red flags. Elodie's stepmother (Angela Bassett) starts to suspect foul play.It's fine. It's not anything special. Millie Bobby Brown is doing yeoman's work. The general premise is pretty good. The writing could be more inventive and it could set up some stuff better. For example, Elodie should be the one hiding a knife in her dress. Why would the dress come with a knife anyways? Maybe they are teasing the girls with the least amount of help. I kept expecting the axe to come back into the story. They need to set up something at the beginning. I doubt that a dragon gets burn by its own fire. There are just a lot of little irksome matters in the writing.

title: Honest review
text: The movie was focused to much around "strong independent female lead who doesn't need Prince Charming" but they did execute the movie in an okay progression. Most movies with that focus looses the storyline and progression, but this movie ended up okay because they didn't fail in making an okay story and story progression. Left quite a few things out that could have made the movie better but the movie is far from a disaster. I'd say the movie overall has the wrong overall agenda but has an okay but average story that lacks quite a few elements that would have made the movie desirable for a bigger audience.This movie gets a plus because they actually made a dragon a dragon and not a wyvern and then calling it dragon like most of the major fantasy movies and series.10/10 Dragon.5.5/10 Movie.

title: Damsel: A Fairy Tale That Misses the Mark
text: If you've seen the trailer, you figured out what the plot of the movie is. While the premise itself sparks curiosity - a princess yearning not for rescue, but for escape from a dragon-appeasing sacrifice - the execution stumbles upon some rather unconvincing performances.One can't help but wonder if director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo was aiming for a touch of Monty Python-esque absurdity. If that was the target, well, he hit the bullseye. The acting choices veer towards the exaggerated, occasionally teetering over the edge into melodrama. Millie Bobby Brown, though undeniably blossoming into a beautiful young woman, delivers a performance that's lacking the nuanced depth the role demanded.Thankfully, the film doesn't completely descend into the realm of unintentional laughter. The visual effects, particularly in the fantastical dragon's lair, are a saving grace. They provide a splash of wonder, a reminder that this isn't your typical princess story.So, is "Damsel" a shining example of cinematic brilliance? Not quite. However, for those seeking a light-hearted fantasy adventure with a dash of the bizarre, it might just be the dragon's hoard you've been looking for. Just don't expect a performance fit for a standing ovation.

title: Way too long
text: It's 110 minutes long.You can just watch the first 5 minutes and skip the next first 30 minutes. They are pure filler; they add nothing.Then, it's a mix of unncessary grunting and pain-shouting shots with normally-paced action-ish shots.It's not that it's actively bad. It's just not good.They wanted to feature Milly Bobby Brown in a film and make her the hero.They thought having a dragon would make it cool.They created a 30-minute script.They added a whole lot of filler footage and thought that Milly Bobby's grunting abilities would do the rest.If you paid full price to watch this in a cinema... I'm sorry you wasted your money.Ok to watch for free in a secondary TV while you do something else.Honestly, it would have been so easy to look for a decent script with an actual storyline... such a waste.

title: Absolute tripe!
text: Why cannot I give zero stars? Awful movie. Millie B started digging a hole with Enola Holmes 2 and hasn't stopped with this nasty, clichéd, dumb, boring, waste of time. The movie could have been an hour shorter and been just as bad, but no they dragged it on and on like the slow drip of water torture. I kept waiting for the pace to pick up but a damp squib has more bang than the conclusion. The only good thing I can think of is that it ended.. My 4 year old grandson can come up with a better plot, and a more entertaining feature with my phone camera. Sorry, but I don't have the vocabulary to fully convey just what a terrible movie this was. Do yourself a favour and avoid.

title: Loved it
text: I went in thinking it wouldn't be any good, but was pleasantly surprised. They didn't make her an overly good fighter like most movies do. Often times movies will lean into having a girl power moment and end up making it so absurdly ridiculous that it just doesn't work and it is cringy (marvel end game). In this movie she was the hero but it was because she was clever, smart, witty, strong, driven and sweet. I love having strong female leads but I appreciate it all the more when the men remain manly and aren't turned into wusses. I loved watching her struggle and come up with new ways to push forward.I was pleasantly surprised by the ending. I felt like it really tied the loose ends together and it was satisfying to watch.

title: Twist and Turns but Made My Eyes Burn
text: This was not good. There were several extremely predictable twists. Poor plot development, terrible villain character, and a ton of screaming from Bobbi Brown the entire movie. She very well maybe screamed more than she spoke in the film. The writing was bad and cliche. Please do yourself a favor and just guess what happens before watching it, and I bet you can get it pretty close, which will save you two hours! Nice CGI, but the dialogue was lacking the whole film, and the story was too fast. Like it bounced around from new part to new part without doing a proper job of connecting it back. Netflix=quantity, not quality.

title: Same ks acting cliche from Brown
text: Well I must say that when all the people on Facebook saying that this was the new movie to watch, then I thought I must watch this but then after watching this movie I realised that most people on Facebook just agree with others for likes but that is by and by.Now onto the movie, oh boy where do I begin, we'll let me just say if you have watch any of Millie Bobby Brown's other movies then you will know what kind of acting your going to get, the same as all of her movies.I must be the only one who is not impressed by her acting ability, it's the same astonished look in everything she does.In truth a very disappointing film but then Brown's acting hasn't got any better with age. Give it a miss.

title: Exactly what I was expecting and more
text: Anyone who knows the Hero's Journey could have easily predicted how the story was going to play out. But last I checked, no one ever considers the Hero's Journey storytelling method to be tired, unless of course that only applies to stories in which the protagonist is a strapping young man.Millie Bobby Brown delivered a chillingly astounding performance as the lead role through her emotional delivery. Audiences could clearly feel her joy, her optimism, her pain, and her anger. Her interactions and banter with the other characters were clearly indicative of the different relationships she had with each of them.It was never a mystery that the story was going to take a dark turn, yet the transition was thrilling and eerie. Watching the main character undergo a series of painful trials was as brutal as it was exciting.Even though the story was easy to follow doesn't mean it wasn't without its twists and moments where it raised the stakes. Watching a main character develop and grow into a fearless warrior was inspiring and badass. A truly empowering character. This film captured all that and more through its excellent storytelling, characters, costumes and adventure.

title: Decent
text: Female super hero with good CGI. Same old modern story in a fairy tale. The trope is getting old fast.The CGI was good. Making the dragon talk was interesting, though it didn't help the story except give one clue repeatedly. Shohreh Aghdashloo voice is always powerful. Great actress and glad to see her more and more.The action scenes were really good. The actress and stunt double must have had hard days with filming. Which was an unexpected and delightful twist in a female lead movie. The story line was okay but the ending could have used more "relationship" detail. Soundtrack none existent but they probably spent the money on the CGI and lead female actresses.The male acting in this movie was none existent! Which I think hurt it more than anything especially in the ending.Overall if your bored why not.

title: Absolutely loved this move
text: Damsel was Netflix's redemption, with strong female lead and nary a hint of woke bs! Classic story telling. Perfect for young viewers and beautiful sets, cgi, great acting and solid story. I loved every second.The story was simple, yes, but it was the execution and attention to detail that matters here... Characters were classic antagonist and protagonist leads, with dragon mythos and a Shakespearen feel. The castle and background geography contributed to a realistic story landscape that fused drama with place and purpose. I can't wait to have my daughters watch this film, at its heart it's a young person's movie.

title: Dansel? More like Agony
text: Randomly watched on Netflix, and the movie was underwhelming when seeing the title it has.The story itself is super simple, a princess of a kingdom goes on a adventure by herself. There are countless other movies like this plot, but the issue lies in how bland it is.Several of the scenes were portrayed to be questionable in logic that could of been solved if certain characters did more basic things. It becomes more apparent in the "misunderstandings," that could of been resolved early on without dragging the plot excessively.I did enjoy the development our "Damsel" was going through, likewise, so many scenes were plausible to where I was laughing out loud several times.Cliche? Yup. Bland? Very.The usual? Totally.

title: It's okay but not great
text: I don't know if it's because I have a dislike for Millie Bobby Brown or if the movie was just "okay". Nothing against her personally, she's just so far up Netflix's butt the way Lin Manuel Miranda is so far up Disney's. The screenplay originally has a young woman of Asian descent described and there's already such minimal opportunities to POC let alone the Asian community that they really should have gone with someone of that community. Perhaps a fresh face rather than one that's been played time and time again. I fear they may wash Millie out, and she's still so young. Mediocre acting from everybody involved. Could've been the direction, could've been the dialogue. The scenery was beautiful and the stunts were great, but lately that seems to be all we've gotten from Netflix. I was honestly looking forward to this and it just ended up being pretty one dimensional and underwhelming. I think Netflix seems to not be living up to the grand reputation they've built for themselves. They need fresh blood or else they'll die off.

title: Should have been an animation
text: Damsel is a visually fun movie to watch and with a range of acceptable to good performances by the cast plus a time to time great cinematography is even good from a technical point.But here's the thing; the plot has some problems and needed much editing and reviewing. Also, the characters were not developed enough due to their short screentime, especially the queen who had a lot of potential.I think the problems of this movie could have been avoided if it was an animation. As an animated picture, the plot would have made much more sense and Elodie's story would be much more fun and enjoyable. I really think this was a missed opportunity. As an animation movie, it would have been appreciated much more than this.

title: Unveiling Damsel: A Visual Treat with Familiar Twists
text: "Damsel" presents an intriguing premise where a dutiful damsel, played by Millie Bobby Brown, agrees to marry a handsome prince, only to discover that the royal family intends to sacrifice her to repay an ancient debt. This storyline, while initially captivating, falls into predictability as the narrative unfolds.The film's CGI and production values are commendable, making it a visually pleasing experience for an OTT watch. The special effects and set designs successfully create an immersive atmosphere that enhances the dark fairy tale vibe of the movie. However, the predictability of the storyline and the climax detracts from its overall impact.Millie Bobby Brown delivers a decent performance as the lead, bringing depth and resilience to her character. Her portrayal is one of the film's highlights, and she manages to keep the audience engaged despite the familiar plot twists.Overall, "Damsel" is a mixed bag. While it doesn't break new ground in terms of storytelling, it offers enough visual appeal and solid performances to make for an enjoyable movie night at home with family. If you're looking for a film with high production values and a classic fairy tale twist, "Damsel" is worth a watch, even if it doesn't leave a lasting impression.

title: Badly Written and Lame
text: The movie impressed with its CGI effects but fell short in delivering a meaningful portrayal of women's empowerment. Despite its visual prowess, the storyline relied heavily on clichés, such as the symbolic cutting of long hair to signify a transition from weakness to strength. This trope felt contrived and lacked practical significance within the narrative. It begged the question: must all women sacrifice their hair to assert their strength?Moreover, the protagonist's journey towards empowerment felt shallow and unconvincing. Despite lacking any prior training or battle experience, she miraculously transforms into a skilled dragon slayer through a mere display of wit. It undermines the authenticity of her character development and the film's intended message of empowerment.Furthermore, the narrative's reliance on pitting women against each other perpetuates harmful stereotypes rather than challenging them. By framing women who do not conform to the protagonist's archetype as incompetent, weak, or even malicious, the film reinforces gender norms rather than empowering women. True empowerment recognizes everyone's unique strengths.

title: I made an IMBD account just to say how bad this film is
text: The only reason it didn't get 1 star is because I feel sorry for some of the cast who did the best they could with a script that sounded like it had been written by underdeveloped AI. I'm not including Millie Bobby Brown in this as she was awful. I didn't realise just how bad of an actor she is until this film. I also don't understand how she, as an English person, can do a worse English accent than Angela Basset, an American.As the film went on it felt more and more like the director had thought 'oh, MBB is over 18 now, we can show some skin'. She just got more and more 'sexy' throughout which wasn't necessary to the story and felt like it was 'something for the dads'.I genuinely can't think of a positive thing to say about this film. The CGI was passable, that's about it. It's not even one that's so bad it's good/funny because it takes itself far too seriously.

title: A beautiful looking film. But...
text: This film is beautiful for sure. It looks great, the costumes are stunning, the music is fabulous and the direction is good. The performances aren't bad either (even if every injury and stumble seems to hurt Elodie in equal measure throughout lol). The main problem, however, is the writing. The script is overwritten, and it lands like a second draft. I wish more was left for the audience to figure out, and that we got a bit more nuance from the characters. The story is simple, so it needed to make up for that with character development, but the heroine is so perfect throughout that there's no journey - not to mention that every other character in the film is rather one dimensional. Still a fun watch, and a decent fantasy; I just wish they spent such monumental budgets on better scripts!

title: A Tale of Courage Beyond Fairytales: 'Damsel' Redefines Fantasy
text: In the realm of cinematic adventures, "Damsel," a 2024 Netflix original, emerges as a dark and compelling fantasy that captivates from the outset. Directed by Juan Carlos Fresnadillo and penned by Dan Mazeau, this film is a mesmerizing journey into a world where ancient debts, dark secrets, and mythical dragons intertwine with the fate of a young woman named Elodie, portrayed with unparalleled depth by Millie Bobby Brown.At first glance, "Damsel" might seem to tread the familiar path of fantasy and adventure, promising a tale of noble quests and daring rescues. Yet, it quickly distances itself from the traditional narratives, plunging the viewer into a story that is as dark as it is enthralling. Elodie's journey, from accepting a seemingly innocent marriage proposal to realizing she's a pawn in a sinister game to repay a royal family's ancient debts, unfolds with relentless pace and intensity.Millie Bobby Brown delivers a performance that is nothing short of captivating, embodying Elodie with a grace and tenacity that is both inspiring and deeply relatable. The supporting cast, including Ray Winstone as the troubled father and Robin Wright as the malevolent queen, bring layers of complexity and intrigue to the tale, with Wright's portrayal deserving special mention for its sheer villainous brilliance.What sets "Damsel" apart is its unapologetic departure from the typical fairytale narrative, despite its own self-aware tagline, 'This is not a fairytale.' The inclusion of a dragon, both convincing in its portrayal and unreal in its existence, serves as a powerful metaphor for the challenges and beasts one must face in the quest for freedom and identity. This element, while fantastical, grounds the story in a timeless struggle, blending the lines between reality and fantasy.The film's direction, script, and cinematography are executed with precision and artistry, creating a visual and narrative feast that engages and entertains. The pacing is particularly commendable, ensuring that the viewer is ensnared in Elodie's world from the first moment to the last, with no respite from the unfolding drama and suspense.In conclusion, "Damsel" is a fantasy-adventure that defies expectations, offering a richly woven tapestry of courage, betrayal, and redemption. It is a story that resonates on a deeply personal level, reminding us that within every tale of darkness and danger, there lies the potential for heroism and hope. For those seeking an escape into a world that is both fantastical and fiercely real, "Damsel" is a must-watch, providing the perfect backdrop for a lazy afternoon-or any time when the call for adventure beckons.

title: Please, no more cheese.
text: Unfortunately, Damsel is a big disappointment for me. I love a strong heroine, a period piece, and dragons so combining them should be a sure win. However, I found Damsel to be heavy on the cheese and silly in the worst way. Much of the movie sees Millie Bobby Brown acting solo and the script had her just spelling out every piece of plot for us. It's not that difficult to understand and we don't need a play-by-play. If she could have just been quiet instead of screaming constantly, the main character would have been a lot better off. The best part for me was the dragon voiced by Shohreh Aghdashloo, who has an incredible voice. I'm ready for Enola Holmes 3 now!

title: Most used movie ever
text: The Movie is the least original film ive ever seen. Milli Bobby Brown is sadly only good in scene where she has to scream, fall, or fly throught the room, like in stranger things. The dialogs are so poor, that kenny from southpark seems rich next to them and you cant even understand what he says. Your time is better spent smocking crack, what would make watching the movie probably enjoyable. The scenes and cgi effects are lame. Look like a scene from skyrim, a game that is good, but old by now. This movie gots to be the most souless thing ive ever seen. I just hope there will be no second part.

title: Below Average show
text: It is nothing what I expected based on the trailer and hype it was given. I am giving it 1 star for it being disappointing that it didn't stand up to what they promised. It has nice visuals and everything but story wise it's just blah and I think they could have cased someone else other than Milly Bobby Brown. Her acting felt more like drama than it feeling like a real character. Overall feels like something which was pictured in a small time. Feel they could have done way better by making small things better and keeping the story engaging. It just felt like the story kept beating around the same bush.

title: Netflix once again misses the point
text: What hasn't Millie Bobby Brown done? Developed her acting skills in any way since her teenage appearances. What can't Milli Bobby Brown do? Carrying a (sustainable) film. But she's a cinematic pop star, at least for now, and we're only talking about 15 days of streaming fame, not an entry in the history books. And what or who is supposed to portray her stepmother here? Well, it's a fairy tale, and then there's Netflix. Accordingly, the film came more or less out of nowhere, with CGI instead of real substance. The direction doesn't quite reveal itself, I had the feeling of a Sunday afternoon TV fairytale the whole time. After the first third, however, it becomes less child-orientated. So it's most likely a fairy tale for adults, especially women, see the constant strong-girl tones. I don't believe in a successful direction, but no matter, the main thing is that the agenda is right. Not to review only negatively, there are positive things too, most notably the dragon. This seems to be where the main animation budget was invested, and with really good results. The story itself isn't bad either, as far as I know it's an adaptation of a novel. What Damsel means, however, is withheld (at least from German viewers).

title: A dumpster fire of disappointment
text: Damsel (2024) is a cringe-inducing mess that not only fails to deliver on its promise but also manages to insult the intelligence of its audience at every turn. From the laughably contrived plot to the embarrassingly one-dimensional characters, this film is a prime example of lazy storytelling and uninspired filmmaking.Let's start with the protagonist, Elodie, whose name seems ripped straight from the pages of a hipster baby naming book. Because, you know, it's just not edgy enough to go with a regular name like Melanie or Emily - no, we have to strip away the first letter and pretend it's somehow avant-garde. Newsflash: it's not. It's just stupid.But Elodie's absurd moniker is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the film's many flaws. The so-called 'plot' is a nonsensical mishmash of tired tropes and clichés, with more holes than a block of Swiss cheese. We're supposed to believe that Elodie, a supposedly 'strong' female character, is duped into marrying a prince who promptly tries to sacrifice her to a dragon. Because nothing says empowerment like being treated as dragon bait, right?And don't even get me started on the supporting characters. From Elodie's simpering stepmother to the bumbling nobles of Aurea, it's like the filmmakers raided the discount bin of stock character archetypes. There's not a shred of originality or depth to be found anywhere in this sorry excuse for a cast.But perhaps the most insulting aspect of Damsel (2024) is its clumsy attempt at feminist messaging. Rather than offering genuine insight into the complexities of female agency and empowerment, the film relies on tired stereotypes and ham-fisted plot twists to convey its half-baked message. It's about as subtle as a sledgehammer to the face, and just as painful to endure.In the end, Damsel (2024) is nothing more than a misguided attempt at relevance, with all the subtlety of a toddler throwing a tantrum. Save yourself the agony and skip this dumpster fire of a film - your brain cells will thank you.

title: Follows the Standard Manual of How to Make a Movie by Netflix
text: Lord Bayford (Ray Winstone) receives a proposal from the Kingdom of Aurea to marry his daughter Elodie (Millie Bobby Brown) with Prince Henry (Nick Robinson), the son of Queen Isabelle (Robin Wright). In return, he would receive a fortune in gold, capable to help his people from his depleted land. Elodie agrees to help her father and accept the marriage. Lord Bayford, his wife Lady Bayford (Angela Bassett), Elodie and her younger sister Floria (Brooke Carter) travel to Aurea, and they meet King Roderick (Milo Twomey), Queen Isabelle and Prince Henry. Lady Bayford learns that Queen Isabelle is an arrogant and wicked woman and unsuccessfully tries to convince Elodie to call off the wedding. After the ceremony, Elodie and Henry head to a cave for an ancient costume of his family, and Elodie finds that she will be sacrificed to a dragon to keep the prosperity of the kingdom. Elodie begins a cat and mouse game with the dragon inside the cave, searching for an exit while learning about the tradition of the royal family."Damsel" is a movie that follows the standard manual of how to make a movie by Netflix. The queen of a Caucasian family in a fairytale is black. The powerful villain is another queen from a different kingdom, and her husband, the king, does not open his mouth the entire movie. The powerful destructive creature is a she-dragon that warriors and kings fail to destroy. But the damsel succeeds, without shield or weapons. The lead character is funny, making noises and screaming while hunted down by the she-dragon in its cave. Another funny scene is the escape route that Elodie discovers. Why would the escapee return to draw the map? The film is also too long, predictable, and boring in many moments. My vote is five.Title (Brazil): "Donzela" ("Damsel")

title: Mindless entertainment
text:
The pros:
1. Great production value.2. Visually appealing with a decent score.3. Robin Wright Penn.The cons:
Practically everything else.The movie is alright if you want to shut your brain off and enjoy a visual treat. It doesn't have much going for it as far as plot is concerned. The acting is mediocre and the writing is poor. The plot is very contrived and doesn't make much sense. Characters are all one dimensional and rather bland. I suppose this is the fare we're served these days. I truly wish movies would make an effort to delve a little deeper into a character and make their actions make sense. Alas, this was another disappointment.

title: I liked it
text: I'm not sure why but I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. Maybe coz I like the actress a lot. She is just so pleasant to watch even in her other movies. Or maybe I just simply love a good fairy tale with the dragons and princess and all that.I wasn't looking for a deep moving tale. I knew it was going to be a simple fairy tailish movie and I enjoyed it through out.I liked those tid bits of flashbacks Elodie saw in the case or the map she reads and all those little area's she crosses. Those bluish things that were hanging from tree and glowing. Such a beautiful movie to watch. Delight to the eyes :)

title: Totally ashamed of wasting mah time
text: Totally different but same story .. so basic that people will feel bore .. I was a Millie fan she was good but the story was basic. The worst part was the movies story there is nothing new .. people will waste their time on it.. If you are a true movie fan you will skip this movie because the story contains nothing but child play with low VFX project.. more likely to watch game of thrones 3 times rather than watching this.. if you like to watch cringe kins of movie than this movie is new ... there is nothing new with this movie I totally dislike it because of it's graphics and vfx also .. hate that this story contains. Nothing but a basic story.

title: Excellent family fun
text: I really enjoyed this and its an excellent family film. Plot has reasonable depth for a fantasy film and made complete sense. There were a few points where I thought there were going to be plot holes but they filled these in reasonably. Good pace, although could have even been expanded and been longer. MBB kicks ass and could be a good Red Sonia replacement. The Dragon CGI in the open air let it down a little bit otherwise I liked the creature design. The use of Shohreh Aghdashloo as the voice of the dragon is an excellent choice. Ray Winston is reasonably used and puts in his normal gruff appearance, although there could have been more use of Robin Wight and Angela Bassett. Fun fantasy film.

title: Brilliant!!
text: Absolutely amazing movie!! There isn't anything bad I can say about the movie at all. Millie absolutely kills her role and the acting and story/plot of the movie is very well written. Amazing animations, reminds me of game of thrones in a way. The ending is really good, actually gave me cold chills and not a lot of movies has done that for me but this one sure did!! The only reason it's not getting 10 stars is because it didn't release in theaters, I would have loved to watch this in a imax theater!! Please don't listen to the bad reviews and watch it for yourself you will not be disappointed.

title: It's a children's movie
text: If you are older than fifteen, don't bother watching this. Hammy acting with ridiculous accents. Hair, make up and costume design are wrong in so many ways. All the main actress wanted was to look pretty in every scene. Well, again, suitable for children or early teens. Just wanted to warn viewers that this is not a fantasy movie that could entertain an adult audience, a warning that should have been made by IMDB, Netflix and other media. I guess they didn't want to narrow down the viewer base and, therefore, deliberately tried to trick people like me into watching this. I fell for it, so you don't have to fall too.

title: Nice, if you're twelve-ish.
text: Very predictable, it feels as if they are trying hard to make it seem "epic". Watching it reminded me of the movie "Eragon" (which should not have been made into a movie if you ask me), it was quite childish but trying not to be.I did not care for the special effects nor the feel of the entire movie, it was quite hard to care for the characters too. I might have liked it more if it didn't make me cringe so much. It was wildly underwhelming and trying very hard to be like the big fantasy movies (and failing miserably).I'd recommend this movie if you are in the ages of 12-16, or have the taste of a child.It was honestly very boring.

title: Fantasy, adventure and very cool fight scenes
text: Damsel weaves a spellbinding tale of fantasy, adventure, and intrigue. The film unfolds with the classic elements of a fairy tale: damsel, stepmother, evil queen. But this fairytale has a twist: the damsel is strong, smart, and capable while the prince is well....not so much.The story takes the damsel through danger, discovery, and of course a run-in with a dragon.The action scenes are meticulously crafted and heart-pounding. Besides the adrenaline-fueled battles, the story is engaging and entertaining. The growth of the main character from dutiful daughter to heroic warrior is empowering, and the outcome for the dragon awesome.

title: Poor acting
text: The story is not great but okay. It was not thrilling but somewhat entertaining. Also i think the story is very rushed, it has a little bit like an arthur and his knights feel. But then it is so rushed that you dont have the time to get to know the characters. What i feel really makes this a bad movie is the acting especially from mille bobby brown is bad. She is making her character super akward and stale. You can really tell when she is having an interaction with someone. It is like watching a kid actor being unsecure.The cgi for my taste is acceptable but not great either, the shape of the dragon is pretty wierd tho.

title: The screaming...
text: It's not that bad, really - it's a fairly decent fantasy story, dragons and all. Some evil queen, some brave heroine, some bad decisions and sacrifices, some victorious riding into the proverbial sunset in the end. It's not that bad.At the same time, it kinda is - most of the emotions are conveyed via screaming (or last-breath-panting), most of the action is secondary and uninventive, most of the character choices are questionable at best. And actors don't seem engaged much into what's happening (or perhaps what's happening is not much to engage with) - it looks more like a inexpensive theatric play rather than a movie, despite the actors' potential.I'd not recommend this one - it's not even entertaining, unfortunately. I'd rather suggest re-watching both of the Enola Holmes movies, if one is craving for some Millie Bobby Brown's performance - that one was good. This one is not.

title: Barely watchable.
text: I think I already got angry and disappointed at the beginning of the movie. They know what they dealing with and they just brought that kind of army?I dont even think this movie is for kids because it is too gory for them. There are a lot more blood and injuries than I expected.The cgi is .. kinda a mess. Millie is alright but I dont particularly fond of the character. I like angela basset character the most, despite her lack of appearance. Im also surprised the love simon guy is there, as well as robin wright.And man... I do feel bad for the dragon. Especially when you consider the plot. Kinda unfair but then that ending was cringe... like urgh and the lack of attention to detail at millie's injury. It irked me.

title: So so. Not bad, but not great.
text: Here's the thing about this film, I just don't understand why it was made. The story is as predictable and cliche as it gets, you get most of the plot in the trailer alone and it just does not develop from there.However, a predictable plot can still work if the aim is action. Similar movie like The Princess with action pack fight scenes, martial arts, etc.. was shear awesome. Yet this film has very limited action scenes.Most of the film is about the main character trying to escape the cave. So is this a survival film? Not really. I guess the best way to describe it is that it is a fairytale, a fable, even. But if that is the aim, then again the plot must be the strength.So overall, I don't seem to know what is the point of the film and why it was made. The CGI is fantastic and the movie is filmed extremely beautifully and crisp. It is like a beautiful painting, but you just don't know what the painting is suppose to mean.5/10.

title: Don't mind the negative reviews. It a Great movie!
text: "Damsel" transports viewers into a captivating fantasy realm filled with enchanting landscapes and magical creatures. The film follows the journey of a courageous young heroine who embarks on a quest to rescue her kingdom from darkness. With stunning visuals and imaginative world-building, "Damsel" immerses audiences in a spellbinding adventure. The stellar performances of the cast, coupled with a compelling storyline, create an engaging cinematic experience that will leave viewers spellbound. With its blend of action, fantasy, and heartwarming moments, "Damsel" is a must-see for fans of the genre.

title: Boring, awful casting
text: Shohreh Aghdashloo's voice is painful to listen to as the Dragon and took me out of the movie immediately.It is an interesting premise, but wasn't executed in a satisfactory way.I like Millie as an actress, and there were some solid visuals, but only some as most was so dark that a lot of it was just just black - which isn't interesting at all.I did try. I just found it weak on many levels and not worth my time, at the end of it. I was left disappointed. I see many others found it to be lacking in smarts, in cleverness and so on. They just weren't impressed.It was an effort that came up short.

title: Nothing But Yelling
text: Screaming and scenes that are too dark to see. That's it. That is the whole movie. Screaming, crying, running, and the occasional wooden one liner that even a child could write.I'm not even sure there was a script or writers for this movie. We just get one word, caveman style (when there's no screaming) statements here and there. I know Millie is every young woman's idea of perfection however; she is not a good actress and cannot be relied on to carry a movie on her own. Especially when the script is a pile of hot garbage.This movie is relying solely on CGI and Millie's start power. It's got nothing else going for it. Avoid if you are not a 17 yr old.

title: For all saying "Dont waste your time", I decide on what to waste it, not you.
text: The movie itself is not perfect, clearly it is a formula we've all seen, but we need to accept that not every single movie has to be a blockbuster, this movie was good, The Dragon was one of a kind, yes it needed more work and this movie would've been perfect of they took time to develop everything, clearly the limitation of trying to fit a whole fantasy world in just an hour and a half, but it delivered and delivered good.So, dont let every person saying "Dont waste your time" affect you if you wanna give it a try, watch it and build your own opinion, some will love it, some will say its just good, some will say its meh and some will hate it, but let it be your choice, not a stanger's.For my personal opinion, Loved it.

title: Disappointed...
text: The trailer was intriguing and I thought the plot sounded interesting enough, but I couldn't handle the amount of grunting, groaning, and screaming from the main character(s). It was painful to listen to for over an hour, and so over the top when the dragon is supposed to be able to hear where she is at... she even says "be quiet, she can hear you" and continues grunting and yelling a few seconds later. There was too much that was unrealistic, illogical, or just plain random. This had potential to be a cool movie, but between cheesy lines, lack of depth, and excessive noises, it was a flop for me.

title: A Disappointing Dive into Mediocrity
text: Upon settling in to watch 'Damsel', my expectations, fuelled by the platform's reputation for delivering engaging content, were high. Unfortunately, the experience that unfolded was nothing short of a letdown, embodying the epitome of weakness in filmmaking and acting.From the onset, 'Damsel' struggled to establish a compelling narrative. The plot, riddled with clichés and predictable turns, failed to captivate or maintain my interest. It felt as if the script was an afterthought, lacking depth and originality, which made the viewing experience excruciatingly dull.The characters, who could have been the saving grace, were instead flat, unrelatable, and cringy.Princess Elodie's character development throughout the film was minimal, rendering the journey and struggle uninspiring. The interactions felt forced, and the dialogue, which aimed for wit and charm, often landed with a thud, further detracting from the overall enjoyment of the film.Is emotionally fake a thing?Visually, 'Damsel' did little to impress. While Netflix productions are typically known for their high-quality visuals and effects, this film felt lackluster. The cinematography was unimaginative, and the special effects, where present, did not meet the standards one would expect from a platform that has previously set the bar high.The soundtrack and score, often an area where films can redeem themselves, added to the sense of mediocrity. Instead of enhancing the emotional weight of scenes or elevating the narrative, the music felt disconnected and at times, intrusive.In reflection, the frustration of having invested time into watching 'Damsel' is palpable. The notion that time is a precious commodity we cannot reclaim feels particularly relevant here. My disappointment with this film is compounded by the fact that it represents a significant misstep for Netflix, a platform I had come to trust for quality entertainment.Please don't let a film like this get released without reviewing it thoroughly first.The only right thing about this movie was Robyn Wright.To reiterate , 'Damsel' was a profound disappointment. It serves as a cautionary tale of the pitfalls of lackluster storytelling, uninspired character development, and mediocre production values.For those considering watching it, I recommend setting your expectations low or better yet, choosing to invest your time elsewhere.

title: Most awesome dragon since Smaug
text: I just love this movie , it was nice to watch . And finally Netflix have made a real nice dragon since Smaug 😂.I don't understand the critics , Milly Bobby brown is amazing as Elodie. She is very talented.And if you read the book , they did a pretty good job in making a film out of the book , ofcourse not 100% page to page accurate, if they did that the movie would have been at least 10 hours long 😂.It's understandable if you haven't read the book as well. But I recommend reading the bookSo if you love the fantasy genre , dragons and power woman . This one is for you.I am.quite impressed on this Netflix movie.

title: "Damsel" is distress
text: "Damsel" on Netflix transports you to a fantastical realm inhabited by a fire-breathing dragon and a fierce princess, portrayed by Millie Bobby Brown. Sounds good, doesn't it? Sadly, the film never quite gets off the ground. With no unexpected turns, the narrative reads like a recycled version of well-known fairytales. All of the characters are quite uninteresting, even the evil Queen. The entire thing feels a little phony due to the excessive use of green screens, which overshadows some very amazing CGI moments in the otherwise mediocre special effects. Even gifted performers such as Brown are cast in shallow roles.Certainly "Damsel" could amuse you for the evening if all you're seeking for is something simple to watch with some action. Given that there isn't any really graphic violence and the plot is rather simple, it might also be appropriate for a family movie night with teenagers. If, however, you're in the mood for a complex, thought-provoking fantasy movie, you should probably search somewhere else.

title: The badass female lead is the new generic thing
text: Maybe the world had enough of these generic movies, making a strong female does not mean the movie is better.This movie is lacking creativity, it seems like the producers forgot that the characters are the core of the story not the fantasy elements.There was no depth in the characters, the story & the plot was one of the most basic thing I've ever seen, it's like the writers didn't even tryThey group up and decided that they will make a story about a dragon and they thought the best idea is doing a "you can do it girl" type of movieI left the movie without any strong opinion or feeling towards any character but Elodie's father because he was the most stupid character of them all.Maybe you will like the fantasy elements but I don't think you'll enjoy watching it.

title: Very predictable, very dull, very unconvincing
text: It was not as great as I could've been. The story is quite predictable and tries too hard to carry a promising storyline. It also tries to be smart, but the characters are very badly acted (this is not to say that the character Eloide isn't smart, compassionate and honest), and this isn't a personal attack on the actress who plays her, the acting isn't very convincing and Miss Bobbie Brown isn't suited for this role, for a fantasy story that supposed be set possibly in the 1800s, her face is too modern and would be a bit more interesting if the character is more soft and gentle looking. The casting directors should've been smart to cast the actress who plays the younger sister as the main character rather than Miss Brown. I know I'm no one to judge the actors, but maybe it's because MBB has a contact with Netflix so maybe that's why she was given the main character role, if casted better the film may have been better.

title: good special effects and plot
text:
The Damsel movie offers a captivating experience from the very beginning. It keeps the viewer immersed in a well-done, solidly developed story. Set in the medieval era, the story unfolds naturally and focuses on details. It provides wonderful landscapes, well-designed costumes, and special locations that transport the audience to another time
One of the highlights of the movie is the meticulous attention to small details, especially in the rich costumes that highlight the historical environment. Although the dialogues are scarce, the narrative is based on deep scenes accompanied by appropriate background music, which helps maintain the viewer's attention throughout. The well-executed gradual transition between the representation of the medieval era and the science fiction elements, gives the story originality and mystery. One of the most relevant and valuable aspects of the movie is the prominent role played by female characters.However, it is important to mention that there were some dark and prolonged scenes that make it difficult to see clearly. This may affect the viewer's experience. In the same way, inside the mountain, there could have been opportunities to explore more fantastical scenarios that could have enriched even more the second part of the movie.Highlighting Eodie's shining performance in the lead role, the movie captivates audiences with a combination of stunning visual elements and a satisfying conclusion to the story. In conclusion, this film is a work of art that delivers an exceptional cinematic experience.

title: 4 stars for Millie Bobby Brown
text: Millie Bobby Brown shows her talents once again, but that's not saving this awful movie.At first we are lead to believe that this is somehow a movie rich of lore and world building like Game of Thrones, but the "plot points" and "twists", both major ones are seen coming from a mile away.The fact that I could deduce the story very easily and then that's the end shows how poorly written this was.The cave scene was way too long, and the villain a Cersei Lannister wannabe who's twirling her mustache at you.Truly the poor mans "Hobbit" movie. One messy dumb movie with no real purpose. It's all been told, better, before.

title: Entertaining and unique twist
text: There were a few parts that I predicted what would happen but overall, I found this to be entertaining and a great fantasy film that shows what happens when a strong woman perseveres.I think one of the best parts, and some of what makes it so unique is not justing showing that a woman conquers just like the usual male fantasy heroes. Rather, it shows all the pain the character feels, and highlights the amount it affects her. It really lends impact to what it cost Elodee to continue and push through, refusing to be left behind or cast away for the sake of another's power aspirations.I would gladly watch a sequel of this move. Only 9 stars for the screaming and minor predictability.

title: clever story with potential ruined with propaganda
text:
What an interesting story with a twist in the core theme of the prince saving the damsel from the dragon! What a ruined potential adding those details that not merely entertain but also send the political message. What a pity to mix a fantasy medieval world with the contemporary american society and what an irritating propaganda to add all those details in attitude and behavior of the protagonists or just cast those actors that represend all kind of people and races of the modern USA with no practical reason or point to the narrative..
Well, the good things with this movie are the innovative story, the special effects, the nice performance of Millie Bobby Brown and the different environments the plot took place.The bad things are: The extraordinary strength and training required aspects that gave to the damsel. The non- realistic falls that should result in death that happened (or implied that happened again and again). The non-realistic (almost idiotic in terms of the choices the dragon did) fight between the damsel and the dragon. Escpecially in comparison with any other fight between the dragon and other protagonists or past soldiers. The interracial couples that were the norm in the movie. Instead of creating a kingdom of Asians for example, or black africans for example and suggest that different kingdoms of different races people coexist peacefully and the plot could invest on that aspect, if they truly cared in representing people, they choose to mix people in a hypothetical world that there is no specific homogenous kingdom in terms of race and that it's a mix of multicultural global society.Lastly, some details that posibly try to send the message, for those who take care in detail: The damsel transformed during the movie from a beautiful feminine typical princess (apart from the self-confidence and the doubtful spirit she used to be) into a fighter with masculine characteristics. She even cut her hair to declare that transformation, something that some women who become radical feminists are used to do. Another message is that: The dragon and the dark past that connects it with the kingdom (I don't want to spoil so I don't define more what I mean) is also redefined in the present but now with an excuse that a deal with the devil if it's meant to be for the good reason it's justified. Lastly, the damsel's transformation into .... (again, I don't want to spoil) reminds the choice of lonely women who reject the world and the norms of the society and choose their own path.I don't say that is a bad thing. Everyone makes their own choice and it's respected. I just say that a movie should be politically free and don't contain too much societal message. Especially movies that don't class in a social genre, but instead in a fantasy, medieval, science fiction, family destined genre. That's not ok. Even, if most people won't super-analyse all the above aspects, it's still annoying for the typical viewer and it's still obvious that something has changed the last decade and movies don't entertain, or at least don't merely entertain, but also they lecture and send political messages.

title: Boring and Predictable
text: I'm a huge believer in there being more original live action Fantasy movies not based on any existing IP.Damsel has some interesting ideas that could have led to an awesome Fairy Tale revenge story. The problem is that Damsel just doesn't deliver on any of it.The characters are all bland and uninteresting. Our main character is great at things because she just is. The plot is so predictable and boring with it using every trope imaginable. The dragon is not menacing enough and is also incredibly stupid. The acting from everyone including Angela Bassett is mediocre. Milly is literally screaming for most of the movie which got annoying quick.It's a dumb popcorn movie that doesn't overstay its welcome. If you got 100 minutes to spare then you can enjoy making fun of this movie. Shame that this is such a waste of a fantasy setting.

title: Better than the reviews suggest give it chance!!!
text: This is fun romp with some twists you don't see coming. Action, betrayal, revenge ish, amazing creature with a mesmerizing voice! Remember l the first time you saw Indiana Jones - oh I know where this is going - wait I didn't expect that! Millie plays a full formed female character in what you expect as a fairy tale but has so much depth. Yes, some of the other characters were one dimensional - remember the black coat wearing nazi in Indiana Jones? Same thing. But here instead of the male hero we get a smart, resilient, empathetic female hero who learns from what has happened to others and chooses her own path.NO IDEA why so many give it such low reviews. Is it the most amazing movie ever ? No. It is entertaining? Hell yes! It reminds me a lot of The Mummy (Brenden Frasher version) with its silliness and predictable plot but also with twists and a whole lot of heart!!

title: Don't waste your time
text: I've given this movie 3 stars for the dragon special effects and that's about all it deserves. It's an attempt at a fantasy story designed to appeal to a 'modern audience' which, given the endless stream of box office and critical failures being pumped out by Hollywood etc. These days, doesn't actually seem to exist. The protagonist, Elodie, couldn't possibly be saved by a handsome prince so she saves herself because she's a 'strong, independent woman' and girl boss. Each and every male character, however, is a lying and manipulative piece of crap. I'm so tired of this rubbish.Millie BB is great at crying in this movie and not much else and what Winstone, Wright and Bassett are doing in it I have no idea, other than sullying their reputations for a hefty paycheque.Seriously, don't waste two hours of your life to watch this rubbish.

title: Complete Rubbish
text: Complete DEI, badly written to the point of vomit, horriblly accented (some so bad it's beyond rubbish, like why bother to mix the accents at all) rubbish. Even Bobbie can't save this rubbish. The only authentic accents are the actors from Britain, otherwise complete rubbish. And all the beautiful cinematography can't help this rubbish.Complete DEI, badly written to the point of vomit, horriblly accented (some so bad it's beyond rubbish, like why bother to mix the accents at all) rubbish. Even Bobbie can't save this rubbish. The only authentic accents are the actors from Britain, otherwise complete rubbish. And all the beautiful cinematography can't help this rubbish.

title: Good, powerful film with GOT vibes
text: Really enjoyed this. I understand why people say its premise was obvious (you can get the initial plot from the trailer!) but it had enough twists and turns to keep you interest and rooting for the heroine. BB played it as if her life depended on it, which of course it did for her character! Took the usual fairy tale vibe and turned it into something much darker and more entertaining. Great effects, real jeopardy and an enjoyable film. Perhaps we have stopped just enjoying films for being entertaining, what more could be asked? I hope this signals more Netflix films to come that entertain and empower.

title: Intellectually unstimulating
text: In the realm of entertainment, delving into an episode of Xena: Warrior Princess unquestionably surpasses the experience offered by this particular cinematic endeavor - a lamentable concoction of a plot, void of ingenuity, merely a fusion of well-worn tropes with foreseeable twists. It embodies the epitome of mediocrity, a narrative that regrettably treads the well-trodden path of clichéd tales, lacking the finesse and originality to captivate. Alas, Damsel epitomizes the modern cinematic landscape, crafted by individuals who lack the passion and dedication requisite for true artistry in filmmaking. It has devolved into a mere industrial product, bereft of soul. As for its technical aspects, while production and acting suffice, the visual effects vacillate between adequacy and the reminiscent aesthetic of subpar video game cutscenes. In conclusion, Damsel stands as a monument to tedium, redundancy, and banality, bereaved of characters that evoke genuine empathy, for they are but replicas of replicas of replicas. The denouement, so painfully predictable, renders it nothing short of insipid: I recently revisited Krull, a film that shines brightly in comparison - it approaches the stature of Citizen Kane when juxtaposed with Damsel. The precise evaluation: 3.5.

title: LAME
text: Easily one of the worst movies I have seen in quite some time. I was expecting this movie too be some type of hybrid between house of dragons and stranger things with Millie staring.....not even close. I know it is syfy and therefore not realistic but the whole thing was just horribly made and truly unrealistic in the worst ways. The talking dragon was corny and a born and raised princess that could scale mountains and out run a flying dragon really made me throw in the towel. The acting was also out of control horrible. It was like Bridgerton with a talking dragon. Millie can do so much better and I am truly embarrassed for her.

title: Unexpectedly good!
text: I'll be honest - the ONLY reason I turned this on was because a bunch of men online were whining about female leads in fantasy, and specifically mentioned this film. "Oh, it's not because it's a woman, it's just BAD." Which we all know is code for "no seriously, women should only exist in film as eye candy." While I love Stranger Things, I've never been a fan of Millie Bobby Brown in particular - probably because I'm way older than her usual demographic. Still, I figured I'd thumb my nose at misogynists and give the film an extra view or two by having it on in the background while I did other things around the house.I was surprised to find myself quickly engrossed, and was literally on the edge of my seat several times. Aside from two scenes involving animals being hurt by the dragon (and MBB's flawless eye makeup throughout the film's entirety,) I have no complaints. If I were 25 years younger, I would be cosplaying Elodie at the next DragonCon. She's intelligent and determined, and with a depth I hadn't anticipated. Plus, MBB was amazing in this.Bravo. More like this!

title: Predictable
text: Yawn. Nothing exciting about this. It was watchable and the acting was good...Millie slightly overacted but I think that's her thing. But before I even watched it knew the ending. It's so predictable and it made it boring. I felt like I'd seen it before. I wondered if it was a remake of something? I don't think so but who knows. Are any movies original these days? What's left to make new movies about? Feels like every film that's made these days is a remake or an unoriginal one. It's probably because we've made movies about almost everything now so we're all bored. Nothing excites most movie goers nowadays. Especially not this movie. This didn't do it for me. Wasn't that exciting and I looked at my phone through most of it. 3/10.

title: Don't believe the hype!
text: Main character had a shocking accent and acting was poor! Altogether disappointing, the plot was obvious and there really wasn't too much else to the film. It felt as if even the actors felt silly working on this film. Couldn't even put this into the comedy genre as it was just so sad. I would advise not to waste any of your time watching this as it was a total cringe fest! I am struggling to write a meaty review as there was nothing to this film. It was simple and not in a good way. The other actors in the film made valiant efforts however this could not rescue the poor plot and I'm sorry to have to say, as I loved her in Stranger Things, but extremely disappointing acting from Millie Bobby Brown.

title: Very little redeeming qualities
text: This movie is so stupid it hurts. Logic is nowhere to be found. The dialogue is awfully written, and I'm sorry but I do not think Millie saved this at all. I find her acting obnoxious, and same goes for every other actor involved, minus the voice of the dragon. Every few minutes dumb decisions are being made, yet we are led to believe Elodie is "smart". She leaves behind valuable resources, constantly screams, doesn't know how to bandage properly, and only decides to get her hair out of the way in the last 10 minutes. By cutting it. Because apparently buns aren't a thing. Not that you should want to save your long locks at all cost but... Making a bun is a whole lot easier than cutting your hair with a sword. The only thing I liked in this movie is the betrayal of her new husband throwing her into the pit. That carried some emotion, despite the execution being lackluster. It would have been even better had the royal family not explained exactly what was about to happen word for word. Overall, I would skip this movie.

title: Netflix just following it's trend
text: Netflix is just following it's trend to make female centric movies whether it goes with the story or not. Here story was there for Millie Bobby Brown but making was horrible with poor CGI. No explanation of the back story. It is not a mythical story nor a Disney princess story. Rather trying to get something from everything like Game of Thrones. As they are doing good marketing people will increase the view count and Netflix may continue for another horrible episode for this useless story. If this came out in the theater I am sure it won't make even quater of it's budget. But here Netflix just pushing it to get view count. Don't waste your time on this.

title: Dull and unoriginal
text: A young woman, Elodie, meets a handsome prince and they fall in love. At their wedding it is revealed that the prince had more sinister reasons for courting her: she is to be sacrificed to a dragon that has been terrorising the kingdom. Elodie now has to fight for her survival.Fantasy dramas are hardly my favourite genre of film but I was looking for something light to watch and I spotted this. Turns out that it is light, to the point of almost having no substance at all.A fairly conventional swords-and-dragons type movie with a basic plot and average (at best) performances. Moreover, it all seems quite unoriginal - everything seemed like it had been done before. Even the dragon seemed like a perfect copy of the dragons in Game of Thrones!Millie Bobby Brown (of Stranger Things fame) stars as Elodie and if she was hoping this would launch her movie career, she's going to have to wait a while longer.

title: An extended Mac commercial
text: I love fantasy, I love dragons, I love a strong lead, I love decent cgi and photography, I love fancy costumes. This movie had them all. I enjoyed the royal grandeur and how elaborate the settings were. However it started off badly when I saw how much makeup the ladies were wearing, especially at the start when they are supposed to be poor and downtrodden, even down to the manicured gel nails which just didn't seem fitting for an obviously medieval setting. The acting is decent but the script is not. I knew the plot, it's not unobvious, but I just felt nothing for the characters. The characters had no depth and nor did the movie.

title: A Competent Fairytale of the Modern Era, But Ultimately Fails to Captivate.
text: The movie is beautiful to look at, both in terms of sprawling landscapes and the cavernous expanse of shadowed caves. Although it should be noted that both lean heavily on CGI, but nevertheless are skillfully crafted.The main idea of the story is that Elodie (Millie Bobby Brown) is not a damsel that needs saving. Rather she is a resilient, loyal, and compassionate woman thrust into circumstances beyond the realm of fair.The movie is at its strongest when Elodie and the bereft dragon share screen time together. It takes far too long for the central elements of the story to begin, and sadly relies predictably on common character tropes like a wicked queen, a morally torn prince, and a father who chooses wrongly before embarking on a redemption arc.For the age group this film is aimed at, I think they've done an acceptable job. Overall I feel this movie is a forgettable experience that can be enjoyed once.

title: Loved it
text: Predictable but I'm glad it ended the way I predicted. Otherwise it would've been a sucky ending. The effects were impeccable and I loved how they protrade the dragon fire, something to be reckoned with. Honestly a part 2 would kinda be cool as the dragon would be just over powered and nobody could do anything about it. How tf am I supposed to get 600 words in this review, damn. Glad I watched it and it earned number 1 on Netflix imo cause Netflix kinda has a sucky selection to begin with so this is easy a top 10 Netflix movie.
