The hate this movie warranted is kind of annoying to me people just like to hate these days I guess...

title: Clunky
text: Oh dear. This is a well meaning film but, at times, it comes across as a Poundland version of Game of Thrones. I'm not actually suggesting that it has stolen lots of plotlines from GoT but there are certainly similarities at points. Millie Bobby Brown, as usual, steals the show but I would like to see her stretch herself, at some point, in a more challenging role. She could play this part in her sleep. I'm sure this will be extremely popular with young girls who are looking for a sassy and determined figure as a role model, and so it should be. It's certainly not awful but it lacks any originality. It is well made and there are many worse films around, just don't expect too much.

title: Damsel in Distress
text: The first 20 minutes of this project are OK. It feels like a fast moving fantasy film of medium quality, with good visuals of castles, ocean voyages, and palace interiors. The acting seems forced, even by the skilled actors, but that bit of amateurish technique doesn't hinder the arc of the first segment.Then: SCREEEEECH! All of the film's intro segment skids to a stop when the Princess gets tossed into a dark cavern with a dragon. The next hour and a half is her stumbling around in the dark, in sequence after sequence of boring and meandering attempts to escape. It was so dark and pointless I lost all interest in how the film turned out, and fell asleep several times to the sounds of 11 doing her Stranger Things cry for help (which is a MUCH better project in every way).When I awoke there were some bad CGI segments of the dragon, and then PUFF! It was over. It leaves you wondering if the production ran out of money or something. In sum, this odd Jeckyl and Hyde mash-up doesn't work and should probably be avoided. Stick to the fantasy classics that all have great stories and consistent momentum.

title: What a princess fairy tale should be...
text: If only I had been given a fairy tale princess like Elodie when I was growing up. A woman that didn't need a prince to save her and her family, but instead had a dragon to help her do the job.There is far more to love about this movie than there is to poke fun at. Damsel took those contrived fairy tale tropes of a female in peril and completely flipped the script. Elodie had herself, her smarts, and her ability to feel empathy to rely on. Not to mention a stepmother who was the complete opposite of what that character has been portrayed as in every fairy tale ever. And a family that was imperfect, yet still cared about one another, even to their own detriment.I loved how this film both fit the bill for a classic damsel in distress set up, but also broke every single one of those rules. The dragon was very reminiscent of Lord of the Ring's Smog, but more evolved and able to overcome prejudice, a truly incredible character in it's own rite. And Elodie was so badass I just immediately wanted her and the dragon to become bff's.I also loved how Elodie became a princess version of Sarah Conner. Plus, I'm a big fan of the usage of bugs as a night light, reminiscent of the film Pitch Black, which also had a badass leading lady at its center.I'll put this film up there with Hulu's The Princess, which yes, I also enjoyed. How wonderful is it to think that this young generation of females growing up is being given princesses that don't need to be saved, but instead do the saving. I'm truly jealous and awed. Lucky them.

title: Better than I thought it would be
text: Damsel from Netflix is a movie mostly aimed at a teen audience but is watchable for all.I'm not a fan of many fantasy movies and I was very worried that this would be a woke awful film when my missus suggested watching it as she's a fan of dragons and stuff!I have to say I was pleasantly surprised.The dragon in question was very well rendered and genuinely nasty and angry for good reason.A good 20 minutes could have been shaved off though to make this a more rip roaring adventure.Millie Bobby Brown does a fine job with what script and direction she is given but a bit more of a fight with the humans would have been great.Overall a six means it's watchable if you're bored and stuck for things to watch.

title: waste of time
text: Honestly, I run out of adjectives to define the films they make on Netflix, I can't believe that someone who is supposed to be a screenwriter makes these films, but the worst thing is that a director, who has good films, agrees to direct such a thing, Having said that, I don't know how to define it without using bad words, I'm left with the expression "waste of time", predictable, unspeakable, with script errors, etc.It's my fault, for paying attention to certain critics, it seems like they are paid to give a favorable opinion of a film, otherwise I can't explain how the criticism can be so different from what I see, but what I said, it's my fault for giving More opportunities to Netflix, one day, they will do something decent, even if it is by chance.

title: Starts great for 10 minutes
text: Let me start by saying that this movie starts off really well. The views, the music, the characters, and the overall production is beautiful. I would say the first 20 minutes really reels you in, and then things change drastically. If you enjoy a girl running from an angry talking dragon in a cave, then this movie is definitely for you. The talking dragon for me was just so awkward and ruined the entire film. To have full blown conversations with a dragon was probably the worst idea you could have ever come up with. Robin White MAY be on screen for 10 minutes total, which is quite awful seeing as she played the part so well with Cersi vibes. Stay away from this movie, it's awful, predictable, and boring.

title: Cringey, predictable, and some weird mistakes
text: The entire time Millie had full glam on, even while struggling in a cave. It looked distracting in many scenes as if they're constantly trying to make her look sexy despite what she's been through which takes you out of the immersion. At some point around the end, they swapped the side where the scar on her chest was supposed to be in the cave versus at the castle scene, showing continuity issues. There was even a scene where a servant was talking the previous princess around 13:30 into the movie without moving their mouth. There was really no character development throughout the entire movie. The ending went downhill and was cheesy. The flame dragon was defeated with flames. Every princess survived a major drop from a crazy height. Plot armor was thick, and there was lots of plot holes too.

title: Predictable and mediocre
text: This film was recommended by a friend who never recommends anything to me concerning films. I decided why not and watched it.It was a bit below average and predictable. The special effects were decent and where a large portion of the budget went apparently.Some of that money should have been spent on the script.A king desperate to save his kingdom agrees to hand over his oldest daughter's hand in marriage to the prince of a kingdom offering enormous compensation. From the beginning this deal stunk from the way the future mother-in-law treated the bride's stepmother to the cryptic mention of rituals at the nearby mountain.Angela Bassett and Robin Wright are A-listers given very little to do in the means of great lines of script... That's a waste of talent and this movie could have used them better here. 'Damsel' lacks any surprises so having these two interact more with better lines would have been more than welcomed.Millie Bobby Brown was miscasted as the lead - she simply didn't give that great of a performance. Stiff, one note and inadequate.No spoilers here - you don't need any once you get through the first 75 minutes.

title: The dragon is great
text: The story moves along, but it's very predictable. The set up is interestingly told, but interest declines rapidly after the wedding. After that the movie is a survival story, and aside from wondering what obstacle will pop up next, I was simply admiring the graphics of the dragon. In fact, although the heroine does demonstrate an evolving set of survival skills, the dragon is the most complex character here, actually evolving with experience. And extremely well drafted and acted.I guess the idea here was to underline that women can succeed despite an intimidating environment, but Angelina Jolie is more successful in that objective and more entertaining as Lara Croft in Tomb Raider.

title: Too much screaming and groaning
text: If you can put up with MBBs constant screaming,it's an unoriginal CGI laden piece of nonsense.The story is a reuse of many films like Brave.But again the screaming and moaning from the lead, together with her semi-narrative script has you wanting the dragon to put us out of our misery.Not sure who the intended audience was but certainly not worth the time.Shame really as the trailer hooks you in.I haven't seen any of the Enola Holmes movies but can only imagine if MBB adopts the same approach to them, then I would struggle to watch them.Maybe someone should have spent more time and effort on the dialogue.

title: Amateurish, unsure what it wants to be
text: The premise sounded interesting but the special effects were straight out of the 1950s. Actors bobbing on fake horses for closeups, ships with no wake, and waaaaay too much gold paint. Add to that the stilted acting, awkward plotting, histrionic speeches-somehow the pieces did not fit together for me. The feminist theme came late and seemed tacked on so it was difficult for this viewer to work up any enthusiasm. Sorry but I was really excited to see this film, being a fan of Millie Bobby Brown. I perhaps expected too much and was disappointed. That griffon-like dragon was exceptional, however.

title: The Makeup is so disctracting
text: Her makeup is so distracting, im not sure why they allow this knowing that this is not a modern setup. Yes she was slaying on that makeup but its ruined & distract me and i cant be serious while watching!Her makeup is so distracting, im not sure why they allow this knowing that this is not a modern setup. Yes she was slaying on that makeup but its ruined & distract me and i cant be serious while watching!Her makeup is so distracting, im not sure why they allow this knowing that this is not a modern setup. Yes she was slaying on that makeup but its ruined & distract me and i cant be serious while watching!

title: Pretty but underwhelming
text: I adore fantasy films. Not this one. Millie Brown has a lot to learn when it comes to acting. She wasn't bad by any means and of course part of her performance is partly to be blamed on the director. However, she wasn't great and was barely good, particularly towards the end of the film. Such as when she was confronting the queen in front of the 3rd sacrificial bride. It was straight stupid, poor writing and ignorant direction on performance.As for some of the comments on 'moderninity', I typically only view that with ethnicity (forcing different skin shades where they don't belong). Yes, there were 2 'out of place' black characters but you have to remember, this is a FANTASY land. It has a totally different timelime and happenings than our own. I personally didn't have any issue with any of the cast in that sense because this movie is not claiming to be historically accurate. I like Angela Bassett but I didn't care for her in the role she had, she is far too strong of an actor to be playing a character that, essentially, is weak. Not to mention it's a small role and she deserves bigger and better. Yes, I know she chose to take the role.The CGI was really goos, I could only notice a few things that were a little blurry or otherwise not perfect, but ultimately it doesn't matter because I can't remember what they were the next day. I enjoyed the dragon having a slightly different form to traditional dragons. She was by no means the first of her design but it was refreshing to see something different, yet not ridiculous, that wasn't limited to video games. The voice actor was a good choice, obviously feminine but still held the weight of a large, not-to-trifled-with beast with some gutteral sound.I hated the visions of previous princesses, it really took me out of the moment. I think this would have been better as a short series and probably would have enjoyed it much more. A shame they went for the short movie time instead, really takes away a lot of opportunity and visual growth. I will never watch it again, and while I gave it 4 stars I would recommend it to anyone interested in fantasy.

title: One of the worst fantasy movies.
text:
This movie is a colossal disappointment in the realm of fantasy cinema. From start to finish, it's a chaotic mess of clichés and lackluster storytelling. The characters are one-dimensional, the plot is predictable, and the special effects are laughably amateurish. The dialogue feels like it was written by a high school drama club, and the performances are wooden at best. It's clear that the filmmakers had no idea what they were doing, resulting in a film that's painful to watch. Save yourself the
"Damsel" is honestly the worst fantasy movie I've seen. It's like they took every overused fantasy idea and mashed them together without any creativity. The characters are so dull, you'll find yourself rooting for the villain just to spice things up. And don't even get me started on the plot-it's so predictable, you'll know what's going to happen before it does. The special effects are a joke; I've seen better on YouTube videos. The acting feels forced, like the actors are just going through the motions. And the dialogue? Let's just say I've heard more natural conversations in a kindergarten play. Save yourself the agony and skip this disaster of a movie. You'll thank me later.

title: I wonder how I would feel if I watched 'Damsel' as a child, but as an adult, it is a mediocre one!
text:
I am not a fan of fairy tales, but I do like modern twists on them. Damsel tells the tale of Elodie, the princess of a faraway kingdom, who gets duped by her fiance, who throws her into a cave as a sacrifice to a vengeful dragon. What happened next? Why did they do this to her? Did Elodie survive? The answers to these questions form the rest of the story.I did like the pacing of Damsel; It did not take a long time for us to get into the story and Millie is a fine actress; She shows a great deal of emotions on her face, which are compelling and fits the rebellious nature of Elodie. CG was stunning at times, glitchy at other times, but appreciate the effort put into it.Characterization and storyline is a huge 'meh' for me. The screenplay is an ancient cliche, you always know what's gonna happen next and like all other fairy tales, Damsel does not differentiate much between its characters. Every one has two-dimensional traits.Damsel is also a women-centric movie; In the sense, men don't play much part in it. The protogonists and the antagonists are all women. Felt like I was watching an Indian drama, to be honest.To conclude, Damsel could be a film you watch to pass time on your weekends but it does not leave an impact. On the other hand, the film might be a little scary for children to watch.VetrrichChelvan
NETFLIX170324.

title: A captivating story because Elodie has an intense aversion to death
text: For those of us who love fantasy and the acting professional by the name of Millie Bobby Brown, this Netflix film is for you. Damsel (2024) A dutiful damsel agrees to marry a handsome prince, only to find the royal family has recruited her as a sacrifice to repay an ancient debt. What makes this story captivating is that the character Elodie, played by Millie Bobby Brown, has an intense aversion to death. Elodie embraces her destiny as a member of the royal bloodline, but her life is not solely determined by the existence of dragons, royal families, and obedient villagers. This movie plot is the quintessential story of a hero's journey with her family, royal bloodline and friends by her side.

title: Disappointment
text: After watching the preview, we had high hopes for this movie. Our excitement quickly fell flat with a slow start, predictable plot and poorly written script. The storlyine was nonsense and the characters lacked in believability. My husband generally loves movies with dragons, based in medieval times. His attention was lost within the first 30 minutes of the movie. He was able to predict all of the intended twists and turns far before they could even happen. The heroic scenes quickly turned corny and disappointing. We watched with hopes that it would redeem itself, but unfortunately It was not worth the time it took to watch.

title: Drivel
text: At no point does it work the imagination. I have seen far better performances from some of these actors and this feels more like a "day at the office". From trailer to tail end it is a bit of sugary gum that rapidly loses its flavour. I get that a lot of these tales have been hashed and rehashed but the production money could have been better spent and the attempts at the subject matter themes better explored. Indie films and streamer series are doing a far better job on lower or similar budgets. If the people making these movies don't push boundaries for something fresh and insightful then they are going to keep producing the same drivel - probably not what they envisioned when they entered the industry.

title: Phenomenal Movie
text: Don't listen to what others are saying about this movie giving it low ratings. This movie was a gem and I was easily watch it again and again.Shoreh as the dragon, she did an outstanding job! Millie did an amazing job as well. Both were fantastic in their performances. Honestly, everyone did a great job!The designs of the costumes were also absolutely amazing, same with the scenery.I'm not sure why people are giving this a low rating? Yes there's female empowerment but it isn't made political. And Millie's character wasn't a mary sue either.Great film! Only thing I can think of is a few errors here and there but nothing huge. Like Elodie being too loud in some scenes and bsing confused as to why she didn't try to be silent? And some other things i could nit pick but nothing major at all.

title: Damsel? More Like Abysmal
text: Netflix keep on pumping out these crappy films. This type of thing has been done a million times over now. A princess marries a prince, things go wrong and characters get betrayed, oh but now we have a female version of Smaug the dragon.The writing was all over the place and made me zone out on a number of occasions. Characters are written paper thin, one has a change of heart completely out of nowhere.If you want to watch a damsel in destress who actually kicks ass I would recommend the far better film "The Princess" starring Joey King, it was much better than this weak effort and has tons more action.

title: Long, slow, dark, boring
text: I'm not going to say the special effects aren't pretty good and the acting is mediocre, but you are constantly waiting for something to happen and even when it does, you are waiting for something else to happen, this movie is long, dark, slow and boring and nothing of surprise happens and nothing of consequence happens, it tries to subvert expectations, but it is the epitome of everything that the message wants you to know, man is bad, women are strong and powerful and murderous dragons can be forgiven. The plot plods along and things only happen because the movie needs them to happen, and incredibly diverse pile of crap.

title: Great fun for 10 year olds
text: I am a big fan of Millie Bobby Brown and Ray Winstone, so I had really high hopes for this film. However, we were left really disappointed. Our overall feeling is that it is a great film for 10 year olds.It's very stylish and visually stunning but the dialogue was very stilted and sometimes childish. Even Millie enunciated her words so much that it was if she wanted the aforementioned viewers to understand every syllable she spoke! She reminded me of Emma Watson/Hermione in HP and the Philosopher's Stone.Then there was the over styling of the bad ass Millie, cutting her hair (all done without a mirror in sight!), evenly ripping her dress.... and so it goes on.As I said, great for kids but not mature adults.

title: I was scammed into watching this
text: I got tricked into watching this by seeing all the headlines about what an amazing movie it is and how it's one of the most watched films on Netflix etc. Needless to say this is one of the worst movies I have seen recently. Millie Bobby Brown's acting is cringe and her character is totally boring and uninteresting, the writing is cringe, the plot is cringe, the characters are boring and over all the only positive element in the movie for me was the pissed off female dragon. If you love fantasy storytelling with dragons and knights and stuff like LOTR, you are gonna be disappointed. If you're thirsty for a high fantasy movie, choose something else.

title: 1.5 hours you'll never get back
text: Millie Bobbie Brown screams for 1.5 hours. That is honestly the majority of her 'lines'. Her character makes little to no sense and the plot itself is the kind of storyline you write for year 8 English class. The acting from the supporting cast is questionable (don't get me started on the prince's myriad of weird accents).It they had taken the time to just add 10 more minutes to the set up, we might actually care about any of the characters, in reality, you don't care if any live or die.Costumes are pretty for a fantasy and the SFX are good for the budget, that's why it's gets 2 stars instead of 1.

title: Watch On - Drakon (2015) instead
text: If you want a short review - just do yourself a favor and watch the film this was clearly heavily inspired by instead. Or at the very least watch it first. It surpasses this one in every single aspect and has one of the most beautifully portrayed romances I've seen on film.That being said, I gave this a fair shot, even though I knew it's going to follow the girl boss formula I despise.The set designs and especially the costumes were pretty great, the music was beautiful and Shohreh Aghdashloo's voice acting was superb as always.I found the writing pretty weak, they kept missing opportunities for an emotional punch. The acting was a bit over the top from the 3 main female characters and on a personal note I don't like Millie Bobby Brown's breathy deliveries in particular.The violence felt out of place somehow... I'm not sure how to explain this, but it felt like it's gritty for the sake of being gritty and it took me out of the movie rather than reel me in in some satisfying way.Overall, It's a decent time waster, but there are so many great movies to spend your time on instead.

title: Great fantasy movie
text: I didn't know what to expect from this movie but it was definitely worth watching. Probably girls will love it more ( the female protagonist is the hero).The starting is so visually pleasing ( the gowns, castle, scenery). Millie looks exceptionally pretty with brown hair.The action is good. VFX are great. Storyline is solid. It's like a new version Disney story, where the female lead is bold, smart and strong ( damn, the crystal climbing looked tough: inspired me to start doing rock climbing). The cinematography is perfect.It is not that childish and I think even adults would enjoy it. Overall a nice fantasy watch.

title: poor adaptation of the book..
text: Only after the movie I looked on the internet, according to netflix where the movie is... it turns out that it is a trilogy of books, which could have turned into at least an average movie or quite a good trilogy, but the creators lacked the will to try to make a corresponding movie or the story was rejected.the first 20 minutes of the film tries to engage or interest, and then the average or lackluster special effects catch your eye and you immediately feel that it is no longer a story telling, but just a rush... is the film worth the cinema? I doubt it.. is it worth your time? A lot like the fast x film, because the effects and quality are quite similar... the first 20 minutes of the film tries to engage or interest, and then the average or lackluster special effects catch your eye and you immediately feel that it is no longer a story telling, but just a rush... is the film worth the cinema? I doubt it.. is it worth your time? It's a lot like the fast x movie, because the effects and quality are quite similar...

title: Had potential
text: I seen the previews and was intrigued. A lot of big actors were in the film and only those big actors seemed to carry the weight of the movie on their shoulders. Millie Bobbie brown is overhyped and unfortunately drove my rating down. Her accent wasn't consistent and every line she said was flat. Her facial expressions also did not match what kind of girl she was supposed to portray. Millie has never been that great of an actress to begin with and this just drove it home for me. Unfortunately the other actors do not appear in the movie much since it is about the damsel. So much potential only wasted with subpar acting.

title: To those asking how can dragons burn in their own fire. Well, how do you think dinosaurs died lmao dumbo?
text:
Loved Millie's acting. People just hate when its a female protagonist movie. Like if you hate some movie, why else would you feel the urge to come on IMDB and rate it as worse, knowing that no movie can be that worse. Just to kill others motivation and do critics. Go rate those stupid spiderman movies that I didn't even enjoy at 15. This movie was so much better than horror movies at scaring me. It has all the genres: adventure, horror, romance, politics, fantasy, drama, thriller.VFX: 8/10
Bg score: 10/10
Millie Bobby Brown: 10/10
Stepmother shown trustworthy which is unlikely : 10/10
story: 8/10
execution: 7/10.

title: Nobody has standards anymore
text: It's always very funny to me how people would trash talk movies but still give them high ratings.The setting of the movie is nice. Very good CGI work here. Angela Bassett is just 'the appearance' in every movie.As far as acting goes, it's not bad but.... Meh. Not much acting needed in those shallow scripts and that's what you're getting.But there's a massive problem I have with movies that are supposed to be medieval. WHY ARE THEY WEARING FULL FACE MAKEUP!?!?!?!? And they don't even hide it. The main character has a full smokey eye, lip gloss and bright pink lips..obvious blush and highlighter. Not even mentioning the bleached wite teeth everyone is spotting. Like, oh yeah we don't have running water but sure, makeup and high profile dentists are just... Heavenly sent I guess.Yes there was light makeup back then but NOT to that extent! I just don't know why they try to fool us.. Maybe because they can right.We don't want pretty, we want actors who can act.So overall, it's okay for what it is. No need to watch it, just run it while you're doing other things.

title: Miss Brown: I'm so sorry...
text: We were looking forward to a good adventure story with Millie Bobby Brown given her performance in previous shows, especially Enola Holmes. She did her best with this lame body slamming and useless exertion filled story. This cast was a wealth of female talent portraying characters in a weak excuse of a movie.If you can tolerate movies with shallow dialogue, a lot of pain and screaming, pointless "trying to escape scenarios", and countless injuries that are ignored in order to undertake the fighting, running around, and hiding scenes, then give this show a go.For me, this was one of those shows that I 'just wanted to end already' once the Damsel started her 'distress' journey.

title: I'm not sure what everyone else watched but this is one of the better action movies this year
text: Not sure why the bad reviews this movie actually has some heart to it. In fact, I'd say Netflix is stepping up their game on quality. Compared to what's showing in theaters at the time of this writing(3/11/24). You're better off staying in with some popcorn and relaxing on the couch in your own home because this is actually entertaining.No spoilers but the trailer pretty much sets up the story. However the third act reveals a pretty satisfying conclusion and I found myself rooting for the dragon. All is not what it seems in the land of Damsel but you'll enjoy a pretty decent ride finding out.

title: Well that was a bit crap. But alright if you need something mindless
text: Crap script, average acting and pretty predictable plot. The sets, costums, scenery and CGI were really good though.Slow build and lame character development for the first 30mins. So many holes in the plot and unexplained bits of information provided. The father daughter (whole family) relationship could have been developed so much more and actually made you sad/interested when stuff happens. No idea what was up with her original mother and the story behind that.Corny ending and no real explanation as to what's going on now that she's saved the day.If you've seen the trailer you've seen the movie lol. Sorry. This was easy to watch if you're bored, but not recommended.

title: Not great
text: After recently watching Enola Holmes 2 I was really excited to watch Millie in this. However, I was somewhat disappointed. It felt like the movie was written around Millie, and as great as she is, it just didn't really work.It lacked excitement, and quite honestly it was boring. The viewer got what they wanted in the end, but it was too drawn out in the beginning, especially since most of us knew where it was going from the trailer. The dragon, however, was great and pretty freaky!I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone. It's really not that good, it's worth using your time to watch something else.

title: Only made it 15 minutes
text: Is this the way of the future? I endured 15 minutes of this CGI monstrosity and can only wonder if this is how all future movies are going to be made. Every single second of the 15 minutes was CGI. How do these top-notch performers endure the agony of acting in front of a green screen? Please PLEASE bring back real action with real props using real scenery. What happened to the wild beauty of New Zealand where LOTR was filmed? Or all that we got to enjoy of Surrey, England while being enchanted by The Princess Bride? Are such natural wonders gone forever? Might as well just go ahead and CGI the performers as well, watching real people against CGI backgrounds is just not enjoyable.

title: Yelling Actors and Cool Effects
text: Alright, let's dive into this movie review. Picture this: you're settling in for a cozy movie night, hoping for an engaging story with some stunning visuals. But as the film unfolds, you quickly realize there's a major hiccup-the protagonist's constant screams. Seriously, they're relentless, and it's like nails on a chalkboard throughout the entire movie. Now, I'm all for adding suspense and tension, but this just feels overdone and takes away from the overall experience.But hey, it's not all doom and gloom! Despite this glaring issue, the movie still manages to hold its own thanks to its original concept. I mean, kudos to the writers for thinking outside the box and bringing something fresh to the table. It's definitely a breath of fresh air in a sea of predictable plotlines.And let's not forget about the special effects-they're nothing short of spectacular. From jaw-dropping CGI to heart-pounding action sequences, the visuals alone make it worth the price of admission. Seriously, there were moments where I found myself on the edge of my seat, completely immersed in the world unfolding before me.So, is it worth a watch? Absolutely. Sure, the constant screaming may leave you with a headache, but if you can look past that, you're in for an entertaining ride. Just be sure to bring along some earplugs, because you're going to need them!

title: Wonderful!!! Bravo, Millie!
text: This movie is an absolute masterpiece! I am portuguese and was thrilled to know they were filming in Portugal.The movie photography is excellent, the plot is very good and the performances are amazing.Millie resembles a younger Natalie Portman, both in beauty and talent. Either it's as Eleven, Enola or Elodie, she always delivers in her acting!I loved the main character's strength, determination and courage!Also, don't want to spoil the film, but there's an amazing plot twist regarding the Dragon and background story.I honestly recommend this movie, thank you Netflix for giving us great content as this! Bravo!

title: Dark Fairy Tale in The Upside Down
text: I watched the whole thing and it held my attention, but only a 5 star in my opinion. Worth at least 5 stars because it stars Robin Wright and Millie Bobby Brown. Observations: Costumes like The Princess Bride, Robin Wright's character meaner than Claire Underwood in House of Cards, Millie Bobby is pretty much Eleven but older and more shapely. The cave - where most of Damsel takes place - seems like a knock off of The Upside Down. Throwing in the ghosts of previous sacrifices is a convenient way to check off the diversity requirements. I did not give up on it and turn it off, but it sure could have used more of a plot.

title: Damsel 2024
text: This movie was EPIC! The dragon was extremely detailed and visually stunning! The acting was great the storyline was thorough and in the end one does live happily ever after... even if it takes a fire breathing dragon to get there! The only thing I would have changed is that the prince actually go down in the cave to save her and they revolt against the evil queen! Best nextflix movie of the year so far! Definitely needs a part 2 for sure! The dragon needs a story maybe she can have more children and find another group of dragons like her to live with instead of being lonely. Now that's adventure!

title: Hollywood needs a vacation!
text: I don't know what is happening lately but it's just disaster after the disaster of movies that come out of Hollywood. Do they all need a break?! This new addition to the series of "blockbusters" is astonishingly plain, full of cliches and zero depth. The cast was a good one, so I ask myself was that production made, because they had some money to spend, didn't want to overwork themselves and had some free time to offer??? This movie felt more like the final semester project of a film school graduate than a real Hollywood production. I am quite sure that my eleven years old niece would be equally amused with how shallow this movie is as was.

title: Screamfest
text: I mean, it's not that bad - it's a fairly decent fantasy story, dragons and all. Some evil queen, some brave heroine, some bad decisions and sacrifices, some victorious riding into the proverbial sunset in the end. It's not that bad.At the same time, it kinda is - most of the emotions are conveyed via screaming (or last-breath-panting), most of the action is secondary and uninventive, most of the character choices are questionable at best. And actors don't seem engaged much into what's happening (or perhaps what's happening is not much to engage with) - it looks more like a inexpensive theatric play rather than a movie, despite the actors' potential.I'd not recommend this one - it's not even entertaining, unfortunately. I'd rather suggest re-watching both of the Enola Holmes movies, if one is craving for some Millie Bobby Brown's performance - that one was good. This one is not.

title: Damisel vs Dragonheart.
text:
==================
Pros
==================
-It's entertaining
-Good decorations
-Good photo
-Good costumes
-Good locations
-Good CGI
-The Voice of the Dragon is played by a good actress with a very identifiable voice played by actress Shohreh Aghdashloo.==============
Cons
==============
-It is predictable
-The king of the kingdom doesn't matter. Not a single line of dialogue
-The role of the King falls to the queen.-The protagonist does not stop screaming in the cave.-The main character ends up being RAMBO.-The male characters have flaws, and are treacherous.In Damsel it tells a story of betrayal and revenge. Not a hint of optimism. Dragonheart is much more sentimental, Featuring a rogue dragon, who gives his life to save the kingdom. Quite the opposite of this movie. As for the Damsel soundtrack, it seemed generic to me, while the Dragonheart soundtrack is very good.

title: The movie wasn't good ?
text: Tbh you would have to have to have a few screws lose to think this movie is amazing it's at best a mid story telling movie and the acting from most of the cast mainly Millie brown was Terrible and i don't know why she did so poorly like I know she can act stranger things have proving that but I'm trying to Decide if it was her acting or the writing that made it bad the only reason why I would say it's mid because the dragon didn't look bad and the voice actor for the dragon did amazing I wish I could give it a higher score but we can't let netflix keep releasing these half ass movies/shows, like what a joke ?

title: Awful rip off
text: Lord of the rings, game of thrones rip off - fantasy novel stuff but without the incredible classical knowledge of Tolkein or intrigue of Martin. They should stop making this kind of film, nobody will do it better than Peter Jackson now so why bother.From the first scene, where some knights go fight a dragon (who of course breathes fire) wholly unprepared, it's just a let down. All too obvious. At times it resembles a TV movie, there's no quality.Millie Brown does her usual 11 from Stranger Things thing, the standing and screaming act which she's perfected but there's nothing else to it.I lost interest half way through.

title: Genuinely underrated, I don't think I've ever seen a more visually stunning or empowering movie in my life!
text: I absolutely ADORE this movie... the CGI, the soundtrack, the plot, and everything about it is so powerful. It swayed my emotions and really tug at some personal places in my heart where normally nothing can touch. The sounds practically thrummed in sync with my breath and pounded against my lungs like a heartbeat. It really saddens me to see people overlook the movie and have such negative feelings about it. Sure, this movie did have a few parts where I cringed a bit or was slightly duller than other scenes. But like all the other wonderful movies out there, despite being very unique, they all have one thing in common. Like all the other masterpieces to ever have been born in history, there are always flaws or mistakes. Whether if they're small or little, there is something bad about every movie. And that's NORMAL. I know this review may sound really cheesy or overly exaggerated, people need to understand that there is no such thing as someone or something being perfect. People really need to also view the things about the movie through multiple lenses. If you look very closely, there are lots of deeper meanings or multiple meanings about something. There is also LOTS of symbolism involved. I would say a lot more about how amazing this movie is, but there are infinite things about it and there is way too much for me to talk about. Thanks for reading, and I'm wishing ever single one of you the best in life!

title: Might be great if...
text: While I understand the director's intention to immerse the audience in the realistic darkness of a cave, as depicted in the movie, I believe there's room for a compromise that enhances the viewer's experience without sacrificing authenticity. The primary issue lies in the film's excessively dim lighting, which, although atmospherically accurate, hampers the audience's ability to engage fully with the visual storytelling. It's a movie, after all, and a certain level of visibility is essential to connect with the characters and understand the narrative.The scene set in the dark cave could have been an excellent opportunity to use creative lighting techniques to suggest the environment's gloominess without plunging the entire scene into near-total darkness. Subtle illumination, perhaps mimicking the faint glow of bioluminescence or the soft gleam of a distant light source, could have provided just enough visibility to keep viewers invested in the unfolding drama.Moreover, the sound design, while clear, left me straining to associate the noises with unseen actions, breaking the immersion that visual storytelling offers. It's crucial for a film to balance its auditory and visual elements, especially in scenes where the setting plays a pivotal role in the narrative.In conclusion, while I appreciate the filmmaker's commitment to creating an authentic and immersive environment, I believe a more nuanced approach to lighting would greatly enhance the viewing experience. It would allow the audience to remain engaged with the storyline and characters, even in a setting as challenging as a pitch-dark cave. The essence of cinema is to show, not just tell, and finding that balance is key to crafting an unforgettable viewing experience.

title: Big budget, big names - pathetic movie
text: I watched this with my son tonight. We were laughing a lot. Basically, every 4-5 minutes one of us would say "do you really think they will ... no, can't be, it's way too obvious / cliche" and then it happened. The story is extremely simple, the acting is not existent, CGI is poor / exaggerated, the whole movie is completely predictable. Very poor choice for Milley Bobby Brown to star in this movie. Her father-king's performance is the worst ever. I completely agree with people that wrote this had better been directed by AI. The plot is just so stupid. It's 1 hour 47 minutes too long. Stay away!

title: Millie's performance as Elodie in 2024 "Damsel" is rather annoying and grating.
text: Directed by Juan Carlos Fresnadillo, "Damsel," the 2024 fantasy adventure, is a movie that's difficult to pin down, both in terms of genre and quality. It's one of those films that, despite its ambitions and a sizable budget, seems to fail in execution, leaving audiences scratching their heads as to what exactly they've watched. Audiences are invited on a captivating journey filled with a talking dragon, regal families, and the sonic enchantment of Hans Zimmer. Yet, it leaves audiences to be in distress and unamazed rather than in awe and astonishment.First of all, let's address the dragon in the room-literally. Yes, "Damsel" includes a dragon that speaks. Now, in the world of fantasy, dragons that talk aren't necessarily a deal-breaker. However, in this film, the decision feels as if the creators threw darts at a board of fantasy tropes while blindfolded. The dragon's dialogue does become more coherent as the plot progresses, but its initial introduction is jarring and unfortunately funny, leaving viewers to wonder if the film is intentionally leaning into absurdity or if it's a misstep. Moreover, the CGI used to bring this dragon to life is, sadly, not up to par. The CGI rendering in "Damsel" still grapples with occasional disparities, as certain scenes suffer from a noticeable lack of visual refinement. Despite the technological advancement right now, the portrayal of a talking dragon reminiscent of early video game graphics, remains an uninteresting choice. The creature's design is less 'majestic' and more of like a 'lackluster Komodo dragon'. It's unfortunate because the dragon is pivotal to the story, yet it lacks the visual appeal one expects from such a mythical creature.Millie's performance as Elodie is annoying and grating. While she brings her face card to the role, her tendency to default to shouting is a choice that quickly wears thin. The overreliance on shouting to convey urgency or distress becomes annoying over time. That's not to say she doesn't have her moments, however, her portrayal could have been more effective. The movie feels heavy-handed and unnecessarily verbose. The dialogue succumbs to overexplaining the situation, undercutting the film's visual storytelling and downplaying the audience. Instead of allowing the audience to engage with the film's world, the dialogue spoon-feeds information, stripping away any sense of discovery or wonder. This tendency to over-explain is perhaps most obnoxious when Elodie spells out her observations, literally. In a particularly on-the-nose moment, she points out "crystals" and a "bird" to an extent that feels unnecessary. Even her uttering the letter "V" as she sees the name "Victoria" written on the stone is very unnecessary. It's as if the film doesn't trust its audience to understand the plot or the setting without a constant explanation. This choice not only disturbs the overall pacing but also negates the potential impact of the visuals and the performances.The film's narrative is a patchwork of concepts that appear intriguing on paper but are poorly woven together on screen."Damsel" seems to struggle to find its identity, unable to find a consistent tone. Is it a children's movie? A dark fantasy for adults? It tries to be both and ends up serving neither well on both demographics. The darker elements feel out of place in a movie that also includes scenes clearly meant to be whimsical and lighthearted. This tonal disconnection results in a confusing experience. The strategy to be ambiguous, at times, results in a narrative that lacks a defined direction. The dialogue's shortcomings are a significant factor contributing to the film's crisis. It's a script that can't seem to decide whether it's aiming for the simplicity required for a young audience or the sophistication that might appeal to adults. The result is a mishmash that's unlikely to fully satisfy both audiences.The musical score, crafted by the renowned Hans Zimmer, introduces a symphony that struggles to integrate with the film's overall ambiance and atmosphere. The composition occasionally borders on obtrusive, disrupting viewer immersion rather than enhancing it. It's a rare misstep for Zimmer, and one can't help but wonder what drew him to this project. Overall, the movie's threads come loose in nearly every aspect. The CGI fails to dazzle, the dragon's dialogue and design are distasteful, Millie's performance is marred by an over-reliance on shouting, and the narrative is a jumble of confusing elements. Even Hans Zimmer's score, which one would expect to be a redeeming feature, ends up feeling out of place.Lastly, the ending of "Damsel" is as predictable as it is cliché. Without spoiling too much, the film's conclusion leans heavily into the 'Mighty One' trope, even cheekily nodding to the "Game of Thrones" series by making the main character "the mother of a dragon" or in this case, "sister of a dragon." It's an ending that could have used a twist or a more original resolution. Instead, it opts for a safe, familiar wrap-up that leaves no lasting impression. In conclusion, "Damsel" is an odd film that never quite finds its footing. It's a mishmash of ideas that could have been something special had they been executed with more care and cohesion. In the end, the movie is an uneven ride, occasionally entertaining but mostly perplexing. It's a fantasy film that's unfortunately more forgettable than fantastic.

title: Enchanted Ambitions: 'Damsel' Weaves a Tale of Beauty and Disappointment
text: In the realm of cinematic storytelling, the fairy tale has long been a fertile ground for exploring the complexities of human nature and societal norms. "Damsel," a film that attempts to subvert the traditional narrative of the damsel in distress, is a bold endeavor that both captivates and confounds.The film opens with a promise of enchantment, as we're introduced to Elodie, portrayed with a blend of innocence and fortitude by Millie Bobby Brown. Her journey, ostensibly to find love and save her family's dwindling fortunes, quickly becomes a quest for survival against a backdrop of betrayal and draconian tradition. The visual splendor of the film is undeniable, with lush landscapes and a royal court that dazzles the senses. The costume design is particularly noteworthy, with each stitch and hue contributing to the film's fairy tale aesthetic.However, the film's ambition is not matched by its execution. The narrative, while initially engaging, soon unravels into a series of predictable plot points. The attempt to modernize the fairy tale with a twist is commendable, but the film struggles to maintain a consistent tone, vacillating between a serious critique and a light-hearted adventure.The supporting cast, including Ray Winstone and Nick Robinson, deliver performances that range from compelling to lackluster. Winstone's portrayal of Lord Bayford is imbued with a gravitas that anchors the film's more fantastical elements, while Robinson's Prince Henry lacks the depth necessary to make his character's actions believable.The film's central conflict, involving a dragon that serves as both a literal and metaphorical obstacle for Elodie, is where "Damsel" shows its most glaring weaknesses. The creature, meant to be a formidable foe, is rendered with computer-generated effects that fail to convince. This, coupled with action sequences that lack tension and originality, diminishes the impact of Elodie's struggle."Damsel" does succeed in moments where it allows its heroine to shine. Brown's performance is the film's saving grace, as she brings a tenacity to Elodie that is both refreshing and inspiring. The scenes where she employs her ingenuity to overcome challenges are a testament to the character's resilience and the actor's skill."Damsel" is a film that reaches for the stars but falls short of its lofty aspirations. Its visual beauty and strong lead performance are overshadowed by a faltering narrative and underwhelming effects. It stands as a reminder that even the most well-intentioned tales require a steady hand to weave their magic effectively.

title: A thrilling experience.
text: "Damsel" is a unique fairytale movie that deviates from the traditional plot of a prince charming saving the day. A fresh twist on a classic fairytale! Millie Bobby Brown shines as Elodie leading the charge, this movie transforms a familiar genre into a unique and exciting viewing experience.Initially, "Damsel" may seem to follow the typical fantasy and adventure storyline, offering a narrative of heroic quests and bold rescues. However, it quickly diverges from conventional tales, immersing the audience in an ominous and captivating story. Elodie's progression, from agreeing to what seems like a harmless marriage proposal to discovering she is a pawn in a dark scheme to settle an old debt of a royal family, unravels with unyielding speed and tension.Millie Bobby Brown gave a remarkable, compassionate, and strong portrayal as Elodie, blending empathy with a vigilante-like determination. Meanwhile, Nick Robinson's performance as a prince struggling to break free from his family's traditional values and sense of honor enhances the overall impact of the film.What sets "Damsel" apart is its bold deviation from the traditional fairytale storyline, despite its self-aware disclaimer, 'This is not a fairytale.' The presence of a dragon, appearing both authentic in its depiction and mythical in its being, acts as a strong symbol for the obstacles and monsters encountered on the journey towards liberation and self-discovery. This fantastical element anchors the storyline in a timeless conflict, blurring the boundaries between reality and fantasy.The movie's downside is the inconsistent CGI used throughout the film. Apart from the predictable storyline, the film is quite enjoyable. Overall, the film's direction and cinematography are carried out thoughtfully and skillfully, resulting in a captivating and enjoyable visual and storytelling experience.In conclusion, if I could watch this movie with the same awe and wonder as I did the first time, I would, because it was absolutely breathtaking. I totally recommend it!!

title: Predictable and at times laughable
text: Lots of the film I found to be quite predictable with obvious twists and narrative developments, it seems to follow the same ideas of many recent films having the female lead have skills and resolve that don't quite make sense to the backstory given.But if you like boss lady action movies this is indeed the movie for you, you will get a kick from her badassery and men being a moronic and stupid evil force we need to destroy.Many plot holes, plus cliché scenes make the film unenjoyable to watch but enjoyable to poke fun at.Over all I do not recommend this to guys but to a female audience it might be pretty good.

title: Definitely worth a watch
text: Don't understand the low ratings, the movie is pretty decent. Loved how the damsel in distress fights her way out with fearlessness and kindnessThe story and screenplay, both are good. Nothing extraordinary, but the action, immersive world-building, thrilling action sequences make Damsel a must-watch for fantasy enthusiasts. With its enchanting visuals and satisfactory storytelling, it delivers an exhilarating journey from start to finish, leaving audiences eagerly awaiting the next installment. I won't be surprised if they plan to make its sequel.Overall the Damsel's journey that's as enchanting as it is thrilling is a good watch.

title: Decent But Wants To Be, "Game Of Thrones" So Bad
text: It was a decent ride but unfortunately, there were no twist or turns that I did not see coming from a mile away. I predicted nearly everything that took place and it ended exactly the way I knew it would. I tried to create, "Game of Throne", vibes but kinda fell flat. There were also some things that didn't make much sense, i.e. The messages. Several plot holes and logic issues as it pertains to this. Aside from this, the girl kept exposing her location every five minutes because of all the noise she made. She became very irritating to endure due to her stupidity in not understanding the value of being quiet I wanted to scream at my laptop. Ridiculous. If I never watched this movie, I would've missed nothing but I'll also say, it's not horrible. I just felt like I was on a flatline plateau for the entire movie. There was no climax for me since I predicted everything including the nature of the bugs. Saw that a mile away too. 😒

title: I frickin LOVED this.
text: 47 year old bloke here, and I thoroughly enjoyed this.In this era of DEI, ESG and that W-word, people (including myself) have been decrying the hijacking of popular franchises in an effort to drive an agenda. We say, "Make a new IP! Don't ruin existing ones!"Well, here it is. And you're all still complaining.Is it flawless? No. The pacing is too rushed at times and the father's lines at the beginning were lacking. But those are super minor issues - the cinematography, the dialogue, the motivations: all great in my eyes. Most of it was logical, except for the delayed "lie" discussion which I'll give a pass for.The cast was excellent with a couple of weaknesses.The protagonist *develops* and *grows*. She faces challenges and overcomes them. The start shows she has character and why she has some muscles - the rest comes through the story.I put this on par with "Snow White and the Huntsman" and "Maleficent" in terms of enjoyment and fantastic creativity.I loved it, and I hope there's a sequel.

title: Ok for kids, but a bit lame
text: I don't know why I watched this, it looked like a fantasy film not a children's fantasy film.It's very predictable. It has a very brave princess, a dragon that misses the main character every time, lame men characters that can't stand up to their mothers or consider sacrificing their kids, nice ending, nice generic cgi, not awful but not really a film for adults.To be fair it's typical Netflix nowadays output. Looks like it was written by junior staff following guidance from a spreadsheet or by people who really don't care anymore. Or AI.I was playing on my phone to be fair.YawnYour ten year old daughter may love it though.

title: It's All A Lie !
text: I usually don't spend time on this type of movie and I summarize 2 hours in 10 minutes and I don't have a special opinion about it...I believed that maybe this content would be independent of attracting viewers and selling tickets, and I would be entertained; Or Millie Bobby Brown shines like Stranger Things, but no! It didn't happen. Arrogance, talkativeness, unclear purpose, and the story is based solely on a legend without support, it has made a difficult path for itself and is not attractive at all... The dream has a limit and it should not be too far from the expectation!!!!! AhhhhhhA story with teenage content and often simple for general understanding (teenagers) that may not affect a viewer of the best series and movies of the century!I recommend you run away from this attractive banner and thriller and go to other works in the world of movies and series.

title: Millie Bobbie Brown is making even stranger things!
text: I gave this movie two stars because, up to the point when the damsel is put in distress, I was enjoying the movie. It became quite predictable pretty quick though. And just plain dumb! Throughout the whole thing I was yelling out for script changes and better editing! I mean, who let this crap out the door??? I am so sorry that Millie, Robyn, and Angela made this movie. Their acting was pretty spot on, as usual, but the directing was just lousy, which, in turn, casts a bad light on them! It's not fair to them! You know, I really wish I would have listened to my gut when I came across this movie and not turned it on. I think I would have liked a political documentary more, and I despise politics! It was just bad.

title: Back to a world of fairy tales .
text: Long time when I have seen a good fantasy movie and those are always my favourite genre . The story is close what I read and heard when I was a kid so it made it extra special . Costumes , music the actors and the CGI work well together. Was nice to see Hans Zimmer name on production list . Have a proper storyline and visually very detailed. The costumes are absolutely stunning.I don't expect too much from a fantasy then a good and evil fight which I'm getting it . Fantastic entertainment for a family which I've been missing since The Hobbit. Money well spent . Acting was my least favourite still good though but went beyond of my expectations.

title: What happened?
text:
You lost me in the first 10 mins. Had a few drinks then sat down for this pile of garbage. Watched the whole thing but couldn't tell you what the movie was about. Was it Dragon heart but lamer? Don't bother watching this one 👎
Although I did have a pretty decent nap during this one. So all around it's still a -2.3 rating. Good for the background noise to help with insomnia or other sleeping issues. If you're looking for a good movie this is not your choice. I've watched some horrible movies and I will watch them again. This one I will warn people not to watch. Even better I will never utter the words of this movie that I have forgotten the name of while writing this right now.Rum rules! This movie drools 👎

title: Beautiful and tragic - and Games of Thrones-esque
text: Ok, first thing's first: yes, Damsel quite obviously is inspired by and even borrows direct shots from Game of Thrones. Putting it here up front because it's apparent from the start that the director is enamored with GoT. But, if you can get past that...Damsel is a tragic requiem for girlhood, and a beautiful tribute to womanhood. It subverts trope after trope, carried on the back of one of the finest actors of her generation in Millie Bobby Brown, and manages to genuinely surprise at least twice. It's the reverse of a fairy tale - the prince does not get the princess - and a reverse of so many similar fantasy movies - the heroine does not "save" the day.The music is exceptional, the special effects are above average, and there is one scene that will pull tears from your eyes. Overall it's a little rushed and there are a few clear continuity errors, but for a movie where there is essentially one person on screen for 80% of the runtime, it works really well. Credit to Millie for her ability to play fierce and vulnerable at the same time, especially with the after-effects of dragon fire.Highly recommended for those of you looking for something just a little bit different. International Women's Day indeed.

title: "Prey" Does it Better
text: If you want to watch a movie with a female lead, in unexpected danger battling a monster, then watch "Prey". It does everything better than this movie. Better writing, better story, better acting, and in my opinion better action and visual effects.The premise of this movie seemed interesting, and there are parts that I enjoyed, but as a whole I would not watch it again. I think the weakest part really was the writing. The dialogue in most scenes wasn't very good, and the structure/pacing of the movie didn't keep me interested. Even the ending wasn't very satisfying.Watching this also made me think of "The Princess", a movie about a captured damsel who has to fight her way through her captors. That movie had HORRIBLE dialogue, but at least the action was fun. "Damsel" has better writing and acting, but less compelling action.Like I said at the beginning, I think if you want a more enjoyable experience from a movie, watch "Prey".

title: No character build up
text: I do not know how Elodie got her perseverance and endurance which showed in the scenes on the cave. All I know is that she is cutting woods that may have made her strong.Elodie definitely did not get her attributes from the father as the father got a weak personality. If the movie had flashbacks on how strong willed Elodie's biological mother and how her real mom have trained her then it would have been such a nice story. The story focused on the cave wich shows how intelligent Elodie is yet never that these traits were developed in the story.I watched it because I like Enola Holmes that made me assume that this has a good story too.I like the action and they were perfect.

title: This is how movies should be
text: Netflix made a whole W with this movie. It's creative - has its own story, which wasn't made before or did in so many different ways you could tell how it would end, or be bored to watch. The story could get a bit deeper, some dialogous could be longer to build out connections, but besides that they were really good and good to understand. Also the visuals were stunning, and I heard that the landscape of the kingdom is actually real, which shows that this movie doesn't need endless CGI to work, showing the love made to this movie. Millie B Brown did a really good job with her acting, would say one of her best performances, while she did her stuns by herself. This movie wasn't just made, it was made to entertain and getting our interest. I would've thought it would be a characterless/pointless feminist movie, but it also came out on womens day, but it DIDN'T.Don't listen to people who talk bad about this movie, it would be boring or not original. What many people forget is that a movie needs to get into the story, and just telling is boring to some, but the visuals make it also really interesting. So give it a chance and you will enjoy it!

title: Slow Start - Good Middlepart - Bad Ending
text: The movie started off rather slowly and then became exciting towards the middle as the (relatively predictable) story gradually built up tension. During the middle of the film, the entertainment is quite good, but towards the end, what was until then a well-made film suddenly turns into a kind of one-man-army show, which doesn't fit with the previous narrative style or the plot and tends to become somewhat ridiculous. Once again, a Netflix series where many opportunities were missed, since the foundation of the film was actually quite entertaining and good up to the middle, but then it was continued unimaginatively.

title: Nothing happens. Like, at all.
text: You can watch this movie in 4 minutes. Mostly, for the campy costumes. Nothing happens, at all. It's so pointless, fake and boring, not even someone like me, who absolutely loves fantasy, could find any redeeming qualities - the acting was sooooo bad. The cliches, the insanely predictable plot, even the ending was stupid. What a waste of money, to make something so lame. Whoever thought this was some grand lesson in emancipation of a sassy teenage girl (played by an actress who seemed to think she doesn't need to do anything other than show up and look bored), must have been aiming at 9 year olds.Really, if you never see this trash, you'll not miss anything. It's Eragon level bad.

title: Fantastic Fantasy Movie
text: I went into this not 100% sure what I was expecting, but this was incredible. The setting, the costume design, the set's and visual design. It was visually stunning. Millie Bobby Brown was the perfect damsel/heroine to this story, delivering a fantastic performance both alone and with her co-stars.The story was dynamic, with the subtle build up and tension overlaying the fantasy romance start shifting into the fantasy adventure that makes up the rest of the movie.While the eventual resolution of the movie is a little predictable, that's not a bad thing. The ending was set up by the beginning, and was incredibly well executed. It didn't need a twist ending, only for viewers to watch the story and follow it to the payoff. It was dramatic and well executed and wonderful to watch. The whole movie fits this description.

title: Ok for a Sunday afternoon... just
text: Another 'had all the right ingredients but didn't deliver' film.Overall this film gets a pass just because it's a some what enjoyable fantasy adventure.But it is barely scrapes through getting that pass.First off, this is painfully predictable. If you don't have the entire plot figured out soon into it, then you mustn't have been paying attention.The acting and dialog is so bad and cheesy it's laughable. Which is quite surprising considering some of the cast. Seriously, it feels like amateur hour at times.All in all, it's poor attempt at a fantasy action adventure.So if you have absolutely nothing to do on a Sunday afternoon and want to switch off for a couple of hours, then sure, this will pass the time. Just don't expect much.

title: Very entertaining!
text: It really surprised me and it kept me entertained the whole time which is what I was looking for a rainy Friday evening. Much better than I was expecting.Although I'm not a huge fan of Millie Bobby Brown her acting was on point this time. And the rest of the cast was great as well.Maybe I would have ended it in a different way but at least it was an end that I definitely did not see it coming like that.I liked this one more than the Enola Holmes ones and I would say that is one of my favorites movies about dragons so far.Also the directing was good and the effects were really good too.I highly recommend it.

title: A nice popcorn fantasy movie
text: If you're in the mood for a classic fantasy escapade with dragons, action-packed sequences, and medieval landscapes, then Damsel might just scratch that itch. It's a decent addition to the genre, delivering exactly what you'd anticipate, albeit with some flaws.In terms of performances, the cast delivers an okay rendition. Millie Bobby Brown shines, though her penchant for screaming might test your patience. Angela Bassett, while undoubtedly talented, tends to lean into her signature style a bit too much, resulting in a performance that feels more suited to theatrical performances rather than on the screen.Visually, the CGI holds up, seamlessly blending into the fantastical world without becoming distracting or unintentionally humorous. However, the story is of the standard hero's journey with only minor deviations from the well-trodden path.Overall, it's a serviceable fantasy adventure that provides a decent amount of entertainment, even if it doesn't break any new ground. If you're a fan of the genre and in need of a popcorn-worthy escape, it's worth a watch. Just don't expect any groundbreaking revelations along the way.

title: this is not fantasy
text: Yea for me this is just the typical trash horror/action creature chasing its victim kinda movie with a dragon, and its an insult to fantasy fans to call it a fantasy movie just because it has a dragon.And the movie itself has nothing really to offer, compilation of cliches we already seen a million times, dull and very predictable, i guess its made for those who play movies on the background while they scroll their phones and at the end of the movie they gonna tell you that its very good.My point is if you are a real fantasy fan, dont waste your time with this, calling this garbage fantasy is missleading.

title: Not worth spending time on
text:
Nice made and the music and effects too, but the plot and storyline totally lacks credibility, so in short - not worth waisting your life on...
The movie starts out strong - but most of the movie takes place within the dungeons of a mountain with a highly in all ways unrealistic enviroment like healing worms who also serves as light. And while screaming and groaning through all the mazes in stead af being quiet and silent - the dragon cant seem to hear her anyways - and after having spent days of climbing trying to escape - when her father comes down to rescue her - she returns back in few seconds - in short YAWN.....
Too bad cause its well made and well played but the storyline sucks....

title: Yep. A 10.
text: I gave this story 10 stars for 10 reasons.It didn't try too hard. It didn't have to. It stems from a simple story, yes, but the twists and turns were the perfect amount and way to keep us guessing. And the story has the right amount of depth. Interesting and not confusing. And you'll care about the story and characters.Every actor was exactly right. No over the top drama. The right ppl were the right amount of emotional at exactly the right times. They didn't force us to know their motives or showboat a specific trope of personality, which is so correct and breath of fresh air. And no one over acted. All the actors did an excellent job!The cast was perfect.The dragon was a multidimensional character and not just a terrorizing creature. And her voice(can't remember the name of that phenomenal actress) was perfect.The main character is portrayed throughout with a particular character trait that I don't want to mention here but it played absolutely perfectly for such a remarkable story arc.I love a movie that takes what seems like a simple story - and keeps it simple. I know that seems weird. But though it's simple - it is 100% not like anything else. It wasn't slow. It wasn't shallow. It wasn't trope-filled. This is the kind of movie that I would actually like to see a sequel of.Millie Bobbie Brown just brings it. She must be a strong person because she shines as a strong brave kind intelligent hero.The story also wasn't convoluted by a narcissistic director. Those ppl like to put it so much extra fluff to draw out a timeline and this director refrained from doing so. They knew they had just the right amount of everything for a good film. And that it's a perfect example of a good film it gets 10 stars.I truly enjoyed watching this film.

title: Oh, come on!
text: Watched this with my 13 year old daughter. Being a Millie Bobby Brown fan, a Stranger Things fan, and a 13 year old girl, she gave it a thumbs up. That's your target audience - others need not apply.I shouted "Oh, come on!" at every derivative plot point, bad choice, and impossible action. Others have detailed them, so I won't (except to add that humans typically can't fall more than 20 feet without breaking a bone. Just sayin'.)To be fair to my daughter, she shouted at the main character to stop screaming and wailing, understanding it was very unwise under the circumstances, so she wasn't completely taken in.We watched this right after Spy Kids, one of my daughter's favorite movies, which just served to underscore Damsel's lack of pacing, intelligence, and wit (and Spy Kids is no Oscar contender.) But for MBB, she was willing to forgive most everything. It was an action adventure with a powerful, intelligent female lead, and for that I give it 3 stars.I award a fourth star for a stepmother who loved and cared for her stepdaughter. That was the one refreshing, innovative note to the story.Another reviewer said there will "defiantly be a sequel." Yes, I fear that's exactly right.Now perhaps I'll see if my daughter will rewatch Ever After or Princess Bride with me.

title: Movie for all of ages and specially for GOT(Game Of Thrones) lovers
text: This movie shows the life of a girl whoc becomes princess after his marriage forcefully. The girl who known as "Elodie" in this character. She throws into a beast cave. Now this story shows, can she alive with this. You will be shock with every scenes of this movie. I see this girl last time in the godzilla movie. Millie Bobby Brown who act into this role and her acting skill is next level into this. This girl means Millie Bobby Brown famous for fighting role. In the last Godzilla - King of monsters also shows this. This Damsel movie also shows a dragon and it also remain me for some GOT too .

title: It will not blow you of the chair
text:
But its a good movie
Perhaps its for the younger ones, an excellent family movie for everyone, no blood , not to scary or violent, just in the middleGood parts,, CGI effects are actually pretty good, dragon look like dragon, knights looks like they should and fire looks real , good computer work, acting is also goodBad parts,, the story is horrible, it feels more like a goodnight story made up when its told and its a bit stupid aswell, lots of holes and shortcuts , predictable and simple,, its very netflixisticBut its ok , you can slow watch this with one eye , no shamepillow infront of your face, its just ok.

title: A Generic Fantasy Film
text: Damsel is not raising the bar at in the Fantasy Film genre. Instead what we get is a very generic and predictable fantasy film. Millie Bobby Brown is a very talented actress and has showcased her talents in a lot of great things. This just happens to not be one of them. Watching Millie Bobby Brown here you can tell she is doing this film because she was probably under contract with Netflix. Some of the shooting locations looked pretty cool but the CGI dragon lost it's excitement after a while. Trust me there is a lot more exciting fantasy films out there that do a much better job then this. Damsel gets a low 4 stars out of 10.

title: Beautifully filmed but generic story line
text: The costumes and setting are so well done and all the actors did a good job. But, the movie is very generic. I think they were trying to go with a new thing by capitalizing on this idea of a damsel in distress. Very commendable, but it made the plot easy to figure out and that means it's just a run of the mill movie. But, the dragon looks amazing! And Millie Bobbie Brown does not disappoint in her role. She's a strong female character and does bring out the inner strong woman in all of us.If you want a fun movie, this isn't a bad way to go. But, I just wouldn't expect anything out of it. It's one of those that you might have up while doing something else.

title: Boring and poorly written.
text: I was intrigued by the trailer and was hoping for it to surpass my expectations. Unfortunately, after watching the film (In parts, couldn't give it a straight viewing) I was left with a harsh blowout.I'm game for the fantasy genre. I have been introduced to it in recent years, and ever since then I have invested my time in watching different films, shows, games and even books, most of which are pretty good. In this case, I find that Damsel is a derivative, boring facade of a film. Having little to nothing to show for it other than a castle and a dragon.Most performances here I found to be either over dramatic or choppy and robotic. Nothing really felt authentic. Millie Bobby Brown stars as the lead, and she's fine in regards to the rest of the cast but still isn't good enough to salvage this film. I like Millie and I think she has wonderful performances in other projects. A lot of scenes here had me feeling like I was heading into a side quest in an open world RPG game, that's the vibe if you catch my drift.Visually, for a Netflix production this film looked good. Some of the wide shots with the castle were stunning to look at as well as shots with the mountain. The dragons CGI could have used a little bit of touching and sharpening but overall was solid.Damsel to me was missing the magic that fantasy projects so dearly need in order to draw attention. I want to be invested in the plot and to be taken on a journey. I want my curiosity to sparkle and here it just didn't. I did not enjoy watching this film and would recommend you spend your time and energy elsewhere.

title: Fantastic
text: Don't listen to the bad reviews. I don't understand how some people are giving it a 3 star, clearly they are wanting a love story? Who knows! Personally... It's actually a really good action movie. Its an all star cast and you never know what's to happen next, decent fairytale story with a great twist and at times keeps you on the edge of your seat or even holding your breath and staying silent along with the movie.Millie Bobbie Brown is just absolutely stunning in this movie and makes a fantastic and smart heroine who uses her wit and initiative to find her way through. I really hope they make a second one.

title: Disappointing is an understatement
text: I really wanted to like this movie. It has a good cast and the premise, while nothing new, has potential to be really good.Instead, the movie doesn't use those brilliant actors to their potential, tries too hard to be too many things at once, and convolutes a simple, fun premise in an attempt to give it a twist even though it lays it out within the first few minutes.The actors do the best they can with what they're given, but the writing is clunky and the characters aren't even cardboard cutouts because cardboard has more depth to it. That is a real shame too, because of the caliber of actor they crammed into those paper-thin roles. I feel like they could have saved on their casting and put that money into other areas where it needed it like the CGI.Millie Bobby Brown really tries to elevate this but there's no real progression or growth to her character even though she's on the screen for like 95%of the movie. She goes in as a smart, stong-willed, independent, female protagonist and comes out the exact same just with shorter hair. Even her wounds are conveniently healed almost instantly, so there's never really much of a struggle or danger that isn't resolved within a few minutes. Of course, that's what happens when you try to cram the premises of multiple stories into a movie with a shorter runtime than most of the movies it's ripping off.There's a few scenes of pretty settings, and the costuming is well done, but then it dives into a dark soundstage with mediocre CGI that just underwhelms.
