The CGI just seems to suffer even more when the dragon is no longer hidden in the shadows of its own cave.For the sake of spoilers, I'm not going to really discuss the ending other than to say that it may have been the most disappointing part of all.If you can ignore the mediocre script, paper thin plot, even thinner character depths, lackluster CGI, and have never seen any of the classic fantasy movies this tries to be, I guess it could be ok. Unfortunately, I've seen so many movies that did better at all the things this tried to do, so it severely paled in comparison. I'm giving it an extra star because I do appreciate it trying to bring a strong female lead to a genre with nowhere near enough of them, I just wish they had done a better job with it.

title: Lacks depth, lots of missed opportunity
text: I don't often say this, as trailers have gone downhill lately, but the trailer for this was more interesting than the movie.The movie was visually striking and the acting was decent but it lacked both character and plot development. We learn almost nothing about the main female lead (even though I had hoped her passion for mazes would lead somewhere) nor do any of the other characters have much depth.As for the plot, it's overexplained and too simple. The moral of the story is black and white the whole way through without any captivating grey area, which is a huge missed opportunity when you think about the nature of sacrifice and the motivation behind most of the characters' actions.Overall it needed more complexity and nuance. I finished thinking "meh".

title: The essence of "damsel in distress"
text: I love this movie. I understand the critics, but for me, it is a brilliant movie, and I'll explain why.The "damsel in distress" trope is one of the oldest narratives in human civilization, recounted in a million variations over the last few thousand years. Yet, we've never seen it portrayed in its most essential form in a movie. Of course, we've encountered many variations-stories that are more complex, set in different times, and different environments. However, these adaptations never captured the true essence of the story, because no studio had the courage to present the foundational tale in its simplest form, which is, of course, straightforward as a nail. Not a complicated story, but the real, original, simple one.I believe this movie presents us with the original version that was born in the early humans' minds as a tale, nothing more. That is why I think this movie occupies a niche of its own.The scenery is breathtaking, with wonderful performances by Millie Bobby Brown, Ray Winstone, and Robin Wright. The dynamics are thrilling. And the story is simple as a nail, which is something we could never fully appreciate until Damsel.

title: It's boring and predictable
text: Everything that happens is so predictable it really feels like a copy of a normal fantasy film with dragons.I had seen some of the promotion for this movie and it looked good so I decided to give it a try even though it was a Netflix film. I should of listened to my common sense as the movie was bland and unoriginal, even though it had a promising story you realise as the film goes on that it's just one of those predictable dragon fantasy films.I thought the acting was okay, i always think Millie Bobby brown puts in a decent performance in most of her films and the rest of the cast was alright. The cgi in this film was decent especially for a Netflix movie where it is normally below average or downright terrible.Anyway i rated it a 5/10 because it's nothing special. I would not recommend it to anybody cause to be completely honest it's a waste of time!Thanks for reading.

title: Very Entertaining
text: An interesting twist on ye olde damsel in distress genre. Excellent dragon animation with Shohreh Aghdashloo's voice, a perfectly angry mother growls her rage. Maybe all those corsets and hoops and bric-a-brac would break the girls' falls but from that height doubtful. Okay, it's a fantasy anyway. All the moms in the story are greater actors than the quality of their parts or lines. The wardrobe had some very fine, luxurious detail. The imaginary landscape shone in verdant splendor. But the ocean scenes needed to be less calm for the size of the vessel they sailed. In all, very entertaining although not unpredictable.

title: That is one struggling dragon.
text: Elodie (Millie Bobby Brown) is convinced by her father Lord Bayford to accept the proposal to marry Prince Henry of Aurea. This alliance would help her people to come out of poverty. However Elodie's stepmother realizes the true colors of the Queen of Aurea but Elodie sticks to her decision. The post wedding rituals shocks Elodie as she thrown down a chasm which is also a dragon's lair. How Elodie survives the dragon and what actually is the truth behind that sacrificing ritual forms rest of the story.Damsel is in distress but the story soon runs out of gas. It starts of as any fantasy story and the narrative is highly predictable. The problem is it barely gives the high of a survival thriller and the tense moments are as generic as it can get. The hopes the talking dragon create is thwarted in the third act where thr bland reveal and Elodie going all out female Rambo on the dragon fails to leave any sort of impact. Visually the film is passable for a Netflix film but for the starcast they had, a better screenplay was definitely needed. I am just going with a lenient rating for the shorter runtime and the glowing bugs.

title: Fantasy about a princess battling a dragon is a mindless action piece.
text: 4 out of 5 stars.Damsel is a good dark fantasy film that takes Millie Bobby Brown into a gritty role of battling a dragon. Definitely not an ordinary fantasy story of a princess marrying a prince and they save the kingdom together. It has a twist. And a dark one at that. With the prince and his family sacrificing every princess into a mountain. Where lays a dragon that is bent on revenge against the royalty family.The plot was okay. The script is a bit cheesy with the narrative in the beginning. The visual effects are okay worthy. The action sequences is also okay as well. Nothing too epic to make it memorable. The acting is a bit stale with the cast ensemble. Performances were flat that made it seem like it should have been buried in the mountain.The film spends most of the second act with Mille Brown hiding in the caverns and trying to escape the mountain. The film does provide a bit of mindless thrills if you could put aside the cheesy acting and iffy script.

title: Has the right ingredients but unfortunately fails to deliver
text: A disappointment.'Damsel' has the right ingredients but unfortunately fails to deliver. Millie Bobby Brown leads the cast in alright fashion, her performance in the lead role is serviceable. She is probably the only positive that I hold for this 2024 film sadly.My main negative is the special effects, which are quite distracting throughout - barely any of it comes across as convincing. The dragon looks OK, but the way it moved sometimes didn't seem right. Speaking of that creature, Shohreh Aghdashloo is a neat piece of casting on paper, though her voice was not the most fitting in actuality. The lighting also felt odd.On the cast, away from Brown, Robin Wright is very meh in her role, while Angela Bassett feels extremely wasted. There is, at least, a nice end credits song from the ace Lykke Li, "Ring of Fire" is admittedly incomparable to "No Rest for the Wicked" but it is pretty good all the same!

title: Enjoyable. And sometimes that enough.
text: Damsel sets the stage for a tried-and-true fantasy storybook world. It is clear from the first lines that this is not a story where a brave knight saves a maiden, and delivers on that promise.This was simply an enjoyable movie, well enough written, well acted. It was not over-reaching, or trying too hard.It delivers a satisfying story, and showcases that Millie Bobby Brown can deliver in a lead role. Angela Bassett was a delight as a stepmother who is refreshingly not evil.The story itself was linear and straight forward. Maybe it was a little predictable, but I would also argue that we don't always need a jarring twist for a movie to be fun.

title: **"Waste of Time - Unless You Are a Child":**
text:
**Reimagining the Fairytale Princess:**
"Damsel" aspires to refresh the classic fairytale princess tale by introducing a female hero into an action-packed plot. The concept is alluring, hinting at a brave deviation from the norm. However, the film's realization falls short, hampered by a failure to fully deliver on its innovative promise.**Screams Amidst Silence:**
A glaring misstep is the film's reliance on an outdated cliché: the incessant screams of female characters in response to pain, fear, or surprise. This is not just a tired stereotype but also a narrative flaw, especially when silence would be crucial for survival. It's baffling why these otherwise empowered women would revert to such counterproductive outbursts.**Visually Pleasing Scenes:**
Despite these criticisms, "Damsel" features aesthetically pleasing scenes that likely shine on the big screen, backed by a clearly generous production budget. The narrative is captivating and well-constructed, deserving a solid 7 out of 10, if not for the previously mentioned flaws.**Cinematic Missteps:**
Beyond the screams, the film includes a series of illogical details and blunders that further diminish its credibility. These range from minor continuity issues to significant plot holes that leave viewers puzzled.**Family-Friendly Entertainment:**
Nevertheless, for a family audience, "Damsel" might just suffice. It provides a mix of adventure and fantasy that can keep the younger audience spellbound, making it an adequate, albeit not exceptional, choice for a family movie night.

title: In Distress of Being Forgotten
text: The fantasy genre is one that I have deep admiration for, but have not found the last few years of fantasy movies to be particularly fruitful or original. Netflix's Damsel starring superstar Millie Bobby Brown is a film that I had high hopes for. The early marketing material painted a picture of an ambitious, female-led fantasy adventure.Millie Bobby Brown's acting prowess is admirable, creating a career full of potential since the mid-2010's. With her strong roles in the past, it only made sense that she would set into a role in another period piece that is chock full of suspense, violence, and very expensive CGI. However, her acting skills, along with other recognizable and respected talent, were not enough to save this movie's script from becoming soggy from the waters of the oversaturated fantasy genre.I struggle to find anything of lasting substance in this one. Most of what we endure is a survival montage listening to Brown scream for several minutes consecutively. I feel there are missed opportunities to create these segments in a way that reveals more about Brown's character, the world she inhabits, and revelations about her current situation and how she ended up where she is. Instead, these revelations are made in a very matter-of-fact and plain way that removes any mystique or emotional weight from this pivotal moment that should serve to change her outlook on her world as she sees it forever.I found the most immersive elements of this film are the beautifully mystical world that we explore, even if we don't get much time to spend in it before we are plunged into a bottomless fissure for well over an hour. This combined with a beautiful score and sound design do offer a world that feels alive one moment, and cold and desolate the next. The way this mirrors the cast's journey does add to a more visual narrative, even if everything that is happening is explained to us verbally when no one else is around to hear it.I'm surprisingly disappointed by this one. The aforementioned promise it showed didn't hold up, but regardless, the cast tries to breathe life into a fairytale that already feels ancient.

title: Finally a family movie
text: Finally a family movie, I really enjoyed watching this with my daughter. This is a movie to watch with your 13+ kids. I like it because there was no awkwardness in this movie, parents can watch with their older kids. Millie is good actress.we need more kids appropriate content on Netflix.Good storyline, good acting, no awkward or cringey moments. Watch this movie with your kids and see if I am right. Even my daughter really like it because it was not uncomfortable to watch especially with all the things being promoted in showbiz these days. Don't read the bad reviews, not sure what they are looking for, yes finally a good family movie.

title: Worst movie I've seen this year.
text: I kept hoping this movie would get better as it went along, but it failed so in so many ways. I like Millie Bobby Brown. And I like that genre of movies.It had a horrible plot line, weak characters, didn't make much sense, and left me looking for the remote as it went along. The CGI was done poorly when they could have done so much more with the dragon and the mountain.The movie seemed to get lost at times, and I found too many holes throughout the movie. Things just never seemed to add up. And what the dad did, no way.I feel like this movie was made for the under 13 age group with the hope of Millie fans wanting to watch also.

title: Ordinary
text: Frankly, I'm tired of fantastic/action movies with the same type of story. It's getting boring that they keep subjecting feminism to simple stories like this as well. It was not difficult to predict the course of events. If it had been made 20 years ago, the hype would have been greater, cause whole story is hella ordinary. Nothing is special or suprising about it. It felt low on action and low budget. As someone who loves Millie Bobby Brown's acting, I have to say that she is the only tangible aspect of the movie. It's not a movie I'd want to watch again. It might be a cute option for younger viewers.

title: Same old story but its even worse
text: I have watched this yesterday.I am a huge fantasy fan but this doesn't cut it, and the fact that the dragon is actually a dragon does the help it, but it's literally the only good thing about the movie.The first 30 minutes builds up the story what its gonna be about which is usually the case and the next 70 minute is basically the same thing and nothing really changes. They run around the cave for eternity.Milly bobby brown is not a good actress she moans so much during this movie that it could be a porn soundtrack, has 4 facial expressions and all of them are forced. The rest of the cast is about as good as her.The only good thing is the voice actress of the dragon hats of to her. But rest is just awful.I do not recommend not even for one watch.

title: Not fun, not entertaining. Stay away!
text: One of the most ridiculous and pathetic fantasy dragon movie of all times.The production is bad to say the least. The dialogues are cringe worthy. Oh the dragon, the most imbecile of all dragon movies produced.You can say everything that is going to happen next from a mile away. The green screened scenes look like movies from the1960s. Perhaps they have spent all the budget rendering the dragon which is the only thing well made in this crapy movie. Ah, and obvious, pay Millie her salary. And speaking about Millie, she'd done what she could, if was not for her this film would be pratically unwatchable.

title: Finally a dragon that is four-legged and looks belivable
text: The movie is about a young woman named. Elodie that will get married but the kingdom has an unpleasant surprise for her. Elodie gets thrown in to a cave and meet a huge dragon. The womans gets sacrificed to the dragon.The story in the movie is godo but its teh dragon that is the very coolest in my opinion. I like dragon movies but often the dragons are not that belivable. He dragons in "Game of thrones" looked good but these are wyerns and i have missted seeing a four legged dragon for many years.The dragon in this movie is four-legged and its rather cool and a little scary looking. The dragons fire is really special. Its more like lava than ordinary fire and i like this.The dragon even talks and the actor. Shohreh Aghdashloo does a good job voicing the dragon.I wanna see more belivable dragons in the future and this movie show the way how they should look.I rate the movie itself 7/10 but with the dragon i change it to 10/10. The FX team has done a great job with the dragon.

title: Written by a 10 year old?
text: No joke. A 10 year old could have written a better storyline!There is no character background, explanation, etc. All the characters are hollow and meaningless.The amount of plot holes you could make it into a 3 par gold course, Swiss cheese or a fishing net!Millie Bobby Brown is wasted on this man-hating, girl boss movie. She is a fantastic actress and deserves better than this!I hope Netflix made a huge loss on this pile of garbage. How about make a movie with a good plot, storyline, lore and no politics?! Is it that hard for studios in 2024 to make good movies anymore?!Dune 2 is the best movie of 2024 so far, because they wrote a STORY not a cliche femboss hating men policial mess called a movie.

title: Call me a damsel, because this movie had me in distress. Nah, it wasn't that bad.
text: After a very rough - and very long - first act, 'Damsel (2024)' pulls itself together just enough to keep you watching until its credits roll. Although it's all incredibly basic and feels similarly cheap in that specifically 'Netflix original' way, it does feature a number of effective moments (the highlight is a brief but notable claustrophobic crawling sequence) that keep it from being an overall bad experience. These moments don't elevate it beyond general mediocrity, but they do just enough to spark your interest every now and again. They also somewhat counteract the clunky dialogue, predictable plotting, unconvincing acting and flimsy special effects. Therefore, the flick sits firmly in the 'fine' category. There's not much else to say about it, really. It's the sort of thing that you'll forget about as soon as it's over, but is mildly diverting while it's unfolding onscreen.

title: Predictable, formulaic. I wish I'd watched something else.
text: I spent more time rolling my eyes and wondering just when our protagonist would shut the hell up than I did enjoying this. You can see where it's going a mile off, and to say they've got some big names in this, it's an insult to reduce them to mere plot devices. It's very good at treating the audience like they were born yesterday.There's more annoying screaming than there is actual dialogue. The CGI is ok, but can look lazy.You end up asking yourself a LOT of questions.And there's so much plot armour it's ridiculous, there really is such a lack of jeopardy for those that are integral to the main story, which is weird considering they barely feature at all.Especially in the third act.It's a shame; the premise is an interesting one, and they've thrown a lot of names and money at it but sadly haven't managed to flesh it out.You can see this is trying to be some sort of vehicle to, recast or, reimagine a new trajectory for our actor into new genres as far as films are concerned, but perhaps this wasn't the film to do it with.Not one I'll be revisiting.

title: An entertainer
text: When I watch a movie, I watch it for fun. When I rate a movie, I only consider how much it was capable of gluing me to the seat.I am not a movie critic. And I do not pretend to be one. All those reviewers giving low ratings to this movie must be very intelligent, have great knowledge about movie making, and so on. I am stupid enough to understand their arguments.Millie Bobby Brown has done a good job, in my opinion. This was a fantasy movie, and I guess fantasy does not require any logic to justify. That is why it is fantasy. All actors, as for me, have done their jobs decently. The camera work was good. We got to see breathtaking locations, and I personally loved that. The film was not slow, the story was sufficient to establish a fantasy world. I think it was a job well done.I liked the villain-turned-hero kind of sentiment, I am a big fan of Disney animation movies, and I like the moral-oriented storylines. I understand when things come to the protection of children, situations can go haywire. So, the hero's perspective was good, and so was the villain's perspective.Watch the movie. Definitely recommend it. Do not look into the poor reviews. Every good endeavor would face criticism.

title: Unexplored potential
text: The Descent meets Dragonheart with soft, tween horror mixed with fairy-tale fanfare.On the outside I really liked this movies premise, there are some really interesting ideas in this I would have liked to see expanded but there were a lot of moments that took me out and didn't make sense or too many plot conveniences. I actually liked this horror aspect between the main character and the dragon. I wish we had more of that in here. Its a type of fantasy we don't see very much. Imagine the movie Alien but instead of a Xenomorph in space chasing you it was a Dragon in a labyrinth deep in a mountain chasing you. That right there is a selling point and at times it does deliver, other times I feel they didn't do enough...I hope this idea is explored again because there was something to this I want to see explored in the future. Millie Bobbi Brown was great, I enjoyed her role in the movie, other actors are a bit dry and one note, which is why I thought it would have benefited more if it was more of Millie Bobby Brown and the dragon being the two main focus with a more survival tone.Probably not a movie I'd watch again but one I would like to see expanded and redone well in the future. There is potential here sadly this movie didn't really push for it.

title: Dragon !!! It was a good movie! Can't understand these low reviews.
text: A good movie to see the least. Worth a watch, and you will actually enjoy it. Highlight of the movie was the Dragon!!! I haven't seen such a beautiful dragon fire apart from game of thrones, so go watch it on Netflix. Millie Bobby Brown shines as the damsel. The movie had Surprising twists and events Which you would not associate with the typical Netflix Movie. Some of the scenes were a little cheesy to say the least. They needed to showcase a strong and independent woman who could survive under immense pressure and against all odds and they were able to do that. I would love to watch a sequel to this.

title: Why?
text: Why has this awful movie got a such a decent score on here? Are people blind or just stupid? I'd say this must have been written by a ten year old if it wasn't for some of the violence, so not really a kids movie. Didn't mind the visual effects, but the script was shockingly bad, although in all fairness there really isn't much of a script. And I'm sorry but Milly really does not make a convincing action heroine.This is yet another fine example of script writers running out of ideas and borrowing so many bits for far better movies to cobble together any old nonsense to give an actress a movie a star in because Netflix have promised her a film or two to sign to them.

title: So predictable you can tell how it will end.
text: The movie description reads like it is going to be entertaining and will have you on the edge of your seat which it does at certain points however, it then becomes so predictable that you already know how the movie ends. It ended up having the same feeling as "Snow White and the Huntsman" apart from it was way worse. I do concede that Millie Bobby Brown played a fantastic damsel and Ray Winstons mediocre part added to the storyline but it was short lived. I will however give the producers some credit as the setting for where the movie was shot was stunning and the detail for the dragon were so realistic it is probably the best one I have seen but again it does not take anything away for how predictable the story line actually was. The line that really sums it up is "there is some time that I will never get back."

title: Way better than expected!
text: First of all, I have to ask; when did Millie Bobby Brown turn into such a hottie? OMG! All of a sudden, that homely girl from Stranger Things has grown up and all of a sudden, she's got full blown movie star good looks!Okay, back to the movie. I liked it way more than I expected. Interesting story. Good writing. Decent supporting cast. Good CGI. This movie could have easily been longer. Not sure if you could stretch it into a series but, I guess there could have been extra character development without boring the audience. After watching it, I immediately Googled to see if there was going to be a sequel. So, that says something right there but, the Google search results quickly showed me that I'm not alone. A LOT of people want more of Damsel. I'll be keeping an eye out for it for sure but I'm also going to be looking for more MBB!

title: The ending really blew it
text: It's relatively predictable from the beginning. But thats okay. Because the acting and the CGI, and the interesting take on a common trope gets you through most of the movie. But then the ending just totally fumbles tue plot ball. Honestly it was an ok movie right up until the climax with the main baddies.Robin Wright and Angela Bassett are wasted. Just left with no character development. And the ending... There's no show down with the real antagonist. It ends too quickly. The cheese factor with the slow motion and dragon at the end... Why? Who's bright idea was that? Boo.Its a sad missed opportunity to make a good movie great. Too bad.

title: BORINGGGGG
text: Boring. Predictable. Millie Bobby Brown's character (I already forgot her name) does nothing cool. Rip off Game of Thrones basically. Such an inspirational woman movie where it follows the same plot as every other woman movie. I'm so bored. I hate movies. What is the character development? Does she have any flaws at all? As far as I can tell the whole movie she's a perfect "powerful woman" from the very start to the very end, yea she faces hardships, but you're never actually concerned if she'll be ok, the plot armor is far too obvious. I did have a lot of fun pointing out plot holes with my mom, so I guess that's good.

title: It was ok until the dragon started talking
text: I think am getting too old for this. As always Netflix pumps money into creating an amazing picture but forgot that it's the story that carries a movie not the amazing picture.What turned me off was when the dragon started talking, literally. Like what? 😄😄 They should have learnt from GoT and Lord of the Rings. The lip sync was just off and honestly probably the worst I've seen in any dragon movie. Instead of actually talking by moving it's lips, they could have made it communicate telepathically. That would make more mystic sense than this terrible lip sync.But I won't lie, I actually watched this to the very end and enjoyed it quite a bit, the girl did very well, and I have to say I enjoyed Angela Basset a little bit too. All it needed was a great storyline.

title: Extremely predictable Medieval copy of Ready or Not
text: Think Ready or Not, in a more medieval setting, with a dragon. Then picture that with clunky dialogue, okayish acting, and a very boring dragged out and super predictable story. Well, there you have this movie.Is this a bad movie? No, not really. Everything is sort of competent, or okay, but this could easily have been a 30min movie and a tv episode. There is no reason to drag things out as much as they do. And since everything is so predictable this is just a chore to watch. Of course we also get some obligatory diversity, and coupled with the clunky dialogue that part feels more off than usual.The best with this is the dragon which was voiced to perfection.I give this a 3/10. If you have absolutely nothing else to do, and you do not mind a bit of dragged out dullness then perhaps give this a go. If you want quality, great acting and a more fun entertaining movie I suggest you go watch Ready or Not instead. That was a good movie, this is, at best, okay.

title: Spelunking film
text: I was intrigued by the film. I love a gender role subversion but this film did not have enough emotional stakes for me. But if it was going shallow action then I don't think it did much better. Most of the film is hiding in, and escaping from, a cave. If the film was going for tension and suspense, then they brough out the monster too soon. I like the idea of sneaking through the cave, but this was not that. This was dodging fire blasts. The last scene was confusing and the lore left me with some pretty basic questions. The penultimate scene was just funny because of the full mascara and cat eye make-up.It's a fast-forward film.

title: It's a fun movie!
text: Not ever movie has to be Oscar worthy, super sophisticated etc. It doesn't have to be culturally relevant, teaching or life changing. Movies can just be fun, entertaining and an escape for a while. And that's exactly what this movie is. It has great themes like, the importance of family, mercy and empathy, the inate capability of girls, sacrifice and devotion, and the concept that what seems important and true isn't always that way. But none of it is heavy handed or 'preachy' It's a great movie to curl up on the couch and have popcorn with the family or friends. Very enjoyable. Just watch it, enjoy it, and don't overthink for awhile.

title: Just doesn't allow you to truly feel and know the characters
text: From the first few scenes, you can feel it just doesn't feel like it's giving you all the dimensions. The cinematography is amazing, its visually amazing, but the story just lacks any depth. I was really excited for this film to come out, it looked like an epic tale that would pull you on an adventure.It's okay to watch, but its nothing special at all.It's awesome that Netflix are making these big films, that would be cinema movies, if released by another studio, but hopefully they can see that a great movie needs more than money, and a great cast, it needs to weave into the audiences hearts and have them feel it!

title: Millie Bobby Brown is the new Mother of Dragons
text: Millie Bobby Brown delivers a committed performance in this medieval dark fantasy film that's more suspense action thriller than your traditional fairy taleYou can tell she has a bright future ahead of her in the action genre and performed most of her own stunts.I loved how powerful her acting was; this is definitely a film I would gladly watch with my daughter if I am ever lucky enough to have one.The creature design and visual effects that went into bringing The Dragon to life were absolutely incredible and deserve to be recognized as well, as was Shohreh Aghdashloo's voice acting in the role.

title: good first half, then crashing hard
text: In the first half this movie is entertaining and fun. Brown can, in her best moments, project the intense experience of pain, of an hurt body so convincingly that it reminds me a bit of Bruce Willis in Die Hard 1. So the build up is ok, the first parts in the caves are really good, but then suddenly she turns into a mixture of McGyver and, let's say, Charlize Theron in 'The old guard'. Plain silly and not hiding it.As often nowadays, all male characters are either corrupt or - no matter - here they are all corrupt (even if they regret it later).Well, at least the dragon was good (yes, there is a dragon, but that is general knowledge since the trailer dropped): slimmer and meaner than most.

title: Is Millie Bobby Brown reaching the end of her shelf-life?
text: Millie Bobby Brown (one of the current "It girls") carries this kid-friendly Netflix film. She doesn't have her Stranger Things superpowers, but she DOES have determination and resourcefulness. This dynamic is what makes this film watchable. The ending (and overall message) are good, but there are problems.Millie wears a LOT of make-up. I'm not against make-up in principle, but it's actually distracting here, as is the modern dialogue. In NO way do the characters sound like they are from a different time or place. I wouldn't have been surprised if one pulled out a cell phone. Millie's character actually says she was "guilted into marriage". Using guilt as a verb is a recent development (slang or not).The first act is SO SLOW (made worse by Netflix teasers that rob the main plot twist of any surprise value). Also, Millie's character has limited depth -- I'll be generous and call it two-dimensional.While the story has some plot twists, it's still weak -- just strong enough for the Netflix assembly line. There are a LOT of wooden, one-dimensional characters. To be fair, the step-mom (Angela Bassett) and the evil queen (Robin Wright) are both decent. Ironically, Robin Wright's excellent stage presence emphasizes just how weak most of the other actors are.The dragon was OK; the CGI and personality were decent, and of course it's a major story element.This COULD have been an exciting and fully satisfying (8-star) tale of betrayal, survival, and vengeance. But remove one star for the slow start, another for the wildly inappropriate modern dialog, and another for the pervasively (perhaps blatantly) contrived vibe. That's five (5) stars total.

title: Finally!
text: This dragon princess movie really hit the sweet spot for me, taking me back to the magic of my childhood. The characters had more to them than the usual fairy tale, making the whole story more interesting.The visuals and music were spot-on, making the whole experience super enjoyable. It turned a regular evening into a fun escape into a fantasy world that kept me hooked from start to finish. Honestly, every scene felt like a magical painting, turning the movie into something special.A magical canvas of storytelling, this movie not only entertained but also stirred a sense of wonder, proving that some tales are timeless and eternally cherished.

title: 2 because the visually the dragon is striking. -8 for the rest
text: Acting is ok, and it is visually pleasing.But, the scenario is poor. Poor is not strong enough. I think it is supposed to be a twist of the classic fairy tale the damsel in distress. Yeah, it is, kinda.Unfortunately: Everything is made to let you know what will happen next.Litterally every scene and every action is a hint to: This is going to happen. And it starts with the very first scene where Something happens in the background, which let you instantely know why and what will happen.So, absolutely no surprise, just a boring moment waiting for the confirmation of what you KNEW would happen.This is the worst movie of 2024 for me.

title: The damsel is distress & so are we !!
text: Pro tip : Don't watch the trailer !! ( it shows the whole plot )" Damsel" the name says it all ( another fantasy movie ) it is sort of predictable movie & not different than others ( kind of disappointing movie , I expected something better ) . I heard in one of the interviews that Millie Bobby Brown took this movie because it's different than the others she did , but honestly it's kind of same all over ( her : being a powerful lead saving others and herself ) but still it's a mediocre movie to watch ( the visuals and the production is enjoyable ) I won't say that I was thrilled by the cast or the plot but you can still watch it .

title: Of course its predictable...what isnt? but its still a good watch
text: I was expecting 9s and 10s, not 3s and 4s.The cinematography is amazing. The sets, camera shots and locations are all incredible. I mean.. Except for that gold paint cardboard carriage, lol.The acting is great! I didn't have any problem with any of the actors at all. The movie is really solid..But of course its predictable. Only 2 possible endings. Either she kills the dragon and leaves a queen that everyone is forced to bow down to, OR she teams up with the dragon. Now i was hoping for the prior, but Im still happy with the latter because it also shows she did almost kill the dragon.The dragon is pretty stupid, never leaving its dark cave. It couldn't smell that the people up stairs had much more potent royal blood?

title: NOt Acurate Depiction of Dragons!
text: On behalf of Dragonkind everywhere, I must object to the depiction of the Dragon in this very misguided story.The human actors were OK, MBB was a standout, I grudgingly admit. I also felt Angel Bassett was misused; she is capable of much more than we saw of her. Anyone could have played Ray Winstone's part without anyone noticing the difference.Dragons are NOT the demons portrayed here. Think instead of Oriental Dragons: they are regarded as keepers of Knowledge and Wisdom, better befriended than hunted as they were here. Millie Bobbie Brown had the correct idea, but the Dragon was miscast.Yes, the Dragon had the right to be vengeful, but rather than demand blood sacrifice, a true Dragon would have withheld its Knowledge and Wisdom from Humankind.

title: Womp womp
text: I'm trapped underground with god knows what so let's Scream the entire time. They churn out movies like welfare babies nowadays. I havent watched anything memorable since the Harry Potter series ended. Target audiences today are agenda based not people who want to watch movies and or own them. Mediocre knock offs of classics regurgitated into modern drivel. The credits alone are more interesting than the movies themselves because of the sheer number of humans it takes to make these unoriginal, forgettable non masterpieces. Enough of my opinion on the industry as a whole. As for my opinion on this movie: I guess it was not all that great because since I started writing this I completely forgot it existed.

title: Good movie for people who likes fantasy, yet don't care for negative reviews.
text: I won't do a lengthy review, so I'll be giving my thoughts on the movie. The story plot aligns with the course of the movie, the movie also kind of gave me anxiety for the main character. Because the main character is doing her best to survive from the dragon and being thrown by an evil royal family. And, the main younger sister I sense that she has good soul and deeply cares for her older sister. The queen the main character just met I believe she has heart of a bad person. After I watched the movie, the main character sort things out with the dragon and avenge her babies from humans with a bad heart. The dragon understood there are humans with good and bad souls. The dragon spooked me however I like the dragon's personality, although hostile I feel like deep down the female dragon is a good soul who cares for her kind as a dragon. If only things were different between humans and dragons the story plot would be rewritten differently. However, I like the movie as it is without making any changes to the film. Also, I am an artist who loves spiritual and fantasy movies. I feel inspired to do a painting of the main character who serves as role model for woman and girls that our weaknesses is what makes us stronger. Although, we human women and girls are weak, fragile, and sometimes unhelpful that's not true to me and I feel that our kindness, empathy, compassion, and bravery is what makes us stronger than someone with judgment, criticism, and being rough. I think the message of the movie is that you need to let go or avoid letting bad people into your life, and only let in people who have good soul and heart. By the end of the day, we are just humans that are doing our best to become the best version of ourselves. Do inner work and shadow work and let go or purge your old self because it's key to become the best version of yourself which becomes your new identity. Your identity becomes your reality and new behavior. If you want to let go of the old self and current version of yourself let go of it, and embody the person you want to become. My rating for this movie is 9/10 and this is my honest review not biased.

title: Terrible acting, poor script, bad director, and low budget SFX
text: One of the worst movies of the Millennium. This is what we are forced to watch by the greedy spoiled millionaire stars churning out film after film to "star" in?With a cast of so many supposed "actors and actresses", I cannot fathom how this is so abysmal. Cardboard cutouts would give better performances.The script is like something from a sixth grader.The lighting looks like it was made by a blind person. Cringe level SFX, plain to see AI copy and paste fill and color scenery. Nothing but green screens.These kids got swept up into a lowest common denominator cult tv show that all the MAGA sub 100 IQ people eat up with a spoon. And play with a 90s has-been actress Wanona Ridar, who is most famous for shoplifting, and being a criminal drug using adulteress. One of the kids even has a weird mouth deformity, and you can't even understand him half the time. Couldn't make it through more than a few episodes.

title: Millie Bobby Brown Is On Fire In More Ways Than One
text: This is a very well done movie. A simple story told excellently. Millie Bobby Brown is a damsel who is sacrificed to a dragon to repay an ancient debt. Millie takes charge in this role and even shows the dragon some fire of her own. Robin Wright plays the corrupt queen brilliantly. Millie executive produced this along with her father, Robert. This is one of the better Netflix movies I've seen along with the Enola Holmes movies that Millie was involved with. Millie has come a long way from being the young girl Eleven in Stranger Things. She is now a woman who holds her own. I hope she continues to spread her wings just like the dragon.

title: Good, but not catchy.
text: It starts out making you think it's going to be about this, and it goes with that for a bit, and then WHAM, it was just a pretense to start the movie that really doesn't carry on beyond that point.I kept wondering off, not paying attention to it and having to go back. I was never drawn into the film until the very end.At one point the story changes from the beginning theme to a brand new one that lasted a little bit before moving on to a third idea that really seemed to come out of nowhere as it didn't add up to things that were already shown in the movie.Then there was this part that just made no sense and I think was added just for an emotional response.The ending was good, finished up the one theme well and brought the main character to the desirable conclusion. The story was 2/10, as there were a few stories with essentially 2 characters. But overall I like it and found it entertaining if I took it piece by piece and ignored the overall story/stories and would give it like 7/10. So add it all up and I'm giving it a 5/10, instead of a 4/10 for visuals.

title: What's the point
text: I was at a quasi-family thing where a group of folks watches a movie after dinner. This was the choice so I, dutifully, sat through it. What a mistake. The plot is paper thin and so predictable that I imagine a three year old could figure it out 15 minutes in. I admit I am not a fantasy guy, jeesh, c'mom, have a little ingenuity.I guess the CGI for the dragon was okay, but, at times it was hard to understand what it was saying. Outside of some pretty good cinematography, there is little to recommend for this. Do yourself a favor and find a better rated fantasy flick if you're in the mood for that sort of thing.

title: Good movie, bad production
text: So I think the actually movie is a solid 8/10, but the cgi is UNBEARABLY bad, nothing really looks realistic at all.Also the camera movement is really spar-attic and is a bit all over the place, and I get that it's somewhat meant to be like that, in a lot of cases it's not a good time for the camera to be very shaky and etc.And I also think that a lot of the movie is just chase scenes, dramatic scenes etc. Nothing else really.This ends up making the movie SO much worse.I also would've liked a bit more of the story based around the other family members that aren't involved much, you couldn't really see much of them.Bad cgi, subpar acting, and bad camera angles add up to this movie being a 5/10 for me.

title: Superb. Fantastic!
text: I must say, this movie deserves a solid 10/10 rating! It was a thrilling film and I was completely hooked from start to finish! Millie Bobby Brown was exceptional as the main protagonist and her performance was outstanding. She never fails to impress me and this role was perfect for her! The dragon character they created for this film was nothing short of magnificent. The movie had fast transition scenes that kept me on the edge of my seat throughout. Ray Winstone's performance as Beowulf was outstanding and his voice was very soothing. He is a strong character and his role is best suited for medieval and fiction films. I want to thank Netflix for producing such an exciting movie. As a movie viewer, I am truly appreciative!

title: Why
text: As many others have pointed out the script, acting, CGI, plot and more were not great but my biggest gripe with this movie was that somehow Elodie's makeup stayed perfectly in place the whole time?? Not only was her makeup way too modern in the first place, but in the second to last scene after she's been in a cave fighting for her life for who knows how long her eyeliner is perfect, her lipgloss is still shiny, and her contour is on point. It just completely took me out of the movie every time... I really wanted to like it in a "stupid Netflix movie that's sort of enjoyable" but it was simply too terrible to enjoy at all.

title: Damsel's Quest for Freedom
text: "Damsel" is a dark fantasy film that introduces viewers to Elodie, played by Millie Bobby Brown, a young woman who finds herself ensnared in a web of ancient debts and dangerous predicaments. Directed by Juan Carlos Fresnadillo and penned by Dan Mazeau, the film promises an intriguing premise with elements of suspense and fantasy.With a cast that includes Ray Winstone, Nick Robinson, Shohreh Aghdashloo, Angela Bassett, and Robin Wright, "Damsel" boasts an impressive lineup of talent. Millie Bobby Brown's portrayal of Elodie is likely to be a highlight, given her track record of delivering compelling performances.The film's streaming debut on Netflix on March 8, 2024, drew mixed reviews from audiences and critics alike. While some viewers may find themselves captivated by the film's blend of dark fantasy elements and suspenseful storytelling, others may feel that it falls short of its potential or lacks coherence in its execution.

title: Damsel: A Missed Opportunity by Netflix
text: In the realm of fantasy and adventure, expectations often soar high, especially when a promising young talent like Millie Bobby Brown is at the forefront. Unfortunately, "Damsel," Netflix's latest foray into the genre, falls significantly short of those expectations, stumbling on several fronts that detract from its potential.First and foremost, Brown's performance in "Damsel" is a contentious point. Known for her ability to bring depth and nuance to her roles, Brown seems to miss the mark here, delivering a portrayal that leans towards overacting. While her commitment to the role is evident, the excessive expressiveness detracts from the authenticity of her character, especially in scenes that demand subtlety and restraint.Moreover, the film's attempt to maintain a polished aesthetic for Brown's character, even in the most rugged settings, feels incongruous. Whether she's exploring a dark, damp cave or engaging in a fierce battle with a dragon, her makeup remains immaculate, a choice that undermines the realism and immersion of the narrative. Such details might seem minor, but they accumulate, pulling the audience out of the story and highlighting a lack of attention to context and continuity.The script and writing of "Damsel" are other areas where the film falters. The narrative feels underdeveloped, with dialogues and plot progressions that often lack the depth and complexity one would expect from a genre rich in possibilities. This issue is not confined to Brown's character alone; the overall cast delivers performances that range from passable to mediocre, suggesting that the problem lies more with the material they were given rather than their individual talents.While the actors, including Brown, show moments of potential, their efforts are hampered by the film's lackluster script and direction. It's a classic case of a movie that could have been much more, had the writing and character development been given the attention they deserved.In conclusion, "Damsel" is a disappointing addition to Netflix's lineup, particularly given the streaming giant's capacity for producing compelling content. While it might offer a few entertaining moments, the film ultimately feels like a missed opportunity to deliver a captivating, coherent fantasy adventure. Viewers might find themselves watching till the end, but more out of a sense of completion than genuine enjoyment.

title: A children's movie
text: The short review is that it is a good children's movie, less so for any adults. It's well filmed and there are not many dull moments but it has a very unoriginal plot and it is very shallow without any complexity in terms of plot or character development, similar to marvel movies. Maybe I should have read up but my conception of fantasy shows and movies is that it's normally layered upon years and years of story told throughout various books but this is kinda just an action movie dressed in fantasy clothing. If I'm being positive I think the movie looked great and the locations etc were nicely done.

title: Ready or Not... with a Dragon
text: Okay this movie was SO good. I was intrigued from beginning to end. Acting was great, effects were beautiful, the scenery was breathtaking. I love Millie Bobbie Brown, which is why I watched in the first place. Superb acting on her part, and just in general throughout the film.The Dragon talking was a super cool element to the story and her voice was definitely creepy! I love the actual revenge story behind it all, not that she's just a Dragon who wants to kill.Besides the fact that as soon as I saw the mother was black and the queen was white, knowing since this is a Netflix film, obviously the black woman couldn't possibly be the bad guy (hint, hint, Netflix can never make a dark skinned bad guy lol), it was a great overall film that I thoroughly enjoyed!

title: Nice heroine trasher, but no dragon-princess kissing scene :(
text: I feel so bad for everyone who worked on this because the cast is stellar, the acting is superb, costumes, CG & VFX, music... are actually not that bad compared to other movies in the same genre. Except the script. Oh boy, the script!I don't know how you manage to turn that mush of overused, cringe ideas into the least innovative, 100% formulaic, boring and predictable heroine trasher imaginable. They could have taken it, ironed out the kings without much effort - because the issues of the stories are already well known - and turned it into something good. Unfortunately, they kept it at copy-pasting the bad and stupid stuff and seasoned it with more cringe.The only thing that kept me from laughing at how bad it was done was the absence of a kissing scene between the princess and the dragon at sunset in the end. And to to be fair: such a kissing scene would have been more memorable and innovative than the rest of the movie.4 Stars, because the movie looks nice and some people really made an effort. It's a good one if you are in vegetable mode on your couch while having a fever, I can't recommend it when looking for a real movie you want to watch while your brain is fully functional.

title: Highly entertaining and totally satisfying
text: Finally, I enjoyed watching a dark fairy tale with a deceived dragon, betrayal, lies, revenge, and a strong female character in the middle of it all.** I've been enjoying fewer and fewer productions in recent years. From what I understand from the comments viewers make on social media, in general, expectations for productions are too high to be met. Maybe this is because new filmmakers are constantly trying something different and out of the ordinary, and end up being disappointed at the box office. However, a good story, good acting, and a well-adjusted storytelling style will always work. Damsel is a good example of this. Unfortunately, it is clear that it will not please the generally dissatisfied teenagers or the overly artistic masses, but they have created an entertaining and watchable film by applying the formula I gave above in a classical sense. What was the general rule? You can't please everyone.I don't want to be misunderstood, I'm not saying it's the best movie of the last few years and a masterpiece, but it's an entertaining and engaging movie that has what a movie should have and leaves a smile on your face when the "the end" credits roll.** The current generation, which has not experienced the cinema culture of the 80s and 90s, is quite ruthless and destructive in their criticism of films, as they are in everything else. They need to learn that they won't find the meaning of life in every movie they watch, and sometimes they just need to sit back and enjoy the moment.Damsel is nothing more than a dark fairy tale of a young princess whose life begins enchantingly and unrealistically well, and then turns into a survival fight against an ancient and very powerful dragon. Damsel, like every fantasy fairy tale, contains intrigues, lies, and hidden agendas, and presents them to the viewer in an entertaining way. You can guess where the story is going while watching it, but that's not always a bad thing. Not every story has to have very clever twists. Sometimes you wonder how the ending will happen even if you can guess the ending, and that's honestly the case with Damsel.As I wrote at the beginning, you will not find the secret of life in this film, nor is it a masterpiece that has a special place among the films made so far, but you will return to the fairy tales that we all watched, read, or our families told us in one way or another in our childhood years. If fantasy movies are not for you, then Damsel is not for you. Damsel, which has a well-adjusted, satisfying acting and a flowing story, features my favorite fantasy creature, the Dragon, and not only features it, but also shares the lead role. If you are into fantasy genre then give Damsel a chance.

title: The Damsel Ain't in distress no more...or is she?
text: Until minute 35 (give or take) I was sure we are going for an adventure princess story and my wife was totally on board. Once the Dragon came and along side came the horror genre elements, the movie changed completely and my damsel got distressed and baled on me... leaving me alone, in order to complete the mission on my own.Well...challenge accepted...or not completely. The day after she came back, learned that she is a cowered and completed almost all the rest of the film, that was...pretty stupid. Straight forward and almost shoved into each and every viewer's thought. Nothing new from this one or its genre.An almost classis case, for PC era, of roles Reversal, that takes out men almost completely out of order and leaves women to take charge on all of leading roles of influence in the movie. We've got an evil queen mother, the damsel that got distressed and prevails, a female dragon and a whole bunch of men that are doing wrong or doing nothing to prevent all wrong stuff.As I started to say, the first half of hour is kind of an exposition and it completes all genre rules to get the show started. After this time, it's a girl fleeing from a dragoness for each and every direction possible, just to get a second round with it / her. Nothing to be excited about or loose anyone's sleep over it (especially not my wife's).Millie Bobby Brown never proved to be anything else but a pretty growing face in Hollywood and she does it(?) again this time also. We got several has been actors that just watching their name as part of the cast makes me goosebumps.Ray Winstone, Angela Bassett and Robin Wright are absolutely wasted here, but did the job for an 80's kid like me, that will not settle for young Millie Bobby Brown only, in order to check out another collaboration, that she is marking with streaming faltering giant.

title: A good watch for fans of Millie Bobby Brown and lighthearted fantasy adventures. But those seeking a groundbreaking narrative might be disappointed.
text: Millie Bobby Brown shines as a warrior princess in Damsel. This action-packed fantasy throws her Elodie into a dragon-guarded escape from a forced marriage. The stunning visuals, particularly the landscapes and the dragon, are a feast for the eyes. Brown delivers a fierce performance, proving she can do these kind of movies as well.While the plot might be predictable, the film's creatures like talking dragon keep things fresh. Though some supporting characters lack depth, the fast pace keeps the focus on Elodie's thrilling journey.Damsel isn't a groundbreaking story, but it's a blast for fans of Brown and fantastical adventures.

title: The extreme make up - stranger things
text: The Netflix film "The Maiden" suffers notably from underwhelming special effects, which is particularly disappointing for a genre that hinges on the grandeur and awe of epic adventure visuals. The narrative doesn't bring anything new to the table, recycling familiar tropes without any fresh twists or compelling additions. While the lead actresses display commendable physical fitness and commitment to their roles, they are let down by subpar dialogue that fails to capture the depth or nuance necessary for viewer engagement. Perhaps the most jarring element is the anachronistic makeup worn by Miley from "Stranger Things"; her heavily modern makeup feels out of place in a period setting and distracts from the historical authenticity one might expect. Billie Eilish's makeup, too, is distractingly overdone, pulling attention away from her performance and undermining the film's credibility. Overall, "The Maiden" is a lackluster film, and it's perhaps for the best that it was confined to streaming rather than a cinematic release.

title: Another sacrifice on "THE MESSAGE" altar
text: "Damsel," despite its ambitions, falls short in several critical areas, making it a missed opportunity in the landscape of modern cinema. Firstly, the film's pacing struggles to find a consistent rhythm, oscillating between sluggish scenes and rushed developments that leave the audience feeling disconnected from the narrative's emotional core. This erratic pacing undermines the storytelling, making it challenging for viewers to fully invest in the characters' journeys.Moreover, while the movie attempts to subvert traditional genre expectations, it often does so in a manner that feels more contrived than innovative. This approach results in a tonal imbalance, where the film's efforts to blend different genres come off as disjointed rather than seamless. The intended humor and satire, which could have been the film's saving grace, often miss their mark, leading to a sense of awkwardness rather than the intended wit or critique.The performances, although earnest, are hampered by a script that lacks depth and nuance. The characters, meant to be complex and multi-dimensional, often come across as one-dimensional and underdeveloped. This lack of character depth makes it difficult for the audience to empathize with their struggles or understand their motivations, further distancing viewers from the film's narrative.Visually, "Damsel" shows some promise with its cinematography and setting, offering glimpses of what could have been a visually captivating experience. However, these moments are overshadowed by the film's overarching issues, including a storyline that feels both predictable and unfulfilling. The potential for a compelling critique of traditional roles and expectations is evident but ultimately not realized, leaving the audience with a sense of what could have been.In conclusion, "Damsel" attempts to challenge conventions and offer something new but is hindered by its execution. The film's pacing, tone, character development, and humor all contribute to a viewing experience that feels lacking in both substance and satisfaction. While there are fleeting moments of potential, they are not enough to elevate the movie beyond its fundamental flaws.

title: Great fun and fulfilling
text: An excellent movie with a tight storyline and narrative. Enjoyable without trying to be too clever, and has great underlying themes. Would highly recommend this to anyone who wants something enjoyable to watch.A great family watch as well. A few PG scenes of some violence so better with slightly older children.Strong female lead but does it very well in that the lead could've been male and the storyline would not need much change. More movies should follow the lead. Don't write in "female" storylines or beats. Just stick to a solid story and action sequences.Further, it keeps a nice constant flow and story beat. Doesn't drag anything out unnecessarily.

title: Meh
text: The story itself, while not the most original, was still good. The concept itself was interesting. Kind of a shame it wasn't executed better because it could have Probably been really great if had been. The acting was fairly dull and kind of stuffy. Millie is beautiful but I just don't know that this was the right role for her. The biggest downfall of the movie was the lack of emotional depth though. So many scenes that should have brought you to tears were just very bland and almost awkward or obviously forced. However, the biggest positive in my opinion, was the dragon. The dragon was cool looking at least. I probably enjoyed her the most. So there's that. It was cool to watch with my kids at least. The most graphic parts were wounds and blood. Nothing sexual, no real bad language. Could have passed for a Disney Channel movie actually.

title: Well worth a watch
text: To be honest I wasn't expecting much!! But it ended up being a very good film, if your into films with dragons then this is one for you, some good characters and I reckon there could be a sequel? I mean why not it's a lot better film than some others I've seen that have sequels so I'd say give it a chance,Millie Bobby brown, is a great young actress and she's very good in this one , I'd give it a eight out of ten like I've said it's well worth a watch so go and have your "Netflix and chill" with this one and don't but your heating on Because there's plenty of fire in this film to warm you up!!

title: Was pretty good. It moved along at a good pace
text: I watched this and one other movie this weekend. The other movie being Poor things. And this movie was more believable then Poor things.I'm reading a lot of negative reviews. For a movie about dragons, it was pretty good. I mean, again it's a fairytale about dragons. Considering all the critics choices for good movies, this ought to win something. The only negative thing I saw was the ending was rather abrupt. Other than that it wasn't that bad.The CGI was good, after the initial start to get the action going, it moved along pretty good. I'll agree they could have gave more of a backstory, but it was better than expected.

title: This was Surprising Good
text: I have enjoyed fantasy movies since I was a kid. And yes I admit fantasy movies can be hit (Game of Thrones) or a miss (too many examples to cite). This is a hit. Why? Great production values, great -- but not over the top acting -- and special effects that facilitate but do not overwhelm in the plot.I watched this because it starred Millie Bobby Brown. I became familiar with her through the series Stranger Things. In Stranger Things she played an abused institutionalized child, and so her acting was intense and vulnerable. Here Ms. Brown plays a very strong young women full of courage, tenacity and intelligence, and even nobility. Moreover, she carries the movie since she is in almost every scene. She does it brilliantly and with aplomb.Another actress that helps raise this movie is Robin Wright who is obviously channeling Claire Underwood from House of Cards. She steals her scenes.In short this is a great popcorn movie for adults.

title: Easy to watch, might not be perfection for some, but I thought it was empowering with a satisfying ending
text: Sure, you could slice and dice, but sometimes it's just nice to watch a movie, relax, and enjoy watching someone's imagination come to life.I thought everything looked really good. From the CGI to the costumes, hair etc. Mille Brown did a great job, and she looked so beautiful and strong throughout. Robin Wright was an excellent villian, Angela Bassett a loving mother.If you want to look into the depths of it, the moral of the story is as old as tale - the wealthy screwing over the less fortunate. The entitilement at it's highest and the most rewarding ending.I will watch again for sure.

title: Exceptionally well done in 90% of all areas
text: This could have been a perfect 10 had it leaned a little more in to being an adult movie, in terms of violence/gore/plot. Not that it needed to be much gorier, they got away with a ton of violence visuals for a pg13, they just would or could have looked better if they werejust that extra bit more realistic, vs meeting a rating.The plot wasn't new or anything groundbreaking, but it works. They did a good enough job with the story that it didn't need to be an entirely new one.I did feel a couple things things she did didn't seem true to anything. Like cutting off her hair to make a rope.Falling in the crystal area and not being absolutely shredded.Overall though, as a pg13 nearing an adult rating, it was a great adventure, with a phenomenally well done dragon. I would rank the dragon a 10/10 for being a D&D representative. Not sure which species, but this was a vindictive, dangerous apex predator with a motive.

title: delightful
text: Scenery, fun, costumes, fun, cgi,fun, action,fun. I wish to have seen this on a big screen. That must be a gorgeous eyeful. The negative reviewers took this movie too seriously Take a belly breath, pour some good whiskey, put your feet up, and have some fun. This movie is just that. You can find fault with it all you want, be it the plot, the story (yes it is a familiar one), the make believe, the fantasy. But is that not what we need sometimes? My troubles disappeared for a couple hours and I smiled and smiled in that time. If you expect award winning acting and what all else, then sure, you will be disappointed. But do not set yourselves up for that. Just sit back and be entertained. Cheers!

title: A good story!
text: It makes a change to actually get films today that are proper stories, with a beginning, middle and end, without being a prequel or sequel! So, yes, the 'twist' was a little obvious but Mille Bobby Brown did well in a tougher role.Ignore the naysayers and give this film a chance if you like fantasy adventure films with actual plots!It makes a change to actually get films today that are proper stories, with a beginning, middle and end, without being a prequel or sequel! So, yes, the 'twist' was a little obvious but Mille Bobby Brown did well in a tougher role.Ignore the naysayers and give this film a chance if you like fantasy adventure films with actual plots!

title: Amazing film!
text: I will admit I predicted a few elements of the story, but I have found it is truly hard to come up with any singular plot where even one individual doesn't guess or assume the ending or a main aspect of the plot. This did not deter me from enjoying the film what so ever, it was great.I loved it. It was empowering and strong, the characters were strong and thought it greatly, and it was all just simply amazing. The plot was great, and I love how it ended- very strong main character, she was extremely well played. I hope Millie knows she has succeeded greatly.I thoroughly enjoyed this. I haven't sat and fully watched a film in such a long time 10/10.

title: Epic Dark Fantasy
text: 1. Beautifully filmed. Camerawork is really good. No shaky nonsense crap. Each shot and scene were a pleasure to experience, to watch and enjoy. Most don't care or notice as they get used to watching blurs on screen and it's great for a change to see a movie where you can pixel watch every scene . Halo show is an example of the worst camerawork created due to poor directing and camerwork where it's 1/10. This show is 10/10 as even at 24p, you can still see the details!2. Solid directing on every level.3. Very strong acting. Many of us know the actress and she has a bright future as she was captivating the minds of many for a few years now. More hair suits her better ;)4. Good fairy tale-type story that was very well done. The script was very good and it carried the movie without any issues. Scripts often can break a movie and I am glad to see they took a story that wasn't that unique overall, then they made it unique, made it the way it was never done before.At present, the movie is highly underrated. Lots of haters didn't like the fact the lead characters is a female so they've been down voting it.. It's unfortunate we still have petty folks who can't just enjoy a movie without either trashing it due to their own insecurities, racist or other views.9.3/10 I can see myself rewatching it sometime in the future again.

title: A damsel I think not in distress yes
text: I love dragons and I cried. The actress I don't know her name, but she plays this role so perfect. I could not stop watching this. I didn't even pick up my phone. And the thing is is that humans have been doing things like this to destroy animals children for centuries. And this just goes to show how the lies and manipulations of one person can ruin the rest of everybody's life. The mother of the damsel oh I love her. This movie was beautiful. The only thing that upset me is the prince bless his heart. He didn't want anything to do with it, but he was forced to. I almost wish that this was a series. It reminds me of a dragon queen, who protects the last dragon.

title: Entertaining movie
text: I don't understand the bad reviews. If the main character was a man, surely the reviews would have been better. The visuals are great, the storyline is also great, the costumes are very well chosen and the ending, although predictable, is also nice. I usually get bored watching movies, but this one kept me engaged the whole time. If anything, I wished it were longer and the story carried on even after the ending.The dragon itself is built a bit weirdly and looks more like a cat on steroids, but other than that the movie is great for a laid-back movie night.After reading the reviews, i expected a horrible movie, but it's not the case. I recommend watching it with an open mind and try to ignore what you read about it.

title: The importance of telling the truth.
text: This is an awesome "fairy tale". I truly wish they would make far more movies like this. Reminds me of the great 1960's oldie movie called "the wonderful world of the brothers Grimm". And how they searched far and wide to get the "lost" stories and get them in a book. This story is well told and fits right into that genre. It has excellent characters and acting and the dragon effects are stunning and unique and not like any other dragon I've yet seen in any other movie. The story unfolds with a promise and them flows into a great deception, you figure out what that is. It's all about "telling the truth" and how a lie can be very very dangerous. I thoroughly enjoyed this film and was riveted to the screen the entire time and was reminded a little of "Daenerys" from "Game of Thrones" and how she had command of her great dragon. I hope you enjoy this as much as I did. Nothing questionable, no nudity or any foul language, some blood and a little gore. Ok for the kiddos. Enjoy!!

title: Simple story greatly executed
text: Yes , its basic, like a page out of an old children story book, but everything is executed well, there arent too many long moments, and its greatly animated, the CGI is flawless , and there are a lot of beauty in the movie to be seen. The dialogue is nothing great but i've seen worse. Its the kind of movie you watch when you want to shut your brain off, and just get lost in amazing sets decors and visuals. You have to suspend your disbelief obviously but if you can manage to do that you'll enjoy the movie. Maybe im just a fan of dragons , its hard for me not to like dragon movies. But i thought the dragon was badass.

title: Absolutely Loved it
text: Story is good , visuals are great and plot twists are amazing. Good 1.5 hours spent. Loved the lead actress acting. Even if you think you might know the story still its a good watch given all the visuals. Some parts are dark (lighting vise) but that show the storyline. Many think that trailer have given away a lot but actually no. I started watching it with the goal of this running in background meanwhile I do some work but I was hooked. I only watch imdb 7 and above and this certainly met the standards. I am not writing anything about the story coz I don't want to spoil it for anyone . But a weekend will be well spent if this movie is added.

title: EPIC BEYOND MEASURE
text: Visually, "Damsel" is a treat for the eyes. The cinematography captures the rugged beauty of the American frontier in breathtaking detail, immersing the audience in a world that feels both familiar and surreal. The film's soundtrack complements the visuals perfectly, enhancing the overall experience and adding layers of emotion and atmosphere to each scene.What sets "Damsel" apart is its ability to blend genres effortlessly. It delivers moments of humor that are both clever and endearing, while also delving into deeper themes of love, identity, and the human experience. The unexpected twists in the plot keep viewers engaged and invested, culminating in a satisfying and impactful conclusion.In summary, "Damsel" is a gem of a film that offers a fresh perspective on the Western genre. With its captivating performances, stunning visuals, and thought-provoking storytelling, it's a movie that leaves a lasting impression and is sure to be enjoyed by audiences looking for something truly special.

title: A thoroughly entertaining movie
text: I found the film thoroughly entertaining. Yeah, it didn't dig into real life, societal dilemmas, delve into politics or try to cleverly unveil a deep moral of the story trying to change humanity's viewpoint on any current poignant news story... but not every movie has to.The acting was great, the visuals good enough to believe and the characters likeable and hated. In my opinion, it did what few movies manage in the current day and that is to entertain and to allow the mind escape from the real world.Although, the twists and turns were predictable, they were still satisfying leaving the viewer feeling sated and comforted by the end, all loose ends tied and all wrongs righted.I would happily watch sequel after sequel if they happen.

title: Great movie, especially if you loved Ready or Not!
text: I'd been excited to watch this since I saw the trailer, but wasn't sure if it'd live up to how good the trailer was. But, it was actually better!I really enjoyed the story, it was compelling and interesting. Elodie, played by Millie Bobbie Brown, makes for an excellent protagonist that you care about and want to root for. She's interesting, brave, compassionate, and a badass! Millie is excellent at action, I believed everything she was going through.Angela Bassett was also great as the stepmother. Other characters were fine, they weren't fleshed out very well, but they weren't the focus, and they still give you enough to know what kind of person they are and what motivates them.The effects were also very good, the dragon and the flames were very realistic. And the scenery was gorgeous! As well as the costumes. Beautifully shot movie. The sets all looked fantastic and realistic, and fit the mood and vibe of the movie perfectly. Very well directed, all the action sequences looked great and had me in suspense.If you loved Ready or Not, this gives very similar vibes. Will definitely be watching again. Loved it!

title: Damsel In Distress...Not
text: "This is the end of your story," (Damsel, 2024.)What a brilliant way to show what wonders can be accomplished when women work together.I 👏🏻 loved 👏🏻 this 👏🏻 film.Such an eloquent, deep meaning, tale that exhibits the right symbology and themes in such a poignant way! This story took on a ton of tropes in big and small ways, and they were woven together so well. Moreover, every moment of this film told a story that fulfills the heroic journey. Beowulf needs to back up because this tale is a much better version - well, at least a modern version. Also, this film could/ should be used in the classroom. In addition, costumes, special effects, directing, acting, and cinematography were all on point.Watch this film! Talk about it, discuss it in reference to women's strength.Because we're - women - are "done being told what to do," (Damsel, 2024.)

title: This is my new favorite dragon movie!
text: I am a sucker for anything dragon related material. Have always been fascinated by them but recently find them lacking in movies. Sure, some movies have dragons here and there but not like this where they are one of the main plot points of the movie. Usually movies made by Netflix disappoint but i decided to give it a try and watch it with my mom. We bought loved it. Movie runtime was perfect, not too long nor too short and was to the point. Not once was i bored or annoyed, instead it was very entertaining. Acting was great and it had gorgeous visuals and scenery. And the dragon was majestic... This is my new favorite dragon movie! 10/10.

title: Great movie, don't watch the trailer !
text: To start off, the set up was perfect, it really draws you in. I didn't watch any trailers or anything for this movie so I had no idea what it was about. But the movie kept me on the edge of my seat. The ending was well rounded. Over all it was an enjoyable watch. To see Milly Bobby Brown go from eleven in stranger things to an action hero in Damsel is quite amazing. She kinda looks like Natalie Portman when she was younger. I think you should all watch this movie and give it a chance, try and not watch the trailers as it adds to the excitement and thrills of the movie unfolding. Have a good day.

title: Ready or Not meets Lord of the Rings
text: An awesome and well crafted movie. Millie Bobby Brown is amazing in this brutal and violent fairy tale. The visuals and CGI are breathtaking. The Story will both thrill and amaze you at every corner. The dragon is great and has a really tragic backstory. The villains are cruel and threatening even though they do not get a lot of screen time. This movie isn't perfect. It has flaws when it comes to predictability and some small plot holes but if you like fantasy movies with mythical creatures and bloody revenge plot lines you will have a fun time. Overall a good Netflix movie that anyone can enjoy.

title: Loved it!
text: I'm not a fan of CGI. I think too often they decide to make spectacular CGI scenes and then decide to write a movie around them. So you get a lot of things blowing up but no plot.
